loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a very talented lady. She started an embroidery business a few years ago to financially support her family. She lives in the city of Multan, which is the fourth largest city in Pakistan known for its history and tombs. She resides in the area called Muhallah Rahimabad, in a 2-room brick house with her family. Her business has given her a good income because in the city of Multan, people like to wear embroidered dresses in their normal routine.  

Her husband is involved in a dairy business and runs a dairy shop in the market. Zubaida has 6 children, but only her eldest daughter is able to get an education due to limited financial resources. Her daughter is studying in 3rd class. 

Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as cloth, beads, colored thread and sketches to make more embroidered dresses for her clients. She is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her business and her business will grow further. Zubaida is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat lives in a city called Multan, which is the fourth largest city of Pakistan. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family, in the area called Muhallah Rahimabad. She has two children. Both of them are very young and have not started to attend school yet. Farhat is a businesswoman who operates a clothes-selling business. She started this business few years ago to financially support her husband. She buys clothes from the wholesale markets of Multan and sells them to her local area clients for good profit.  

Farhat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothing business. She will utilize the loan to purchase clothes of different varieties in bulk quantity. That will make her able to increase her household income by increasing her sales. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is a resident of Multan, which is Pakistan’s fourth largest city and famous for its history and tombs. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area named Rahim abad, which is a small housing colony of the city. 

Surriya is a businesswoman and operates a small boutique at her home. She makes beautiful embroidered clothes and supplies them to different shops and other boutiques. She does this business to financially support her family. She remains conscious about the future of her children. That’s why she works very hard to fulfill their basic needs and to save money for their futures. 

She is married to R. R. D., who is an electrician by profession. He provides electrical repair services to his clients and generates income for the family.  Surriya has 3 sons. Her eldest son works in a private company for meager income. Another son has a mobile shop in the market. He sells different mobile phones and accessories to his customers. Her youngest son is studying in 6th class. 

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as beads, colored thread, clothes and sketches in bulk quantity, which will help her to make more embroidered dresses to serve more clients. She is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her boutique business and she will increase her household income. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that this step will be a profitable one for her business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for her boutique business

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah rakhi lives in Multan, which is a historic city of Pakistan. It is located in Punjab province and is known for its history and handmade products. Allah rakhi lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area named Shamsabad. She has been living there for over 12 years with her family. 

Allah rakhi is a very caring and supportive lady. She supports her family by selling embroidered clothes. The embroidery business is considered very profitable because people of Multan like to wear embroidered clothes all the time. Allah rakhi specializes in handmade embroidery and is well known among her clients due to the quality of her work and timely delivery of dresses. 

She is married to P., who runs a dairy business. He operates his shop in the market where he sells milk and yogurt. Allah rakhi is the mother of 3 sons. All of them are illiterate because they couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial conditions of their parents. 

Allah rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. She will utilize the loan to buy unstitched clothes and embroidery items such as beads, colored thread and sketches to grow her business further. She is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her business, allowing her to serve her clients better and make more income. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Allah rakhi.

loans.use: To buy unstitched clothes and embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Epmcc2 Plus Group

texts.en:
K. is the manager of the group “EPMCC2 Plus” made up of 16 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.
K. is 45 years old.  He is married and has five children between 6 and 20  years of age. Three of his children go to school.
K. is involved in selling general hardware at the market located east of Kinshasa. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $45. K.  has been a micro entrepreneur since 1997. He likes his business and he is working hard to achieve his goal of one day having his own significant working capital. K. is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received three different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to buy four sets of general hardware to resell with the aim of increasing his profits.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of his business’s goods to resell at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
Barnabas married with six children, four of whom are still in school. He is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya and has been practicing mixed farming for over nine years. He produces milk, maize and beans that are sold locally.

One of Barnabas’s challenges is the high cost of artificial insemination. He is requesting a loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes this loan will improve his family’s standard of living since the milk from the cow will be consumed by his family. This will be his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo and he has repaid a previous loan of a similar amount. Within the next five years, Barnabas plans to have five dairy cows and a chuff cutter.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 50 years old, married and the mother of four children between 20 and 10 years old. She has been in mixed farming for 10 years producing and selling her eggs, vegetables and milk to the local market.

Nelly has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. This is her second loan of a similar amount.She believes this loan can enable her to become the main supplier of eggs and chicken to the local market and generate an income that will make the family stable financially. She is planning to be running a poultry farm of 500 chicken in five years.

Poultry diseases are her greatest business threat.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Mbenda

texts.fr:
Madame MBENDA F. est une femme de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL depuis le juin 2002.

Ses activités sont divers: elle fait de la restauration, la vente de céréales et l'embouche ovine.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettre de s'approvisionner en marchandises pour son commerce et son restaurant et acheter des sujets pour l'embouche.

Son objectif est de participer la prise en charge de la famille. Par exemple la nourriture et la santé des enfants
texts.en:
Mrs. Mbenda F. is a 44 year old woman. She is married and the mother of five children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Ndondol since June of 2002.

Her businesses are diverse: she sells food she cooks, she sells grains and raises sheep. This new loan will enable her to buy goods for her business, her restaurant and to purchase what is needed to fatten the sheep. 

Her goal is to take care of her family's needs, such as food and the health of her children.

loans.use: To promote her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is married with one child and is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya. For five years, she has been practicing mixed farming. Evaline produces eggs, tomatoes, and vegetables that are sold locally.

Evaline has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase poultry. This will be her second loan with Juhudi Kilimo. Evaline says her family will have eggs for consumption and will earn income from selling eggs. Her challenges include food shortages and poultry disease. In the future, Evaline is focusing on expanding her poultry farm to one thousand hens to be the major supplier of eggs in her local market.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Madame Seynabou M. est une femme de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL depuis le 25 juin 2002. 

Elle fait du ^petit commerce et ses activités sont diverses. Elle fait la vente de draps de lit, de céréales, d'huile de palme etc. Elle vend soit au comptant soit à crédit.

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin de réaliser plus bénéfices

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Seynabou M. is a 56 year old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Ndondol since the 25th of June, 2002. She has a small business and sells a diverse array of goods. She sells bed sheets, grains, palm oil etc. She sells the goods for either cash, or credit.
With this loan, she intends to grow her supplies in order to make more profits. Her goal is to be able to help her husband take care of their family's needs.

loans.use: To develop her small business

loans.name: Jorge Ruben

texts.es:
El señor  Jorge Ruben J. S. tiene 42 años de edad y vive en una casa de propia vivienda que esta ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Ana de la ciudad de Tarija. Jorge es casado con la señora Marina Janeth Altamirano Sandoval con quien tiene 2 hijos.  Jorge se dedica al servicio de profesor del area rural y en sus horas libres se dedica al transporte libre de pasajeros como taxista ambas actividades las viene desarrollando desde hace mas de 20 años.  El cuenta con extensiones de terreno donde tiene ganado y además siembra papa.

Francisco necesita  comprar semillas de papa para sembrar, de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su esposa e hijos, es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de dichas semillas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                       
Jorge nos cuenta que quiere darle a su esposa e hijos toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para mejorar las condiciones de su casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Ruben J. S. is 42 years old. He lives in a house that he owns in the Santa Ana community in the city of Tarija. Jorge is married to Mrs. Marina Janeth Altamirano. They have 2 children. Jorge works as a rural area teacher. In his off hours he works as an independent taxi driver transporting passengers. He has been carrying out both of these activities for more than 20 years. He owns plots of land where he has cattle and also plants potatoes.

Jorge needs to buy potato seeds for planting. This way he will improve his income to offer a better life for his wife and children. This is why the loan will go towards purchasing these seeds.
                                                                                                                                                                                                       
Jorge tells us that he wants to provide his wife and children with every comfort that he can. For this reason he informs us that the next loan he requests will be for improving the condition of the house where he lives.

loans.use: Purchase of potato seed for planting

loans.name: Pathani Mai Group

texts.en:
Pathani mai lives in Multan, an historic city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. For over 21 years, she has lived with her family in a two-room brick house in an area named Hazuri bagh. She is a widow with two sons and two daughters. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate her elder children and they had to begin to work to support their family. Her younger children are enrolled in school and are in the third and seventh grades. 

Pathani mai is a very active lady. After the death of her husband, she started a clothes-selling business and became the sole wage earner for her family. Now, her eldest children have become wage earners and they help Pathani mai manage the financial expenses of her home. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver and her eldest daughter runs a beauty salon at home.
 
Pathani mai has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her clothing business. Pathani mai buys clothes from the wholesale markets of Multan and sells to local clients for profit. With this loan, she will buy bulk clothes in different varieties to present better products to her clients and increase her sales and income. Pathani mai is hopeful that investing in her business will help increase her profit. 

This is Pathani mai’s first loan application to Asasah. In the photo, she is holding a book called the Asasah Passbook

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal de “Las Vencedoras” están iniciando su segundo ciclo en el centro focal de Panamericana. Esta banca comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho integrantes.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Valeria, como tesorera Natividad y como secretaria de actas a la señora Silvia. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos:  tejedoras, elaboración y venta de chompas, tienda de consumo, macramé en mantas, tejido de chompas, venta de tejidos y tejidos a máquina.

La señora Valeria, presidenta de la banca comunal “Las Vencedoras” es una mujer joven, convive con su pareja y tiene cinco hijos.  Con respecto a su negocio  ella  teje mantas desde hace 10 años, compra “cortes”, es decir trozos rectangulares de tejidos, ella teje el borde y hace el macramé y la flecadura, y transforma el “corte” en una manta.  La señora Valeria vende su producción en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto.
Lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es la oportunidad de contar con la atención en salud, indica que ha sido bien atendida, siempre trae a sus hijos  al consultorio.
Cuando se reunen las señoras algunas veces vienen sus hijas, en este casos una de ellas aparece cerca a la puerta con su bebé cargado a la espalda.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Vencedoras” (The Winners) is starting its second loan cycle as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group has eight members. Its Board of Directors for this loan cycle consists of Sra. Valería as president, Sra. Natividad as treasurer, and Sra. Silvia as the secretary of records. These ladies engage in different business such as weaving, making and selling sweaters, operating a food store, making macramé blankets, and selling articles woven by hand or with the help of a loom.

Sra. Valeria, the president of the Communal Bank “Las Vencedoras”, is a young woman who lives with her partner and their five children. She has been in the business of weaving blankets for ten years. Valeria buys “cortes”, which are rectangular pieces of woven fabric. She weaves the borders and adds the fringes using macramé, thereby transforming the “corte” into a blanket. Sra. Valeria sells her products at the fairs in the City of El Alto. What she likes most about Pro Mujer is having the opportunity to receive health care. She says she has always been well-cared for and always brings her children to the clinic.

When the ladies conduct their meetings, they sometimes bring their daughters. In this instance, one of the ladies in the photo is standing near the door holding her baby.

loans.use: Purchase materials used in weaving blankets

loans.name: Shahida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Shahida Perveen is a resident of Multan, which is an historic city in Pakistan known for its history and sweetmeat. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for over 18 years. She is a very supportive wife and a caring mother. She is raising her children with great care. She is married to M. A. and has given birth to three children. Her elder son works in a motor workshop as a motor mechanic and her other two children are enrolled in school and getting their education. 

Her husband works as a janitor at a company for a meager income and she supports her family financially by operating a selling clothes business. She is also an embroidery expert who creates beautiful handmade embroidery designs on clothes and sells to the clothing shops at a good profit. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will buy a larger quantity of clothes from the wholesale markets and increase her sales. She is very confident that an investment will definitely help her business grow further and she will be able to provide better facilities of life to her family. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a long term relationship.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran lives in a city named Multan in Pakistan. She resides in an area named Hazori Bagh with her family in a two-room brick house. She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She is also a very caring mother who is raising her children very well. She is married to A. D. and has given birth to four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son operates a business selling vegetables. He has a small shop in the market from where he sells seasonal vegetables to the buyers. The next two children are tailors by profession. They sew men's clothes, specifically. Her remaining children are enrolled in school and are getting their education. 

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her elder son’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell through his shop. Manzooran is hopeful that an investment will make positive changes to her son’s business and his income will increase as a result. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr:
Madame MAREME D. est une femme de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL depuis le 25 juin 2002. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de niébé et de mil. Elle fait aussi de l'embouche bovine.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de poursuivre convenablement ses activités.

Son objectif est de pouvoir faire face aux besoins financier de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mareme D. is a 37 year old woman. She is married and the mother of four children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Ndondol since the 25th of June, 2002. 

She has a small business selling black-eyed peas (aka "cowpea") and millet. She also raises cattle. This new loan will permit her to properly continue her business. Her goal is to be able to handle the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: To promote her income generating business

loans.name: Jane Mweni

texts.en:
Jane Mueni, age 36, runs a retail shop at Mlolongo, which is a busy market. She sells her goods to the residents and customers on transit from Machakos town to Nairobi city. She is a single mother of three children, Annastacia aged 17 years in form 1, Stephen aged 15 years in class seven and Dominic aged 12 years in class six. She was introduced to KADET by another KADET client.

Jane has been running this business for a period of two years and gets a monthly profit of Kshs 2500. This loan of Kshs 20,000 is her second loan with KADET after serving the previous loan well. She intends to use Kshs 10,000 to buy sugar, Kshs 5,000 to buy rice and Kshs 5,000 will be used to buy other small goods like matchboxes e.t.c. If the loan boosts the business, Jane will start selling ballast and sand for a higher profit.

Jane, who describes herself as hardworking and focused, dreams of having a wholesale business and selling ballast and sand to building people.

loans.use: To increase her stock of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina lives in Multan, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is famous for its sweetmeats and shrines. She lives there in a two-room brick house in the area named Hazoori bagh. She moved here after her marriage many years ago. 

Basically, she is a housewife but to support her family financially she also operates a clothes-selling business. She is a very energetic and loyal lady who is always ready to help and support her family in every possible way. Her earnings help her husband in managing the financial expenses in a better way.
  
She has given birth to three sons. Unfortunately, all of them are illiterate and do businesses. Her elder son is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his customers and earns income. Her second son provides loading services on his donkey cart and her youngest son is a tailor who operates a tailoring shop in the market. 

Her husband is a cobbler by profession and makes shoes on order. The specialty of his work is he makes embroidery on shoes that are very famous in the neighboring areas. He also supplies his shoes to different shoe shops and generates good income for the family.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the growth of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy required items, such as beads, thread, leather and nails, in bulk quantities that will enable him to make more embroidered shoes to fulfill orders and to make more money. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with the book called the Asasah Passbook is Samina.

loans.use: To buy required items for a shoe-making business

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Panamericana Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “27 de Mayo Panamericana” es uno de los grupos más antiguos del Centro focal de Panamericana, cuenta con 24 ciclos, es decir doce años.  Las señoras fundadoras están llenas recuerdos, han  podido observar el crecimiento de la institución y de su grupo, durante este tiempo algunas han descansado y luego han regresado nuevamente. Esta banca comunal cuenta con la participación de diez integrantes.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Loida, como tesorera a la señora Simona y como secretaria de actas a la señora Giovanna. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de carne, atención de tienda de consumo, artesanía en yeso, venta de haba, venta de golosinas, venta de artesanías.  

La señora Loida, presidenta de la banca comunal “27 de Mayo Panamericana” es una de las  fundadoras  del grupo.  Actualmente está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  Con respecto a su negocio  ella  tiene un puesto de venta en la Fería 16 de Julio, la feria más grande de la Ciudad de El Alto.  En este puesta vende refrescos, galletas, dulces y similares.  La feria se desarrolla los días jueves y domingo, días en los que recibe la ayuda de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “27 de Mayo Panamericana” communal bank is one of the oldest groups of the ProMujer regional hub of Panamericana. They have completed 24 loan cycles over 12 years. The founding members have many memories of the growth of the institution and of their group. They have watched some of the members retire for a while and then return. 

Now, the communal bank has ten members. The board of directors for this loan cycle has Loida as president, Simona as treasurer, and Giovanna as secretary. The members have various businesses, including food sales, clothing sales, produce sales, meat sales, general store, plaster handicrafts, bean sales, cookie sales, and handicraft sales.

Loida, president of the communal bank, is one of the founders of the group. She is married and has four children. She has a stall at the “Feria 16 de Julio,” the largest market in the city of El Alto. She sells soft drinks, cookies, candy, etc. The market is open on Thursdays and Sundays and Loida receives help from her children.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for market stall - soft drinks, cookies, candy, etc

loans.name: Callen Bonareri

texts.en: Callen Bonareri, age 35, runs a retail shop in Kahawa West estate. She is married to James Nguge who works with the Kenya Power and Lighting Company. Together they have four children: Peter, age seven; Joyce, age five; Moraa, age three; and David, age four months. Callen was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Thika Road office. She has been running her business for three years and her monthly profit is 17,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). This loan of 60,000 KES is her second loan with KADET after repaying a first loan successfully. She intends to use the whole amount to increase her stock of cereals like beans and rice, flour and bar soap for sale. If the loan boosts the business, Callen will introduce a paraffin business in her shop. Her dream for the future is to expand the shop into wholesale of household goods and foodstuffs.

loans.use: To increase stock of flour, sugar, rice and other cereals

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida lives in Multan, which is the fourth largest city in Pakistan, known for its sweetmeats and shrines. She lives in the area of Hazuribagh, which is a small residential area of the city. She has been living there for the past 10 years. Her husband’s name is M. S., and he is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services for passengers and earns income for the family. Zahida has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works in a motor workshop as a motor mechanic, while her daughter does a bank job. Her youngest son is studying in 5th class. 

To support her family financially, Zahida operates a little boutique at home where she displays her stitched and embroidered clothes. She is a very active business woman who has a good number of business contacts. Due to her kind behavior and good business sense, she attracts a good number of clients every month and improves her sales. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her boutique business. She will use the loan to purchase unstitched clothes and embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and sketches to make more dresses of good designs to sell. She is confident that this investment will bring positive changes to her business and her income will further increase. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Zahida.

loans.use: To buy material for a boutique business

loans.name: Gerivasio

texts.en: Gerivasio is a forty one year old enterprising man, married to a farmer with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a semi permanent house and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of the family. He has a great desire  to educate his children. Within five years of beginning farming he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Gerivasio needs a loan  to buy seedlings for planting this season.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame KHADY T. est une femme de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL depuis le 25 février 2005

Elle fait un commerce de céréales, de bissap, d'arachides, de niébé et de mil.

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'augmenter ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale tout en renforçant ses épargnes
texts.en:
Ms Khady T., aged 32, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Ndondol since February 25, 2005.

Her activity consists in selling cereals, roselle, groundnuts, black-eyed peas and millet. Her loan will enable her to increase her inventory and her profit.

Her aim is to help with household expenses, while saving some money.

loans.use: To finance her cereals business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a forty seven year old hardworking man.  He is married with five children  and lives in  his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has a desire to educate his children to attain bachelors degrees. For ten years he has been farming and with this business he has been able to buy land.  However he is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations of his produce which limits his profits. Richard needs the loan to buy spraying chemicals for his tea plantation.

loans.use: To buy chemicals to spray his tea plantation.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen lives in Multan which is an historic city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its sweetmeats and shrines. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the Chowk Shaheedan area. She moved there five years ago after her marriage. Her husband’s name is N.. He is a rickshaw driver, providing transport services to passengers by taking them to their destinations and earning income. Noreen supports her family by selling clothes. She purchases clothes from the wholesale market in Multan and sells to local clients. Her income allows her to pay the utilities expenses. Noreen has given birth to two daughters and a son. All of them are very young and not yet started attending school.

Noreen has applied loan for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband because he wants to repair his rickshaw which is giving trouble and not working well. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and is hoping that an investment will bring good profits. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Noreen.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw to continue a driving business

loans.name: The Shameem Muhamad Nasir Group

texts.en:
Shameem lives in Multan, the fourth largest city in Pakistan and a city that is famous for its shrines and sweetmeat. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in an area named Chowk shaheedan. Shameem came to this area after her marriage with M. N. 12 years ago. 

Shameem’s husband operates a spare parts business and sells parts for different vehicles. His shop is located in the market and he earns a regular monthly income. Shameem supports her family by doing embroidery. She is very good at this art and, since her work is of such good quality, she receives regular orders. She is also a housewife and has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Two of her children are enrolled in school to get an education, while the third one is free and doesn’t do anything. 

Shameen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. She is a new Asasah client and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. With the loan, her husband will buy custom spare parts to meet customer demand and increase his sales. He has been doing this business for many years and has a good customer base. Customers approach him because he is a good dealer who sells genuine parts for very reasonable prices.

loans.use: to buy spare vehicle parts

loans.name: The Musarat Hussain Buksh Group

texts.en:
Musarat lives in Multan, which is a famous city in Pakistan known for its history and culture. For the past 16 years, she has lived in an area named Chowk shaheedan, where she lives with her family in a two-room home made of bricks. Musarat is a working woman who operates a boutique business at her home. She offers a variety of stitched clothes to her boutique clients and, due to the quality of her work, people prefer her business to shopping at the markets. 

Musarat is married to H. B. and has six sons. The oldest three are working and the younger three stay at home. Musarat cannot provide them an education due to her limited financial resources. She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business. She is a new Asasah client and this is her first application. Musarat will use the loan to purchase different varieties of cloth to prepare according to the latest trends to improve her sales. Musarat is hopeful that this investment will result in positive changes to her business and increase her monthly income. She wants to help her family achieve a better standard of life.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, 30, is a hard-working woman. She is married to a social worker and has two children. They live in a rented house in Kamwenge, Uganda and long to own a residential house. She owns a mini supermarket which she has been operating for three years and is reaping commendable profits. She started with one million but now has three million in capital. Her dream is to have the biggest supermarket in town. Agnes needs a loan to buy salt, milk and sugar for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing  salt, milk and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Victor Manuel G. M., tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el Barrio Santa Rosa, es casado y su esposa realiza las tareas del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, que actualmente se dedican a los esrtudios, el labora con Guarda de Seguridad, la familia batalla con una enfermedad cornica de uno de sus hijos, es por el pequeño que solicitan un prestamo para la remodelacion del porche de su hogar, debido a que el pequeño es aca donde tiene sus tiempos de exparcimiento, ellos esperan les apoyen economicamente para darles a sus dos hijos mejores condiciones socio economicas para su diario vivir.
texts.en: Victor Manuel G. M. is 44 years old and lives in Santa Rosa neighborhood.  He is married and his wife is a housewife.  They have 2 dependent children who are studying.  Victor Manuel works as a security guard.  His family is battling a chronic disease which one of his children is suffering from.  The loan is for the little one.  They would like to redesign their house porch because this is where their little one spends their relaxation time.  They hope to receive receive financial support so that they can provide their two children with better socio-economic conditions in their daily lives.

loans.use: To redesign his house porch

loans.name: Benjamin Mwanzia

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 36 year-old businessman who runs a general store at Umoja innercore Estate, which is a highly populated estate. He is married to Annastaia Ngina, who is 26 years old, and they have a two-year-old daughter. 

Benjamin has been running his general store for four years and his monthly income is 24,500 KES. He was introduced to KADET by another client and is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy 25 bags of flour (each bag costs 2,000 KES). This is his first loan with KADET, and if his business improves, Benjamin will help the needy such as orphans and helping develop nearby schools. 

Benjamin describes himself as a hardworking person who dreams of lifting the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Semintei Ole

texts.en: Semintei has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last 11 years. He is 49 years old, married to Mutenkei Ene Semintei and they have two children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He wants to diversify his sources of income, so he plans to use the loan to buy 15 goats and 10 sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit. In the future, Semintei hopes to extend his retail shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy 15 goats and 10 sheep

loans.name: Jenaro

texts.en: Jenaro N., age 29, operates a motorcycle transport business, popularly known as bodaboda business in Kenya. He has a hand cart for goods and a motorbike to transport people from one place to another. He operates from Kahawa West, a highly populated area. Jenaro was working as a houseboy before he started his transport business, buying his first bicycle with the savings from his houseboy job. He saved more until he could afford to buy a motorcycle. He is married to Beatrice Muthoni, who is a dairy farmer, and together they have three children named M., Wambui and Jimfred, ages seven, four and two years old respectively. The transport business has been in operation for three years and Jenaro's monthly income is 7,100 Kenyan shillings (KES). Jenaro was introduced to KADET by existing clients. This is his first loan. With this loan he intends to finish paying for his motorbike which has a balance of 15,000 KES and use the remaining balance of 5,000 KES to buy animal feed to increase milk production in his wife’s farming business. Jenaro hopes to own a taxi and eventually build a home. He did not go beyond primary school in his education and he wants to provide quality education for his children.

loans.use: To finish motorbike payments and buy animal feed

loans.name: Grace Cherop

texts.en:
Grace Cherop K. is 28 years old and married to Daniel Misoi, who is a businessman earning additional income for the family. They have one school-going child of three years and they live in Cheplasgei Eldoret, Kenya. Grace has been operating a general shop for three years and earns a monthly profit of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Grace learned about KADET through a credit officer and is applying for her third loan of 37,000 KES from KADET. She intends to buy three boxes of cooking oil, four bags of sugar, five crates of soda and other stock that needs to be added. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand the shop business. In the future, Grace wishes to have a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy three boxes of cooking oil, four bags of sugar and five crates of soda

loans.name: M'rinyiru

texts.en:
M'rinyiru has been selling clothes in Naivasha town since 2008. He also repairs bicycles on the side to increase his income. He is 51 years old and taking care of his two children alone since his wife passed on. 

M'rinyiru was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to equip the bicycle repair business by buying a new tool kit with the loan amount. He hopes to give his children a good education and be able to provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle repair tool kit

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is a hardworking lady, age 30, married with three children ages 10, 5 and 2 years old. She has been selling secondhand shoes for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

Mary learned about KADET through a marketing awareness campaign and she is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET, which she intends to use to purchase more shoes to sell during the festive season. She has no history with any other MFI and she believes that, with this loan, her business will pick up well. Mary hopes to grow her business and become the leading local investor in Eldoret, Kenya. She wants to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes

loans.name: Yolanda Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Yolanda Q. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María y vive en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se encuentra al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo de clima frió, tiene como atractivos turísticos la laguna de Cochapamba la que se encuentra llena de Totora, la colina de Tasqui la que tiene una hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca y de la parroquia. Su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
Nuestra socia  tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 16, 12 y 1 año de edad, su primera hija  estudia en la universidad y sus dos hijos en el colegio. Su esposo es de profesión arquitecto. Gracias al sacrificio y esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal han llegado a construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Yolanda labora en la tienda que tiene hace 15 años, trabaja en ella de lunes a sábados desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche, debido a que en la mañana se dedica al arreglo de su hogar, también se dedica a la cría de animales que son para su consumo.

Se encuentra como socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y le gusta ya que comparte con sus amigas momentos de alegría, el nuevo crédito que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda. Su meta es acabar su casa ya que aun le falta realizar algunos arreglos.
texts.en:
Señora Yolanda Q. is a member of the Corazón de María Community Bank. She lives in the parish of Valle which is located south-east of Cusco. The climate there is cool. Local tourist attractions include Cochapamba Lake with its plentiful bullrushes and the Tasqui hill with its beautiful view of Cuenca and the parish. The local people are farmers and raise livestock.

Yolanda is 43 years old, married, and has four children aged 22, 16, 12, and 1. Her eldest daughter is a university student, and her two sons attend high school. Her husband is an architect. Through hard work and a lot of effort the couple has managed to build their own home.
 
Doña Yolanda has run a store for the last fifteen years where she works Mondays through Saturdays from 2 pm to 8 pm. In the mornings she looks after household chores. She also raises animals for the family to eat.

Yolanda has been a member of the community bank for three years and enjoys having fun with her friends there. This new loan will be used to buy stock for her store. Her goal is to finish the house which still needs a few more repairs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Martha Verónica

texts.es:
La Señora Martha S. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María y vive en la comunidad de San Juan Loma que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se encuentra al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo de clima frió, tiene como atractivos turísticos la laguna de Cochapamba la que se encuentra llena de Totora, la colina de Tasqui la que tiene una hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca y de la parroquia. Su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

La Señora. Martha se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa pero solo los fines de semana, esta actividad la desempeña hace 4 años, el resto de su tiempo se dedica a trabajar desde su casa en el arreglo de toda prenda de vestir, actividad que aprendió sola.

Doña Martha tiene 29 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 6 años de edad,  todos estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora como carpintero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros compartiendo gastos.
 
Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y se siente muy bien de pertenecer al banco comunal ya que cuenta con muy buenas amigas. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su negocio para la temporada navideña. Su meta es  tener un  local propio.
texts.en:
Martha S. is a member of the 'Corazón de María' (Heart of Mary) community bank.  She lives in San Juan Loma community, in El Valle parish.  This parish is in the south-west of the city of Cuenca.  It is an area with a cold climate which has as its tourist attractions the Cochapamba lagoon which is filled with bulrushes and Tasqui Hill which has a beautiful view of the city of Cuenca and its parish.  The people here work in farming and raising livestock.

Martha sells all kinds of clothes but only on weekends.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  The rest of the time she works from home mending garments, an activity which she taught herself.

Martha is 29 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and three children aged 11, 9 and 6.  All her children are in school.  Her husband works as a carpenter.  They don't have their own home but live in her in-laws' house, sharing expenses.

Martha has been a member of her community bank for 3 years and she feels very happy to belong to her bank as she has some very good friends there.  She will invest her loan in buying more clothes to stock her business for the Christmas period.  Her goal is to have her own premises.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Blanca Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca B. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María y vive en la comunidad de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico, su gastronomía y la calidez de su gente.
 
Doña Blanca tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 27, 23 y 18 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar y su ultima hija es soltera y ayuda en la casa. Su esposo tiene una cooperativa de taxis y labora en su vehiculo propio, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Blanca se dedica al comercio, vende todo tipo de ropa, labora 5 días a la semana y 3 de ellos viaja a la costa a vender su mercadería, los dos días restantes vende en un mercado de la ciudad en donde tiene un puesto propio, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo.

Es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una sobrina a formar parte del grupo. El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su negocio para la temporada de navidad. Su meta es  ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca B. is a member of the 'Corazón de María' (Heart of Mary) community bank and lives in Yanaturo community, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is renowned for the beauty of its streets, its historic center, its food and the warmth of its people.

Blanca is 45 years old.  She is married and has 3 children aged 27, 23 and 18.  Her eldest son is married and lives independently, her second son works and helps towards the household finances.  Her youngest, a daughter, is single and helps in the house.  Her husband has a taxi cooperative and works in his own vehicle.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

Blanca is a saleswoman.  She sells all kinds of clothes.  She works 5 days a week.  On 3 of these days she travels to the coast to sell her merchandise.  The remaining 2 days she sells her clothes in a market in the city where she has her own stall.  She does not have fixed working hours.

This is the second loan that Blanca has had with her community bank.  She was invited to join the group by one of her nieces.  The money from her new loan will be invested in buying more clothes to stock her business for the Christmas period.  Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Rebeca Josefina

texts.es:
La Señora Rebeca L. es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en la comunidad El Amarillo en la parroquia de Cumbe. La parroquia de San Luís de Cumbe se encuentra situada al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, su artesanía se basa en tejidos, bordados e hilado de lana de oveja confeccionando la vestimenta de la región, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Nuestra socia tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos 14 y 12 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción ya que es albañil, gracias a la comprensión, trabajo y esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos, en su casa aprovecha para dedicarse a la cría de ganado, vende la leche a los carros lecheros que circulan por el sector.

Se encuentra en su treceavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal,  le gusta  por se encuentra con sus amigas con quienes conversa y se ríe saliendo de su rutina diaria. El nuevo crédito que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca. Su sueño es ya no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Rebeca L. is a member of the “Nuevas Amigas” (New Friends) community bank.  She lives in El Amarillo community, in Cumbe parish.  San Luís de Cumbe parish is in the south-east of the city of Cuenca.  The region's handicrafts are based on weavings, embroideries and sheep's wool yarn.  These are used to make the region's traditional clothing.  The people work in farming and raising livestock.

Rebeca is 35 years old.  She is married and has 2 children aged 14 and 12 who are both at school in the city.  Her husband works is a construction worker.  Thanks to their joint understanding, work and effort, they have managed to build their own home.

Rebecca does her housework and looks after her children.  She also raises cattle and sells their milk to the milk trucks which come to the district.

This is Rebeca's thirteenth loan through her community bank.  She likes her community bank because she meets up with her friends, chats to them and has a laugh, leaving her daily routine at the door.  This new loan will be invested in buying a cow.  Her dream is to have no debt.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su hijo de 19 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, vende tamales y confecciona ropa, por las mañanas está dedicada a la costura y por las tardes a preparar tamales para la venta.
Ella solicita un préstamo para cubrir los gastos de graduación de su hijo pues está terminando sus estudios de bachiller, lo demás lo invertirá en materiales para preparar los tamales como maíz, pollo y condimentos.
Su sueño es crecer con sus ventas y lograr estabilidad para poder seguir apoyando a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old.  She lives with her 19-year-old son.  She is a single mother living in San Miguel in the district of San Miguel.  She sells tamales and handmade clothing.  She spends her mornings sewing and her afternoons preparing tamales to sell.  She is requesting a loan to cover her son’s school fees.  He is finishing high school.  In addition, she will invest in ingredients for her tamales like corn, chicken, and condiments. 

Her dream is to increase her sales and achieve some stability so that she can continue providing for her son.

loans.use: To purchase corn, chicken, and condiments and pay school fees.

loans.name: Verónica Adriana

texts.es:
La Señorita Verónica C. es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su cultura y tradición, también cuenta con varios lugares turísticos  los que se pueden visitar.
 
La Señorita. Verónica tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres la que es propia, ayuda económicamente en su casa, su papá es de profesión mecánico automotriz y tiene su propio taller y su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos.

La Señorita. Verónica tiene un almacén en donde se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y accesorios de vehículos, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años y labora desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, de lunes a sábados.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 3 años y los créditos le han beneficiado en el incremento de mercadería para su almacén, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más lubricantes para su negocio. Su mayor sueño es  no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Verónica C. is a member of the 'Nuevas Amigas' (New Friends) community bank.  She lives in Totoracocha district, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is noted for the architectural beauty of its historic center, its culture and its tradition.  It also has several tourist sites for people to visit.

Verónica is 27 years old.  She is single and lives in her parents' home which they own.  She helps her household financially.  Her father is a car mechanic and has his own workshop.  Her mother is a housewife.

Verónica has a store where she sells lubricants and vehicle accessories.  She has been in this business for 5 years and works from 8.00am to 7.00pm, from Monday to Saturday.

Verónica has been a member of her community bank for 3 years and the loans have helped her to increase the merchandise for her store.  Her loan will be invested in buying more lubricants for her business.  Her biggest dream is to not have any debt.

loans.use: To buy lubricants

loans.name: Belizario

texts.es:
Belizario tiene 20 años de edad y convive junto con su novia. Ambos residen el una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Reque, un distrito bastante comercial situado a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un grupo de animales menores los cuales cría en algunos corrales ubicados cerca a la vivienda donde actualmente reside. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre suelen visitar la localidad en donde vive. Adicionalmente trabaja como chofer de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual brinda servicio de transporte en su localidad.

Belizario ha estado ahorrando dinero para poder adquirir una mototaxi nueva, ya que la que actualmente maneja no es suya, el desea completar la suma que necesita para lograr su objetivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Belizario is 20 years old and lives together with his girlfriend.  They both live in a marginal urban area of Reque district, a commercial district located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Belizario has a group of young animals which he raises in some pens near his house.  When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who are always visiting the town in which he lives.

Belizario also works as the driver of a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorbike with a carriage behind it which is used to transport cargo and passengers)..  He uses his vehicle to offer transport services in his town.

Belizario has been saving money to buy a new mototaxi' since the one he is currently using doesn't belong to him.  He would like to complete the sum of money that he needs to achieve his goal.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy a new 'mototaxi'

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito pesquero D. San José, un pueblo situado cerca al mar que pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y que se encuentra situado a más D. veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Por más D. quince años ha trabajado vendiendo pescado fresco y salado en el mercado del distrito D. Mórrope (otro distrito D. la provincia D. Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora D. la zona en donD. resiD.). Ella adquiere su mercadería diariamente en el terminal pesquero D. la región y luego se dirige a su puesto D. trabajo a ofrecerla en venta. El negocio es una fuente importante D. ingreso y con el ayuda a su esposo a mantener la economía diaria D. su familia.

María Esther desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más pescado D. modo que sus ventas puedan aumentar y por enD., también sus ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Esther is 45 years old.  She is married and lives together with her family in the fishing district of San José, a town near the sea which is in Lambayeque province, more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 15 years, María Esther has been selling fresh and salted fish in the market of Mórrope district (another district in Lambayeque province which is one hour from the area in which she lives).  She acquires her merchandise daily in the region's fishing terminal.  She then heads to her work place to offer them for sale.  Her business is an important source of income and it helps her to support her husband with the family's daily finances.

María Esther would like to expand her business by acquiring more fish so that her sales can increase and, consequently, her profits as well.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy fish to expand her sales business in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a machine to cut soapstone.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es una madre de familia de 56 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una zona marginal del distrito de Reque, una localidad bastante comercial que se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con animales  menores como cuyes, conejos, pavos, gallinas y ovejas, los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar su  localidad con frecuencia. El negocio le ayuda a mantener la economía de su familia por lo que siempre se esfuerza para sacarlo adelante.

Adelaida desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda ya que esta se encuentra en mal estado y su estructura se dañaría aún mas debido a las lluvias que se presentan en la estación de verano. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a mother, 56 years old, lives with her husband and children in a poor area in the Reque district. The area is commercialized and located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She counts on small animals such as guinea pigs, rabbits, turkeys, chickens, and sheep which she raises in her small backyard. When they mature she sells the to the public and other sellers who visit her frequently. Her business allows her to financially help her family as she always makes an effort to improve their standard of living.

Adelaida would like to make some improvements to her home since it is in bad condition and the foundation would get worse due to rain damage that come during the summers. To do this she requested from Edpyme Alternative a 1000 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To make some improvements to her home.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el sector Fundo El Gañán del caserío Punto Nueve, una localidad agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Lambayeque, a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con animales  menores como pavos, gallinas, cerdos y ovejas, los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar su  localidad con frecuencia. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar como jornalero.

Santos siempre se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelante a su familia. Por ello trata de desarrollar sus actividades económicas de la mejor manera posible. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta con la compra de animales menores y alimento balanceado, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante la presente temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda aumenta. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar  Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santos is 40 years old, married, and lives with his family in the Fundo El Gañánarea of the Punto Nuevo country house, an agricultural place located on the Lambayeque district, half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He farms small animals such as turkeys, chickens, pigs, and sheep in his backyard. Once they mature he sells them to the public and other sellers who come frequently. He is also a day laborer.

Santos always works his hardest to help out his family. To do so he does his best in his economic work. At the moment he wants to expand his farming business with more small animals and a balanced feed. He wants to increase his sales during the Christmas season when demand increases. To achieve this he found it convenient to request Edpyme Alternative a 1000 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To buy small animals and a balanced feed to expand his farming business and increase his sales during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 30 años, es casada y reside junto a su familia en la localidad de Sialupe Baca, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque que se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de chicha de jora, la chicha es una bebida tradicional de varias zonas del país cuya preparación se viene realizando desde tiempos ancestrales, consiste en una bebida fermentada en vasijas de barro cocido, hecha a base de una harina de maíz especial denominada jora. Esta bebida es bastante consumida en actividades sociales, además los pobladores de la zona la consumen a diario ya que creen que les brinda fuerzas para salir a trabajar.

Carmen prepara la chicha en su casa y la ofrece en venta a los vecinos de su localidad. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo de la mejor forma posible. Actualmente ella desea adquirir más insumos como harina y leña para ampliar su producción, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old, married, and lives with her family in Sialupe Baca, a rural area of the Lambayeque district located more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She makes and sells chicha of jora which is a traditional drink that in various areas has been prepared since ancestral times. It consists of a drink fermented in baked clay pots. The main ingredient is a special cornflour called jora. This beverage is drunk a lot at social activities. In addition the people of the area drink it daily since they believe it offers them strength to continue working.

Carmen prepares the chicha in her home and sells it to neighbors in her area. The business is an important means of income to her family which is why she always does her best. At the moment she wants to acquire more materials such as corn flour and fire wood to increase her production, which is why she is requesting from Edpyme Alternative a 500 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To buy more materials such as corn flour and fire wood to increase her production.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Punto Nueve del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de pobladores humildes que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración de venta de comida. Ella prepara alimentos en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona, adicionalmente vende cerveza y chicha los fines de semana. El negocio es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de el se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economia diaria.

Marleny desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para elaborar más platos de comida ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Marleny is 24 years old, single, and lives with her family in the Point Nine contry house of the Lambayeque district, an area of humble inhabitants who are mainly agricultural workers, and is located more than half an hour from the Chiclayo city.

She sells food. She prepares meals in her home and sells them to neighbors and people working in her area. She also sells beer and chicha (a local cornflour fermented drink) on weekends. The business helps her family a lot since it helps with financial maintenance.

Marleny wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more materials to make more food since the demand for her service has increased. This is why she requested from Edpyme Alternative a 1000 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make more food expand her business.

loans.name: Cesar Alejandro

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona conocida a nivel nacional por sus fiestas religiosas que congregan a miles de personas anualmente.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar maíz y otros cultivos, el ya tiene más de doce años de experienncia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la econnomía diaria de su familia.

Cesar desea brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación de maíz, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Cesar is a father, 57 years old, and lives with his family in the Moyupe district, an area known for its religious celebrations where thousands of people congregate annually.

He grows corn and other things. He has been doing so more than two years and throughout has learned a great deal about farming. The income he makes is used to pay for daily expenditures the family has.

Cesar wants to maintain his crop land to install a new corn crop. To do this he requested Edpyme Alternative a 700 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To maintain his crop land to install a new corn crop.

loans.name: Manuel Gonzalo

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en la localidad de Calera San Rosa, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura y que pertenece al distrito de Olmos, el lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga en una moto carguera, el suele brindar su servicio en los caseríos de la zona transportando mercadería, frutas y animales menores. El distrito de Olmos se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en áreas rurales que distan mucho entre sí, sus pobladores son en gran parte agricultores y comerciantes de animales, los cuales utilizan al pueblo central para comercializar sus productos, por ello actividades como las de Manuel tienen bastante acogida y son bastante rentables.

El vehículo de Manuel ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para seguir garantizando su correcto funcionamiento, por ello el se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles con los cuales planea reparar y brindar mantenimiento a su vehículo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 28 years old, single, and lives with his family in Calera San Rosa, a rural area that engages mainly in agricultural labor, and belongs to the Olmos district located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo city.

For a living he transports cargo on a motorcycle. He serves country homes in the area transporting merchandise, fruits, and small animals. The Olmos district is known for having the highest concentration of people in rural areas. For the most part the people are agricultural workers and animal sellers who sell in the central town. That is why jobs like Manuel’s are welcomed and are very profitable.

Manuel’s vehicle has been breaking down and needs urgently to be repaired. That is why he has requested from Edpyme Alternative a 800 Peruvian Soles loan and plans on repairing and maintaining his motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Kelly Merly

texts.es:
Kelly tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y cincuenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega situada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace cinco años y durante este tiempo se ha hecho bastante conocida entre los vecinos de la zona, los que siempre acuden a su negocio porqye prefieren la calidad de productos y el buen trato que ofrece.

Kelly desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio, en especial durante la temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los que espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Kelly is32 years old, single, and lives with her family in the Olmos District, an area with much commercialized movement and is located an hour and 50 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small store in her home where she sells groceries. She has been selling for more than 5 years and now she is well known by the neighbors in her area that prefer to go to her store since she offers quality products and good service.

Kelly wishes to supply her store some more especially during the Christmas season when demand tends to increase. This is why she has requested from Edpyme Alternative a 1500 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to supply and expand her store.

loans.name: Lady Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lady es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda, allí suele ofrecer a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, el negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por parte de los clientes de la zona, los cuales lo prefieren debido a la buena calidad de productos y a la excelente atención que brinda.

Lady desea ampliar su bodega con la compra de más productos ya que durante la temporada navideña la demanda aumenta, por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Lady es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía diaria.
texts.en: Lady is a 30 year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children in a rural zone of the Tambogrande locality. It is an agricultural district in the Piura region, located more than four hours from Chiclayo, capital city of the Lambayeque region. Lady has a bodega [small grocery store] set up in her home, where she offers her customers all types of products for daily use, such as staple items and groceries. Her business is very well received by her customers in the area, who prefer her store thanks to the good quality of her products and the excellent service she offers. Lady would like to expand her bodega by purchasing more products, since demand increases during the Christmas season. For this reason, she decided to request a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Lady is quite a responsible woman and very devoted to her family. She will use the income she earns from this endeavor to help her husband, a farmer, to keep up with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy products to expand her business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con ovejas y aves de corral, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo producto de una herencia en donde suele sembrar mango y limón. Su esposa se dedica a trabajar preparando y vendiendo comida. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Juan desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante esta temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old, is married and lives with his wife and their four children in a rural area of Tambogrande, a farming district in the Piura region, which is located more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.

He has sheep and poultry which he raises in enclosures at home.  When the animals have reached a good size, he offers them for sale to the general public and to businessmen who visit the area regularly.  Juan also has a field which he inherited and where he grows mangoes and lemons.  His wife works preparing and selling food.  With their combined income, they try to make ends meet for their family.

Juan wants to expand his business by buying more animals and balanced feed so he can increase his sales during this Christmas season, which is when demand for his animals increases.  For this reason he thought it was a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 new soles.

loans.use: Purchase animals to expand business growing and selling animals

loans.name: Juan María

texts.es:
Juan tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con un buen número de ovejas, cerdos y pavos, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar mango y limón. Con los ingresos que el percibe de estas actividades se encarga de solventar la economía de su familia.

Juan desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante esta temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old, is married and lives with his wife and their four children in a rural area of Tambogrande, a farming district in Piura region, which is more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.

He has a number of sheep, pigs and turkeys which he raises in enclosures at home.  When they have reached a good size, he offers them for sale to the general public and to the businessmen who visit the area regularly.  Juan also has a field where he grows mangoes and lemons.  With his income from these activities, he takes it on himself to support his family.

Juan wants to expand his business by buying more animals and balanced feed so he can increase his sales during this Christmas season, when demand for his animals increases.  For this reason he thought it a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles.

loans.use: Purchase animals to expand his animal growth and sales business

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Cleotilde tiene 53 años de edad, es viuda y reside junto a sus tres hijos en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ell cuenta con un buen número de aves de corral como patos y pollos, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Esta actividad es una de las más importantes fuentes de ingreso económico de su familia.

Cleotilde desea ampliar su negocio comprando más aves y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante esta temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Cleotilde is 53 years old, is widowed and lives with her three children in a rural area of Tambogrande, a farming district in Piura region, which is more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque region.

She has a good number of poultry, such as ducks and chickens, which she raises in enclosures at home.  When they have reached a good size, she offers them for sale to the general public and to businessmen who visit the area regularly.  This activity is one of the most important sources of income for the family.

Cleotilde wants to expand her business by buying more birds and balanced feed so she can increase her sales during this Christmas season, when demand for her animals increases.  For this reason she thought it a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new soles.

loans.use: Purchase of animals to expand her animal sales business

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo en una zona rural D. la localidad D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con un buen número D. aves D. corral como patos y pollos, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro D. su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.
