Flora desea ampliar su negocio comprando más aves y alimento balanceado D. modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante esta temporada naviD.ña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Flora, age 55, is married and lives with her husband in a rural zone of the community of TambogranD., an agricultural district located in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has a large amount of poultry which she raises indoors. When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the general public and to merchants who visit the area. This business allows her to help her husband, who is a farmer, with the economic support of their family.

Flora wishes to enlarge her business by purchasing more birds and balanced feed so that she can increase her sales during this Christmas season. That is when the demand for her animals increases, and that’s why she believes this is a good time to apply with Epydme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new soles.

loans.use: Purchase of animals in order to enlarge her business of raising and selling poultry.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina tiene 49 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en una zona rural D. la localidad D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con ovejas y vacas, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes fuera D. su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general dentro del mercado del distrito. Esta actividad le provee D. algunos ingresos, los cuales utiliza para apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia.

Maximina desea ampliar su negocio comprando alimento balanceado D. modo que pueda percibir mejores ganancias durante sus ventas D. esta temporada naviD.ña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maximina is 49 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of TambogranD., an agricultural district which is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Maximina has sheep and cows which she raises outsiD. her home.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the general public in the district market.  This activity provides her with income which she uses to help her husband in supporting the family financially.

Maximina would like to expand her business by purchasing balanced animal feed. This will allow her to make better profits from her sales during this Christmas period which is when demand for her animals increases.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed to improve her business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Nuo

texts.en: The two people shown in the photo are Mrs. Nuo S. T., 28, and her husband, age 31. They currently live in Kompong Cham province. Mrs. Nuo S. earns a living by planting rice with her husband. They spend most of their time with the farming business. In addition, Mrs. Nuo S. T. also raises a few pigs behind her house. They have three children, who are all single. At present, Mrs. Nuo S. faces difficulT. with transportation and always has to hire a taxi when she needs a ride. To reduce the cost of transportation, she would like a loan to buy a new motorbike for her family's needs. She will use the remaining funds to purchase more pigs to feed for sale.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her family's needs and to purchase more pigs

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom P. is a 49 year-old widow who has given birth to one child and who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She is employed as a group leader at a garment factory and earns a formal monthly salary. Since 1985, she has also been earning a daily income as a farmer. She owns a farm and cultivates rice to sell as well as selling Khmer noodles. 

Mom P.’s house is very old and most of it is falling down. She has said that she and her family cannot live in her house because it is not comfortable. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to combine with her savings to build a new house.

loans.use: to build a new house

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem V. is a long-time businessman and a low-income person.  He is a gasoline seller   in retail to his neighbor other people in and around Kompong Tom Province, and earning an income of approximately $5.60 per day for supporting his family’s expenses. He has a life partner in his wife who is a seller of different products such as fast food, and Khmer cake. The couple is blessed with three children, all three of whom are single and living on their own. Hem V.’s house has already been built, but now his saving account is not enough to pay for the construction fee. This is why he has decided to look for lenders on Kiva. Hem V. was not available at that day, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To pay the construction fee.

loans.name: Amanda Guadalupe

texts.es: Amanda Guadalupe L.  D. L., D. treinta y nueve años D. edad, resiD. en la capital del país San Salvador y vive en casa propia junto a su mamá, hermana e hija Isabel. Ella tiene instalada en su misma casa D. residencia una pequeña tienda, la que atienD. todos los días D. la semana, en la que suministra jabones, detergentes productos D. consumo diario y golosinas. Además es muy conocida por sus vecinos por dedicarse D. viernes a domingo a la venta D. pupusas a base D. maíz ó arroz que contienen en su interior: queso, frijoles, ayote y chicharrón, las que son preparadas al gusto D. los clientes; además D. antojitos típicos por las tardes D. casi todos los días, como pastelitos rellenos D. carne, enchiladas y atoles. Ella se esfuerza mucho por sacar adelante día a día  a su familia, la que se ha integrado muy bien a fin D. sacar adelante las tareas D. la casa y atender ambos negocios. Ya su hija estudia el sexto grado en el colegio, ella representa la mayor fuente D. inspiración para Amanda,  son mas D. seis años que Amanda Guadalupe tiene D. haber instalado dichos negocios y ahora ella ha podido percibir el incremento en sus ventas, su esmero, paciencia y energía positiva esta siendo recompensado, ella tiene grandes sueños y es por ello que se encuentra solicitando un crédito a Apoyo Integral con el que pretenD. tener otros productos en su tienda y mayor cantidad D. materiales para la producción D. sabrosas pupusas y antojitos típicos, a fin D. obtener mayores ganancias y asegurar el bienestar D. toda su familia.
texts.en: Amanda Guadalupe L.  D. L., 39, lives in the capital city of San Salvador.  She lives in her own home with her mother, her sister and her daughter, Isabel.  Amanda has a small store set up in part of her home, where she works every day of the week selling soap, detergents, daily consumer products and sweets.  In addition, she is very well-known by her neighbors for selling pupusas from Fridays through Sundays.  These are typical Salvadoran snacks maD. of a base of corn or rice that are filled with cheese, beans, squash and pork, which she makes according to the tastes of her customers.  In addition, she makes other traditional snacks in the afternoons almost every day, such as: pastries filled with meat, enchiladas and atoles (a hot drink maD. with corn meal.)  Amanda works very hard each day to proviD. for her family: she manages her family life and the household chores and at the same time takes care of both businesses.  Her daughter, who is in sixth graD., is her main source of inspiration. It has been more than 6 years since Amanda Guadalupe  started up these businesses, and now she has been able to increase her sales so that her dedication, patience and positive energy are paying off.  She has great dreams, and for this reason she requests a loan from Apoyo Integral, with which she aims to have other products in her store and a greater quantity of supplies to make her delicious pupusas and traditional snacks.  Her goal is to obtain better earnings so that she can ensure the welfare of all of her family members.

loans.use: to buy sweet buns, cookies, cereals, staple grains and supplies needed to make pupusas and other traditional Salvadoran snacks.

loans.name: Neou

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the major part of 32-year-old Neou K.’s daily activities in the garment industry. Neou K. has been engaged in her job since 2000 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a blacksmith in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their one kid, who is studying in school. 

Besides her current work, Neou K. is also a farmer and now it is the time for planting a rice crop but her farmland isn't ready for plowing yet because she is busy working. To solve this obstacle, Neou K. is applying for a loan to buy a machine to plow her farmland in order to start growing rice.

loans.use: To buy a machine to plow her farmland in order to start for growing rice

loans.name: Kourn

texts.en: Kourn R. is a rattan cupboard and bed maker. She is 35 and is a married mother with two children who are pupils in the local public school. Since 2006, Kourn R. and her husband have been selling their products in front of their house, which has located in Kompong Tom Province. The couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes the finished items door-to-door to sell across the province. They always take a week or two to sell their products this way. Kourn R. is now able to run her business very well because she sells her items at a reasonable price. Kourn R. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more wood to make beds for selling.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture to sell

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Khin N., age 37, owns and operates a handicraft business selling rattan cupboards and beds. She and her husband sell their products, which they weave themselves or order from other weavers who live in the village of Kompong Tom Province. This couple uses their horse cart as transportation and it takes a week to sell all their rattan products. Khin N. has been facing difficulties transporting her rattan because her horse cart is slow and that affects how she can satisfy the needs of her customers. Because of this problem, Khin N. decided to request a loan to purchase a machine which she will attach her existing cart and then she will be able to transport her products faster.

loans.use: To purchase a machine which she will attach her existing horse cart and then she will be able to transport her products faster.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S. is 44 years old and single mother to five children, all five of whom are single and four of them are working in different occupations. In the beginning of 2008, Sor S. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a few snack products to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. Most of the income in her family comes from her children. One of her sons is a blacksmith and he shares responsibilities of supporting the family with her. Currently, her son wants to expand his business by purchasing a machine. She hopes to encourage her son, but she has no cash to make that possible. So, Sor S. is requesting a loan to purchase a machine for cutting steel. With the remaining funds, she will buy a machine for grinding sugar cane and start a new business for herself.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for cutting steel and a machine for grinding sugar cane to start her new business.

loans.name: El Progreso De Tahuantinsuyo Group

texts.es:
MARIA C. SARMIENTO, residente D. la zona D. Independencia, conviviente, D. 52 años D. edad y con una simpatía que la caracteriza.
La Sra. María, hace diez años y todos los días desD. muy temprano se dedica a atender su negocio D. venta D. comida rápida, el cual inició con mucho sacrificio; tenia la experiencia D. su mama quien hacia muchos años también vendía comida; pero fue mas por un amiga quien vendía muy bien y veía que ese negocio la daba buena rentabilidad, con el esfuerzo D. su gran esfuerzo diario D. trabajo ha podido solventar los gastos D. su familia, su mayor anhelo comprar mas productos para surtir mas su negocio y luego abrir una bodega en su domicilio. 
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio (cerveza).

Hoy en día, integra la ALCOM “EL PROGRESO D. TAHUANTINSUYO”, es la presidenta del grupo, y junto a 08 emprendedores integrantes luchan y se apoyan D. pospréstamos que obtienen D. EDAPROSPO para hacer crecer sus negocios y salir adelante.
texts.en:
52-year old María C. Sarmiento lives with her husband in the neighbourhood of Independencia. She is known for her friendly personality.

For the last ten years María has earned her living selling fast food. She does this every day from early in the morning. It took a lot of sacrifice to get the business going, but she drew on her mother’s experience as she also used to sell fast food. However, it was a friend in the same line of work who told María that such a business would be profitable. Daily hard work has meant that she has been able to pay for the family’s expenses. Her greatest wish is to buy more stock for her business and also to open a store in her home.

María will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her business (beer for example).

She is the president of the Alcom “El Progreso D. Tahuantinsuyo”. She and the other eight members work together to pay off the loans obtained through Kiva partner EDAPROSPO to expand their businesses and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Pruk

texts.en: Pruk K., age 57, makes a living by working as staff in an office in the province of Kompong Tom. She has been employed in this manner for over ten years and has a formal salary very month. Pruk K. was married, but her husband died several years ago. She has five children; one is married and four are single. Pruk K. depends on the income from her three children who work overseas in Thailand. Beside this work, she has also been planting the rice crop that is her annual business. Pruk K. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy a cow to help plow the farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow farmland

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
YASAIDA LUPE, ES MADRE SOLTERA, TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, Y TIENE 2 HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD. ACTUALMENTE ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO "LOS ANGELES", EL CUAL RECIENTEMENTE ACABA DE FORMARCE, Y SE ENCUENTRA INTEGRADO POR 07  SOCIAS QUE RESIDEN EN LA ZONA DE VILLA JUANITA EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
DESDE HACE UN AÑO, LA SRA. YASAIDA LUPE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MAZAMORRA DE CALABAZA EN LAS AFUERAS DE UN COLEGIO. SE INICA EN ESTE NEGOCIO YA QUE EN EL COLEGIO DE SU HIJO, A LOS NIÑOS LES GUSTA MUCHO ESTE POSTRE, ASI ES QUE YASALDA DECIDE PONER ESTE NEGOCIO, Y ES ASI COMO INICIA UNA FUENTE DE INGRESOS PARA SU HOGAR, PERMITIENDOLE MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SUS HIJOS Y CRECER CON SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO.
CON EL ESFUERZO DE SU TRABAJO YASADIA LUPE HA LOGRADO INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO Y LOGRAR LA CAPTACION DE UNA MAYOR CLIENTELA, SU GRAN ANHELO ES PONER UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN SU NEGOCIO Y EN LA COMPRA DE JUGUETES PARA LA CAMPAÑA NAVIDEÑA.
texts.en:
Yasaida Lupe is a 27 years old single mother and has two young children. She is the president of the group “Los Angeles” [The Angels] which was formed recently. It is made up of seven members who live in the zone of Villa Juanita in the District of Carabayllo.

She has been selling pumpkin biscuits outside her son’s school for a year. She started this business because the students like them very much and she wanted a source of income. It has improved her and her children’s quality of life.

Her hard work has contributed to the success of her business and an increase in the number of costumers. Her dream is to have her own stand at the market.

She is requesting the loan to invest in her business and to buy toys for the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy toys for the Christmas season

loans.name: Yok

texts.en: Yok T. is a 47-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Her husband assists her in the farming business. The couple have five children, all of whom are single. Yok T. now has one son who is no longer in school and is unemployed. She wants her son to have an occupation as a motor-taxi driver. Due to her lack of capital, Yok T. has decided to ask for a loan on Kiva to be used to buy a motorcycle for her son to begin running a taxi service.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to begin running a taxi service.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy toys for this Christmas season

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Mrs. Chann S., age 42, is a widowed village woman. Her husband died many years ago, leaving her with one child. She currently lives with her niece who works as a laborer.  Mrs. Chann S. currently generates an income of approximately $2.5 per day by selling Khmer cake. Besides this business, Mrs. Chann S. is a farmer. She has owned and operated her farm to cultivate a rice crop at least twice a year, by following both rainy and dry seasons. Growing crops is an annual action in which she has had great success. This rice harvesting season, Mrs. Chann S. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice

loans.name: Au

texts.en: Mrs. Au N., 32, is a single mother living in the province of Kompong Tom. Mrs. Au N. makes her living by selling fish at the busy local market, and earns an average profit of $3.80 per day. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fisherman. Mrs. Au N. is a humble mother who has three children. Two of them are single and the other one is married. All of her children are working in different careers, and they always share their income with their mother in order to support the family’s expenses. Mrs. Au N. would like a loan in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan P., 31, is a local farmer/rice cultivator who has been living Kompong Tom Province for many years. For additional income, he raises a few pigs in a stall at his home. He was married, but he divorced his wife 4 years ago, and has one child. Chan P. currently lives with his elderly parents. Chan P. uses cows to plow his fields and is concerned that one of his two cows is getting old and it cannot support his plowing process. So Chan P. is looking for a loan to buy a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new cow

loans.name: Sea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sea V., age 44, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fisherman. She currently earns an average of US$2.80 per day. She has been running her business for several years. Her husband is 53 years old and is a fisherman who works along a local river. He is also a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Sea V. is the mother of one young child. 

In order earn extra profit, Mrs. Sea V.’s husband planted some banana trees behind his home, and he often sells bananas in the local market. He uses his motorbike as transportation, but can only carry his products in small amounts. That affects how he can satisfy the needs of his customers. Because of this problem, Mrs. Sea V. decided to request a loan for her husband in order to purchase a trailer to attach to his motorcycle. This would allow him to transport larger amounts of his product than is currently possible.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for carrying product to market

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat L. K. is a 51-year-old widowed mother and a farmer in the province of Kompong Tom. She has three children; two are married and live away from home, and one is single. To help support the family, two of the children are employed: a son is farmer and a daughter sells cakes in the village. Khat L. K. owns a farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows a variety of crops. Currently, she has planted peanut and potato crops. She estimates that she will harvest them within the next two months when the plants mature. Khat L. K. will use the income from her produce sales to better meet her family’s needs. Because of good results from planting these crops, Khat L. K. would like a loan from Kiva to purchase more potato and peanut seeds to sow.

loans.use: To purchase more potato and peanut seeds

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon P. is a woman who works very hard every day to get ahead. She has good skills to use an injection machine for illness in the village, and earns an income of approximately US$2.50 per day. Chhuon P. is 69 years old and lives in the Province of Kompong Tom. Chhuon P. was married, but her husband died several years ago. She has two children, and both of them are married. One of her children is a seller in the busy market, and she sells some items such as cooking ingredients, fast food, and plastic products. Chhuon P.’s daughter is going well, and she wishes to expand her business for extra profit. To support her child’s business, Chhuon P. is applying for a loan for her daughter to use to purchase a larger number of items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a larger number of items to sell.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Kang S. is a 64-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. Kang S. is married to Kim Krich, age 66, who works with her in the farming business. This old couple is blessed with two children, one of whom is single, still living under their roof. The other one is married, and works as a construction worker. Besides this farming business, Kang S.’s husband is a bicycle repairer for all passers-by in the village. He can earn a profit from this business - on average $5 per day - in order to share responsibility for other expenses for the family’s needs. So Kang S. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase some equipment for repairing bicycle, which will allow her husband’s business to grow well. Kang S. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase some equipment for repairing bicycle.

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en:
Sumaira is a resident of Multan which is the fourth largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and tombs. She lives there in the area named Chowk Shaheedan with her family in a two room brick house. She came here after her marriage to M. N. who works abroad. 
She supports her family financially by operating a business selling clothes. She buys clothes from the wholesale markets of Multan and sells them to customers in her local area, particularly to rich families. She has a number of clients and she sells a large number of clothes to them every month and earns good profits. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her father’s business, selling roasted chicken. He has a roasted chicken stall in the market where he sells roasted chicken with French fries to his customers and generates income for the family. Due to his food's good taste, people from many areas comes to his stall to buy a large quantity of roasted chicken from him. 
With the loan, he will buy chickens, spices and cooking oil etc in larger quantities in order to prepare his customers' orders and increase his income. 
Sumaira is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sumaira.

loans.use: To buy chickens, spices, cooking oil for roasted chicken stall business

loans.name: Shakila's Group

texts.en:
Shakila lives in Multan which is the fourth largest city of Pakistan and is known for its history and tombs.  She is married to K. S. who operates a spare parts business.  He sells spare parts for different vehicles from his shop which is located in the market.  People come to him to buy spare parts from him because of his reasonable prices and the wide range of spare parts that are available in his shop.
  
Shakila herself is a business woman, who operates a clothes sales business to supplement the income of her family.  She buys clothes from the wholesale markets in Multan and sells them to her local area clients at a good profit.  She has given birth to two sons.  Her sons are 9 and 5 years of age and have not started going to school yet. 

Shakila has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business.  With the loan, he will buy spare parts for different vehicles in order to fulfil the needs of his clients on a timely basis.  She is confident that her husband’s business will grow further by investing a loan into it.  She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shakila.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of spare parts to resell

loans.name: Mehreen's Group

texts.en:
Mehreen is a resident of Multan, which is an historic city in Pakistan famous for its embroidery and cloth industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the Chowk Shaheedan area.

She is a caring lady and prefers to stay at home and carry out her responsibilities as a housewife.  Her husband operates a small canteen business. He runs a canteen outside of the school area and sells chips, samosas, cold drinks, biscuits, etc. which are very popular among students. He has been in this business for over 10 years and is getting good profits from his business every month.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further improve the business of her husband. With the loan, he will buy required items like cold drinks, chips, biscuits, etc. in a good quantity for selling to the students.
 
Mehreen hopes that an investment will result in good profits for her husband and that her family’s standard of living will be improved.  She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Mehreen.

loans.use: To buy items required for canteen business

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly P. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 46 years old, married and has 2 children ages 25 and 20. To make a living, Beverly owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Beverly is just starting this business.

Beverly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Beverly is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Beverly from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Noor Jahan's Group

texts.en:
Noor Jahan lives in Multan, which is the fourth largest city in Pakistan and known for its history and tombs. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the Dewan Bagh area. She has been living there for over 27 years.

A talented and hardworking lady, Noor carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and also supports her husband financially by making embroidered clothing. She does hand embroidery, which is considered valuable work for women. She has a good number of clients in her community and outside of the community as well. She also exports her embroidered clothes to other cities like Lahore, etc.

Her husband operates a rice-selling business and generates income for the family.  Noor has given birth to 3 children. Her eldest son is completing his bachelor's degree and works as an accountant in a private firm. The next child to him works as a salesman in a factory. Her daughter is 12 year old and studying in in the 5th class (grade).

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy some embroidery materials such as cloth, beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity that will help her fulfill larger orders on time and increase the household income.

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery business

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a business woman who operates a business selling bangles to financially support her family. She has a good number of clients who prefer purchasing bangles from her because of her variety and attractive colors.

She lives in a 2-room brick house with her family in Dewan Bagh, which is a small housing colony in the city of Multan. Multan is an historic city and known for its tombs and hot weather in Pakistan. She has been living there for over 12 years.

Besides her business, she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She is married to M. A., who offers his calligraphy services to his customers and generates income for the family. She has given birth to 2 sons and 4 daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her bangle-selling business. With the loan, she will buy bangles of different varieties such as steel, glass and metal in a bulk quantity that will make her able to fulfill the larger orders of her customers and thereby make more income.

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy bangles for bangle-selling business

loans.name: Rabia Muhammad Saeed's Group

texts.en:
Rabia lives in Multan, a historic city located in Punjab province, Pakistan. The city is known for its history and culture. She lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in an area called Dewan bagh. She moved there six months ago.
Rabia is a very supportive lady, always ready to help her husband and family in times of crisis. In order to support her family financially, she operates a business selling bangles and embroidered clothes. She has a good number of customers who trust her due to the quality of her goods and her cheap prices. She buys bangles from jewelry shops and embroidered clothes from the wholesale market in Multan.
Rabia's husband works in a private firm and earns a meager income. Rabia lives in a combined family unit with her two brother-in-laws. One of them is a rickshaw driver and the other operates a grocery shop. She has no children yet.
She has applied for a loan for her business from Kiva partner, Asasah. With the loan, she will buy bangles and embroidered clothes in bulk in order to increase her sales by fulfilling her customers' orders. Rabia is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy bangles and embroidered clothes for resale

loans.name: Amna Naveed Hassan's Group

texts.en:
Amna is a resident of Multan, a famous Pakistani city known for its history and culture. She lives there with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area called Dewan bagh. She came here six years ago when she married N. H..
Amna's husband has a business selling washing machines. He has been in this business for many years and has a good reputation in the market. He gives his customers the advantage of paying for a washing machine in installments. Due to this, people like to buy a washing machines from him than from other sellers.
Amna supports her family by doing embroidery work. She is skilled at this work and likes to do it. In doing this work, she improves her skills and also helps her family financially. She receives orders from her customers in her neighborhood and provides them with the finished work on time in order to make a good income.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase more washing machines and sell them through his shop. She is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and he will make more money from it.
Amna is a mother of two children – a five-year-old son who reads in one class and a three-year-old daughter who is not ready to attend school yet. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will bring good profits to her family.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Amna.

loans.use: To buy washing machines for resale

loans.name: Tahira Zaki Shah's Group

texts.en:
Tahira is a resident of Multan, a historic city located in Punjab province, Pakistan. She lives there with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area called Dewan bagh. Tahira is a very supportive lady.
A few years ago she started an embroidery business to support her family financially because her husband’s income was not enough to fulfill the family's basic needs. Now her business has expanded and she has started a boutique at her home where she can display her prepared embroidered dresses to more people and therefore increase her household income.
Tahira's husband’s name is Z. S. and he works in the government sector as a clerk. Tahira has three sons and a daughter. Three of them are enrolled in school and getting an education. Tahira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy unstitched clothes and embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and patterns to make more embroidered dresses to display in her boutique. Tahira is a new loan applicant to Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will help to improve her family’s financial condition.
Note: In the photo, the lady who is seated second left is Tahira.

loans.use: To buy unstitched clothes and embroidery materials for her boutique business

loans.name: Irshad Muhammad Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Irshad lives in the small city of Okara, located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area of Allah daad colony. Irshad is a housewife who stays at home to carry out her household responsibilities. She has six children. Her four elder children left education after 8th class and started work to contribute to the family financially. Her eldest daughter does sewing work and her other three sons work in private organizations for monthly wages. Only one of her daughters is able to continue her education. She studies in 6th class.
Irshad's husband is M. A. and he runs a video games shop. He offers his customers different and interesting games to play. His customer base is mostly young children who spend their leisure time playing games. His business is doing well and he makes good earnings. Irshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to assist her husband financially. With the loan, he will buy more video games in order to offer a better variety of games to his customers and make more money. He has been in this business for the past nine years and Irshad is hopeful that the investment will bring a return of good outcomes for the business.
Irshad is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Irshad.

loans.use: To buy video games for video games shop

loans.name: Fazeelat's Group

texts.en:
Fazeelat is a resident of Okara, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in a two room brick house.  Fazeelat is a mother of one son and three daughters. Her daughters are enrolled in school and her son is an electrician by profession.
 
Her husband has run a grocery store business for eight years.  Fazeelat is applying for a loan for her husband’s business.  With the loan, he will put more groceries on store shelves and meet the needs of his customers and earn a better income.
  
Fazeelat is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old, married and has two children aged 25 and 23. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale.
Gloria joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Herlita

texts.en:
Herlita B., 29, is from the town of Sta. Josefa.  She is married and has two children aged 9 and 11.  To make a living, Herlita plants, harvests and sells rice. Herlita keeps the farm free of weeds and pests and hopes to increase her harvest.

Herlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herlita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Herlita is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP to purchase farm inputs like rice and fertilizers. This loan will be her ninth from CEVI.   She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like rice and fertilizers

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her cousin who is a painter from profession.  With the loan, he will buy paint boxes of different colors and brushes to fulfill his painting orders on time to generate a good income and happy customers.  She is hopeful that a loan will bring a positive change to her cousin’s business.

Khalida and her family live in a small city named Okara located in Punjab Pakistan.  She supports her family by doing sewing work for neighboring clients.  Khalida has five sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a motorbike mechanic and the others attend school.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah with a good credit record. This is her third loan application. 

Note: The lady with a book in hand is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes and paint brushes for painting business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime E., 40 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married and has four children aged 10, 8, 5 and 2.  Jaime is a rice farmer.  He and his wife sell their harvest in the local market.  Jaime works hard to be a good husband and father. He makes sure to set aside money for his children's education. 

Jaime joined CEVI to gain access to financial services. He says he is happy for his decision to join CEVI because his loans help his farming business. He is now requesting a loan of Php 14000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim (Photo: far right) is a widow who started a cloth selling business to bear the financial burden of her family after the death of her husband.  She has been in business for 12 years.  

She is a mother of two sons who are married who sell clothes. They have a shop in the market and they earn a good income.
 
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business.  With the loan, she will buy winter season clothes in bulk and increase her sales and household income.
 
She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her third loan application.  In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit history and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie A., 31, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married and has a five year old child.  To make a living, Julie raises crops, primarily from planting and harvesting rice.  He dreams of becoming a successful businessman.

Julie joined CEVI to access financial services to improve his living situation and to engage in business activities.  He requests a new loan of 14000 PHP to purchase farm inputs and to pay for labor.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia D. C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa.  She is 48 years old, married and has four children.  To make a living, Lilia plants and harvests rice for sale.  Lilia does her best to be a responsible wife and mother. 

Lilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Lilia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to buy seeds and other farm inputs.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives with her family in a two room brick house in Okara, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan.  She operates a sewing business.  Razia receives orders from her neighborhoods, and in her six years of experience, she has never received a complaint from her customers about her work.  

She is a widow with three children.  Her elder daughter also sews to help her complete her orders.  Another daughter is a school teacher and her son is a supervisor in a rice mill.

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine.  Her old machine doesn’t produce a quality product and it takes too  much time to sew a dress.
 
Razia is hopeful that a loan will be profitable for her business, that will resulted in a better financial life for her family.  This is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old, married and has 6 children. To make a living, Lolita plants and harvests rice for sale. Lolita works hard to keep up with the increasing needs of her household.

Lolita joined CEVI because she needed financial assistance for her farming business. She is now requesting a loan of PHP13000 which will be used to buy additional fertilizers and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 34 years old, married and has two children ages six and one.  To make a living, Nemia plants and harvests rice for sale. Nemia does her best to help provide for her family. 

Nemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Nemia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP  to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 61 years old. Ofelia is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Ofelia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ofelia also put up a sari-sari store to help in their daily needs. She sells coffee, snacks and other products.

Ofelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to buy farmsupplies and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay for labor

loans.name: Sanilyn

texts.en:
Sanilyn E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 37 years old, married and has seven children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 5. To make a living, Sanilyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Sanilyn works hard to sustain the education of five of her children. She hopes to have them finish college and have bright futures.
Sanilyn joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Sanilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old and married. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gina works hard to build her business and have a stable income.
Gina joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 40 years old, married and has two children aged four and eight. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Helen is a hardworking and loving mother. She only wants the best for her family. She is starting to save little by little for her children's future.
Helen joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Helen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and gasoline for the tractor.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and gasoline for tractor

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 55 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Jose owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale.
Jose joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jose is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shahnaz Khalid Farooq's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in the small city of Okara, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area called Mehboob town. She is 30 years old and married to K. F. who has an embroidery business. He has a shop in the market from where he operates his business and offers hand embroidery and machine embroidery to his customers. He has a good reputation in his area for the quality of his work. Shahnaz is also involved in the embroidery business. She works on orders that she receives from customers in her neighborhood. She has a good number of customers and receives regular orders from them. She uses her income to pay utility bills and her children’s education fees.
Shahnaz is the mother of three children: two sons and a daughter. The first two children are enrolled in school and receiving an education while her youngest son is only three years old and has not started school yet.
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to help her husband in his business. With the loan, he will buy unstitched clothes and embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and patterns to offer a better service to his customers and to fulfill larger orders on time. He has been in this business for over 20 years and Shahnaz is hopeful that an investment will bring good changes in her husband’s business and increase his monthly income. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy unstitched clothes and embroidery materials for her husband's embroidery business

loans.name: Irshaad Zubair Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad is a caring lady who stays at home to carry out her responsibilities as a housewife. Her husband's name is Z. A. and he operates a dairy business. He runs a shop in the market from where he sells a good quantity of milk everyday and earns a good income.
Irshaad lives in the small city of Okara, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area of Mehoob town. She moved there four months ago with her family. She is a mother of four children but she could not provide them with an education due to limited financial resources.
Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to financially assist her husband in his dairy business. With the loan, he will buy another dairy cow which will increase his milk production, enabling him to serve more customers. Irshaad is hopeful that with the loan investment, her husband will be able to get positive financial results from his business.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Irshaad.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Safia Muhammad Hussain's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a resident of a small city called Okara, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area called Mehboob town. She moved there four years ago. Safia has two sons. Her elder son is four years old and the younger one is only four months old. She is a caring lady who carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and pays full attention to her sons.
Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to assist her husband financially in his construction supplies sales business. With the loan, he will buy sand, bricks and cement in bulk in order to provide a better service to his customers and to fulfill larger orders on time. Safia is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her husband’s business and make him more income. She is a new loan applicant to Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Abida Sharafat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Abida lives in Okara, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area called Mehboob town. She moved there after her marriage two years ago. Abida is a housewife who stays at home to carry out her household responsibilities. With her work she tries her best to give comfort to her husband and family. She lives in a combined family unit with her in-laws.
Abida is 21 years old and married to S. A. who has a restaurant business. He offers different kinds of Punjabi food such as Nan chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread) and Biryani (made with rice and chicken, served with pickle) and tea to his customers. He has a good number of customers due to the good quality of his food and his reasonable prices.
Abida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s restaurant business. With the loan, he will buy required items such as rice, cooking oil, spices and chickpeas in bulk. This will enable him to provide better quality food to his customers and increase his monthly income. Abida is hopeful that an investment will improve her husband’s business and give a better future to her son. She is a new loan applicant to Asasah and this is her first loan application.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Abida.

loans.use: To buy items for her husband's restaurant business

loans.name: Monica Antonia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MONICA ANTONIA A. A.  DE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE CON SU CONYUGUE EL SEÑOR ALFREDO SACATOMA SURCO, ELLA  ES UNA MUJER MUY TRABAJADORA QUE SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA-VENTA DE PISCOS Y VINOS EN SU DOMICILIO, A LA VEZ LA SEÑORA MONICA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PECANAS, LA CUAL CULTIVA EN SU CHACRA EN DONDE TIENE UNAS PLANTAS DE PECANO. LA SEÑORA MONICA CUENTA CON 5 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. SU ESPOSO EL SEÑOR ALFREDO SACATOMA, EL TRABAJA REALIZANDO OBRAS DE AGUA Y DESAGUE, AMBOS TIENEN DOS HIJOS DE 13 Y 8 AÑOS DE EDAD, AMBOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
texts.en: Monica Antonia A. A., 43, lives with her husband, Alfredo Sacatoma Surco.  She is a very hardworking woman who has a business buying and selling fish from her home.  Monica also sells pecans, which she cultivates on her fields where she has some pecan plants.  Monica has 5 years of experience in this line of work.  Her husband, Alfredo Sacatoma, does water and sewage work.  They have 2 school-aged children who are 13 and 8 years old.

loans.use: so that she can irrigate her pecan fields

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is a resident of Raiwind, a small city in Pakistan known for its dairy industry. She lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Raja jang. She moved here 21 years ago after her marriage to M. A., a security guard in a private organization. Sajida has 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her elder son works in a factory while the other children are studying at the local school.

Sajida supports her family financially by doing embroidery. She has a good number of clients in nearby areas and receives regular orders from them every month. She learned embroidery skills from her mother before her marriage and now these skills are providing monetary advantages for her. Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to improve her embroidery business. She will purchase embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and unstitched clothing in bulk and craft new embroidery designs that will help her finish her orders on time and increase her household income. Sajida has been operating this business for over 10 years and she is confident that business conditions will improve after making this loan investment. She is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has built a good credit record and attended every meeting.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material in bulk

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband with his butcher shop. From his shop, he sells chicken meat to his customers and generates income for the family. Chicken consumption is different in every city, but people like to eat chicken over other meats. With the loan, he will buy chickens in larger quantities, which will help him fulfill the on time demands of his customers and earn more income. 

Nasreen resides with her family in Riwind, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry. She moved here after her marriage many years ago. She herself is a seamstress, and sews clothes for neighborhood clients. She also does embroidery work that she learned from her mother prior to marriage. She believes that in today’s world it is very difficult for one person to improve the financial condition of the family when the cost of living is getting higher every day. That’s why she supports her husband financially with her sewing and embroidery work. 

She has 3 sons. All of them have their own shops where they also sell chicken meat to their clients. They have a good reputation among their clients due to the quality of their fresh meat. 

Nasreen is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and bring more money to her home. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In her previous loan years, she maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with her hand raised is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy chickens for specialty butcher shop

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma is a talented lady who does embroidery work to support her family financially. Her quality art brings in good income and she fulfills regular orders from her clients every month. She resides with her family in the area named Raja jang, which is a small area in the city of Riwind, located in Punjab province of Pakistan. Asma is 30 years of age, married to S. H., who has a business of making shoes. He has a small shop in the market where he receives orders from different factories and shoe shops to provide finished product to earn an income for his family. 

Asma has 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her oldest son is in kindergarten, while the others are too young to attend school yet. Asma wants to provide quality education to her children. That’s why she works very hard. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his shoe making business. With the loan he will buy leather, nails and shoe polish in larger quantities. That will enable him to make shoes in bulk quantity to fulfill the orders of his customers and increase his income. He has been in this business for over 10 years. Asma is hopeful that, through an investment, her husband will improve his business further and increase his monthly income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she built good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails and shoe polish for shoe making business

loans.name: The Nargis Maqsood Masih Group

texts.en:
Nargis lives in Riwind, a small city in Pakistan known for its dairy industry. She lives there with her family in a small housing colony named Arshad in a two-room brick house. Nargis moved there 10 years ago. She is divorced, and her family’s financial responsibilities are on her shoulders, although she has a daughter who supports her financially by working in a factory and earning a monthly wage. Nargis lives with her brother who is a property dealer. 

Nargis operates a clothes-selling business. She buys clothes from wholesale markets in Lahore and sells them to different shops in Riwind and also to local customers.  She is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to buy larger quantities of a wider variety of clothes to improve her sales and income. Nargis is a regular Asasah loan recipient and this is her second application. She has good credit and has never missed a meeting.

Nargis is hopeful that this investment will make her business more profitable and that she will be able to build a dowry for her daughter’s marriage with her profits. In this photo, Nargis is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in the city of Raiwind in Pakistan. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for over 10 years. She is a caring lady, carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife. She also helps her son in his shoemaking business if she can spare time from her household chores. Her son takes orders from different shoe factories and fills them to earn an income. Shahnaz is married to M. R., who is 60 years old and works in a factory. She has 3 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son makes shoes, the next eldest has a mobile phone shop in the market, selling used mobile phones and accessories, and the youngest son is a daily wage laborer. Her daughter is the only one who attends school and is in the 8th grade. Due to poor financial circumstances, Shahnaz couldn’t provide education for her sons and they had to leave school and start work to support their family financially.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to improve her eldest son’s business. With the loan, he will buy leather, nails and shoe polishers in larger quantities and make more shoes to fill the orders more quickly. Shahnaz is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In her previous loan years, she maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, Shahnaz is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy leather, nails and shoe polishers

loans.name: Nazraan's Group

texts.en:
Nazraan is a widow who lives with her brother in the small housing colony of Arshad, located in Raiwind, Pakistan. She didn’t want to become a financial burden to her brother; therefore, she started operating a clothing sales business a few years ago. It proved to be a good business for her and she started getting regular orders from nearby areas and earning a good income.

Nazraan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to help her brother improve his vegetable selling business. He will utilize the loan to purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk in order to sell more vegetables and make more money. Nazraan is a very helpful and supportive person by nature. She has confidence that her brother will make good use of the money and earn better profits from his business after this investment.

Nazraan has a daughter, 3 years of age, who has not yet started school. It is her deepest desire to provide quality education for her daughter once she becomes old enough to attend school. Nazraan is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is 48 years old and married with three children. Her husband, I., is 60 years old and has a business selling food. He has a small restaurant in the market where he offers different kinds of Punjabi food and tea to his customers. His food dishes are very famous and people come from different areas to taste his nan chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread) and biryani (made with rice and served with pickles).

A talented lady, Bushra also supports her husband financially by doing embroidery. She has a good number of clients in her neighborhood and receives regular orders from them every month, earning a good income. She has 2 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son left school after 8th grade and started working in a factory at a low salary. Her second son is illiterate and her daughter is in 3rd grade.

Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to improve her embroidery business. She will use the loan to purchase embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread, sketches and unstitched clothing in larger quantities to help her make more embroidered clothes to increase her income and sales. She has been operating this business for many years and is hopeful that an investment will return a good profit for her business. Bushra is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In her previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, Bushra is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material and unstitched clothes

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina makes beautiful embroidered clothes to earn an income for her family. She learned this art from her mother as a teenager.

Zarina and her family live a in a small housing colony named Arshad, in a three room brick home in the city of Riwind, Pakistan.  It is famous for its dairy industry. Her husband buys candy at wholesale prices and sells to shop owners for a profit. 

She is the mother of three sons and two daughters.  She couldn’t provide an education to her sons and they started working as teenagers.  Her daughters are in school.

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to provide financial assistance to her husband.  He will utilize the loan to purchase more candy. He has been in business for seven years and Zarina is hopeful that a loan will improves the financial condition of their family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application.  Zarina has built a good credit history and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy candies to sell

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar and her family live in a two room brick house in Riwind, a small city in Pakistan.  She started an embroidery business few years ago and makes a good profit every month. 

She is married to S. who purchases young animals, raised them, and sells them to butchers and other people to make profit.  

Kosar has one son and three daughters who are enrolled in school and are getting their education.  Kosar works very hard to pay off their school fees. She wants them to complete their education and become successful in their lives. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her husband’s business to buy and raise more animals.  He's been in business for 15  years.

Kosar is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application.  In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit history and never missed a meeting. 

Note: Kosar is in the center of the photo.

loans.use: To buy animals for animal sales business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius M., 32 years old, is a single man who operates a motorcycle transport business popularly known as ‘bodaboda’ in Kenya; he also supplies household goods. Julius operates from Kahawa West, a highly populated area. He supports his parents with the income that he gets from his business. He was introduced to KADET by existing clients.

Julius’s transport and supplies business has been in operation for two years and it gives him a monthly profit of KES 13,000. With this loan of KES 40,000, his second loan with KADET, he intends to use KES 25,000 to increase his stock of food supplies and household goods and KES 15,000 to repair and build a carrier for his motorbike to enable him to transport many goods at once. Julius plans to plough back the extra profits into his supplies business since he gets many orders and some of his clients need him to extend credit periods. This will help him run the business comfortably. Julius hopes to expand his business and buy land where he can build his own house.

loans.use: to increase stocks of household goods and food supplies and build a carrier on his motorcycle

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran does embroidery to financially support her family. She learned this art from a technical training school and became skillful at it with regular practice. She receives regular orders from her neighbors, earning a good profit every month.

Nazeeran’s husband, N. M., is a cobbler by trade. He makes shoes on orders which he receives from different shoe factories and shops and provides them with the finished product on time to earn an income for his family. They live in a 2-room brick house in the city of Raiwind, Pakistan, famous for its dairy industry. Their house is in located in the area of Basti amin pura. Nazeeran has 5 children: 3 daughters and 2 sons. Three of them are getting their education while the other two aren’t receiving an education due to the family's poor financial condition.

Nazeeran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy required items such as nails, leather and shoe polishers in bulk in order to make larger quantities of shoes. That will help him fill larger orders on time and earn more income. Nazeeran is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, Nazeeran is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy required items for shoemaking

loans.name: Papei Ene Kameri

texts.en: Papei has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha for the last six years. She is 23 years old, married to Kameri K. and they have two children. Papei was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use it to buy 15 goats which she will rear and sell at a profit. In the future, Papei hopes to open a retail shop to diversify her income.

loans.use: to buy 15 goats

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel N., 36 years old, runs a retail shop in the very busy market of Bissil in Kajiado. He sells his goods to Bissil residents and livestock traders who come to Bissil every day. He is married to 42-year-old Irene Mwende, a farmer, and together they have three children: Mary, 15 years old and in form one, Judy, 10 years old and in class eight, and Anold, 5 years old and in class one. Daniel was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Daniel has been running his business for five years and his monthly income is KES 16,100. He also has a barber shop and green grocer shop to supplement his income. He plans to use this loan of KES 50,000, his first with KADET, as follows: KES 30,000 to  increase his stock of rice, sugar and  flour for sale in his retail shop;  KES 10,000 to repair his barber shop seats; KES 10,000 to stock his green grocery. If the loan boosts his business, he will expand it to the wholesale level.

Daniel dreams of having a big wholesale and store in the future and of buying a piece of land and building rental houses and a shop to operate from. He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: to increase his stock of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in Raiwind, a small city in Pakistan known for its dairy industry. She lives in the area of Basti aminpura in a 2-room brick house with her family. Her husband, J. A., is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to his passengers and drops them at their desired destinations. Naseem has no children.

A talented woman, Naseem operates a sewing business from her home. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns income for her family. She does this work to supplement the family's income. Additionally, she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife.

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine since her old machine doesn’t produce good work and takes too much time to sew the items. The new machine will help her do her work better and finish it more quickly. She has been operating this business for over 10 years and is hopeful that her profits will increase with the help of an investment. Naseem is a new lender with Asasah; this is her first loan application.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret W. W. is a 46-year-old married mother of three children. She lives in Kiembeni and runs a grocery store in Kongowea, Mombasa. She has been in the business for four years.

Margaret is borrowing her first loan from KADET and she plans to use it to purchase new stocks of potatoes to sell in Kongowea. She will use her profits to expand her business. She hopes to live a satisfying and successful life.

loans.use: to purchase new stocks of potatoes

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 38 year-old modest and single mother who lives in Ng’iya, which is about 90 kilometers west of the lakeside city of Kisumu. 

Janet operates a boutique in the Ng’iya shopping center where she sells clothing, footwear, and many other items to meet customer demand. She makes a monthly income of 30,000 KES from her business. She has requested her first loan of 10,000 KES to boost her business through the purchase of clothing and other items that are in demand by her customers. The festive holiday season is fast approaching, and Janet is optimistic that she will increase her profits due to the high demand for clothing during this season.

Being a single mother, Janet will use the profits from her loan to feed her family and buy more stock. Her hope is to see her business grow and expand.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Kilekon

texts.en:
Kilekon K. is 27 and is married to Sitat Kilekon, who is a farmer. Together they have three children whose names are Esiat, Kaapai and Irene. The children go to school and are in form three, class eight, and class four. Kilekon is a livestock trader in the Enkaroni open air market which is a very busy market in Kajiado. He sells his livestock to butchers in Kitengela and Kajiado for slaughter. 

Kilekon was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office. He has been running his livestock trading business for one year and he makes a monthly profit of 13,000 KES. Kilekon is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES with KADET to buy cows, goats and sheep for trading. 

Kilekon describes himself as hardworking and ambitious. His dream is to specialize in supplying livestock to Nairobi, Kenya meat commission slaughter houses. Kilekon is hoping that this loan will boost his business and enable him to open a butcher shop in the Bissil market.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats and sheep for trading

loans.name: Beatrice Ngina

texts.en:
Beatrice Ngina K., aged 38, runs a green grocery shop at Mlolongo Market, which is a busy market. She is married to Joseph Kioko.  The couple has  one son, who is 12 years old and in Form One. Beatrice was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET client.

Beatrice has been running her business for three years, and her monthly income is 26,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). This is her second loan from KADET.  She plans to use the loan to open another shop for selling fruits and vegetables. She hopes to save the income to fulfill her longstanding dream of buying a piece of land to build her home and rental houses.

Beatrice describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To open another shop to sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Solomon Oyieko

texts.en:
Solomon M. is twenty-seven-year-old single man from Kisumu City, a lakeside city on Lake Victoria. He runs a secondhand business at Kondele, a busy shopping center that is about 2 km. from the heart of the city. He has been in this business for the last six years. He has vast experience and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Solomon recently joined KADET in order to access microcredit. He has been awarded a 50,000 KES loan that he will use to buy more used clothing for sale.  He will use the profits to invest in the business by obtaining what his clientele demands.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por un familiar. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta ambulante de helados en un carrito. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Juana ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Juana es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Juana, 55, is a mother living with her family in a marginal urban area of the city of Chiclayo, quite a commercial zone located in Northern Perú.

She has a small general store in her home that a family member tends to.  They offer their neighbors and customers from the area diverse products for daily consumption and groceries.  The business is very well received.  She also is a street vendor of ice cream.  With these activities she is able to help her husband support the family.

The growing demand Juana has been experiencing lately in the store has made her think of enlarging it acquiring more products.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

Juana is quite a hard working woman of very good character.  People who know her hold her in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul T. is a Kenyan entrepreneur in the lakeside city of Kisumu, Kenya. He is married to Mary Apondi, who is a tailor. The couple has a son, Washington Otieno, who is in nursery school.

Paul runs a carpentry workshop where he makes and sells furniture on the premises. He operates his business from the populous open-air market of Kibuye, located near the heart of Kisumu Town. He has applied for his second loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he will use to purchase wood, velvet, and cushions for making sofa sets (couches). He will use the anticipated profits to buy his wife a sewing machine so the family can earn more income.

Paul hopes one day to own a big furniture shop in Kisumu as well as furniture shops in other parts of the city where his customers can get his quality furniture. He also dreams of buying a plot of land and building a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase wood, velvet, and cushions for furniture making

loans.name: Segundo Modesto

texts.en:
Segundo, his wife, and their four dependent children live in their own home. They have electricity and a small well for their home. They live just outside of the small city of Reque, which is twenty minutes to the south of the major northern city of Chiclayo. Reque is a primary transit point for trading fish and other products from the Pacific. The population primarily works in trade, raising animals, and on small farms.

Segundo is well respected in the community and has good references from his neighbors. He is popular with many because he frequently is the organizer of community-wide parties during holidays and festivals. He enjoys building community and helping people come together.
