Segundo is a farmer. He has a plot of land on which he plants tomatoes, corn, sweet potatoes, and pickling cucumbers. This will be Segundo’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa and his first experience with a financial institution. Segundo needs to hire laborers in order to harvest the produce from the fields. He will use the loan to pay the laborers. He hopes his current crop will yield good profits in order to be able to continue to plant and properly tend his next crops.

Segundo is very hardworking and has big dreams for his family. He hopes to be able to send all his children through a full course of school study and see them become professionals.

loans.use: To hire laborers in order to harvest the produce from the fields

loans.name: Eddy Mercedes

texts.es:
Eddy tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Eddy desea ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido, para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Eddy is 19 years old, is single and lives with her parents in the Mochumí district, a commercial farming area that belongs to the Lambayeque province found more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She is dedicated to selling catalog cosmetics. She sells those products among neighbors and friends. On a daily basis, she works to gain more customers since the more orders made from the company providing products, the greater her income. The business helps her to meet her personal expenses and to support her parents with economic support for the home.

Eddy wishes to expand her business by installing a shop for cosmetic products in her home. This way, her customers will have products at hand and will not have to wait until the end of the month when their orders arrive. For this, she needs more products and to achieve her objective, she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,000 "soles" from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand her business.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface, 25 years old, is a single man from Kisumu City, a lakeside town in western Kenya near freshwater Lake Victoria.  Boniface has been operating a carpentry business in Kibuye market, an open air market in the town of Kisumu, for the last six years.  He designs, builds and sells sofa sets. He is taking out a second loan of KES 40,000, which he will use to buy wood and cushions and to pay labor costs for workers who help him. He anticipates selling more as the festive season of December approaches. Boniface intends to use the profits he earns to buy a piece of land, build a house and then start his own family. Later, he plans to expand his business by constructing a big workshop in the city.

loans.use: to buy wood and cushions for making sofas and to pay his workers

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, reside junto a su esposa en el caserío Lagartera, una zona rural habitada por gente humilde y muy trabajadora, pertenece al distrito de Mórrope de la provincia de Lambayeque, el lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con ovejas, cerdos y aves de corral, les cría en algunos ambientes situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que llegan a visitarle quincenalmente. Adicionalmente trabaja como jornalero en los campos de cultivo de la zona. Estas actividades son de mucha ayuda para la economía por ello trata de mantenerlas del mejor modo posible.

Juan desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio durante la presente temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juan, 60, is married and has two children.  He lives with his wife in Lagartera, a rural area inhabited by humble and very hard working people.  It is part of Mórrope district, Lambayeque province, located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl that he raises in areas in his back yard.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that come by every two weeks.  He also works as a day laborer in nearby farms.  These activities are of great help for his economy so he tries to maintain them the best way possible.

Juan wants to get nutritionally balanced feed so that his animals will develop better and can then be sold for higher prices during the Christmas season which is when demand increases.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan that he plans to use to reach his goal.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Josephine Andiah

texts.en:
Josephine Andiah is a 56-year-old ambitious and hardworking mother of three children. She is married to Jackson, a church official. Their two children are aged between 18 and 14 years old and are in secondary school.

Josephine operates a tailoring business in Igunga Shopping Center in the county of Vihiga. She designs clothing for all genders and the business is doing well. She earns a monthly profit of KES 27,000 and the sky is the limit for her. She is taking out a loan of KES 80,000, which she will use to buy tailoring material and a sewing machine. Demand for clothing is high as the festive season approaches since parents will be buying new clothing for their children.  Therefore Josephine anticipates making a profit. She will use the profits to repay her loan and to support her family by providing for their basic needs. Her long term project is to one day own a tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy tailoring material and a sewing machine

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío San José, una zona rural habitada por gente humilde y muy trabajadora, pertenece al distrito de Mórrope de la provincia de Lambayeque, el lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con ovejas, cerdos y aves de corral, les cría en algunos ambientes situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que llegan a visitarla quincenalmente. El negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía familiar ya que gracias a él ayuda a su esposo, que trabaja como jornalero, en el sostenimiento de la misma.

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer bastante hogareña y entregada a su familia, las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer responsable y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que le necesitan.
texts.en:
María Magdalena, 31, is married and lives with her husband and three children in San José, a rural area inhabited by humble and very hard working people.  It is part of Mórrope district, Lambayeque province, and is located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl that she raises in her back yard.  When they reach a good level of development she sells them to merchants who come by every two weeks.  The business is of much help to her family’s economy because thanks to it she can help her husband, who is a day laborer, to support the family.

María wants to get nutritionally balanced feed so that the animals will develop better and be sold for a higher price.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that she plans to use to reach this goal.

María is a very home loving person who is dedicated to her family.  People who know her consider her to be a responsible woman who is always willing to help those who need her.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 40 años. Es casado y resiD. junto a su familia en el anexo Santa Rosa del caserío Lagunas, un lugar habitado por gente bastante humilD. y trabajadora, pertenece a L. provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más D. una hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio L. cual es atendida por su esposa. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes D. L. zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a L. buena calidad D. los productos que ofrecen y a L. buena atención que brindan, adicionalmente se dedica trabajar como agricultor. Con estas actividades se encarga D. sustentar económicamente a su familia.

L. creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarL. adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Vicente is 40 years old. He is married and resides with his family in the Santa Rosa annex of the Lagunas village, a place inhabited by humble and hard-working people, belonging to the Lambayeque province and found more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He owns a small store installed in his home which is attended by his wife. There they offer different consumable products to neighbors and customers in the area, among them basic necessities and groceries. The business is well-known due to the good quality of products that they offer and the good service they proviD.. Additionally, he is dedicated to working as a farmer. With these activities, he is in charge of supporting his family economically.

The growing demand that his store has been experiencing has maD. him think about expanding by acquiring more products. For this, he has seen fit to request a loan of 2,000 "soles" from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase products to expand her shop.

location.town: Anexo Santa Rosa - Lagunas - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana resides in the city of Samundri in Pakistan. She lives in a two-room house with her family:  a husband and 3 sons.  All 3 children are enrolled in school and study in different classes. 

Shabana's husband runs a restaurant where he sells Punjabi food such as naan chanay (a chickpea dish served with bread) and biryani (a rice dish served with pickle). He has been in this business for 10 years and has a good reputation in the area for high-quality food and good business practices.  Shabana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy items such as chickpeas, rice, cooking oil and spices in bulk quantities to make tasty, high-quality food for his customers. This will help him get an edge over competitors in the area and earn more profit. 

Shabana is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and improve his monthly income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has established a good credit record by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

In the photo, the woman with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Shabana.

loans.use: To buy restaurant supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Rueben Shihundu

texts.en:
Rueben has operated in the motorcycle transport business in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 32 years old and married to Elizabeth Auma.  They have two children.

Rueben was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend.  He is applying for a second loan of KES 30,000.  He plans to use the loan to renew his PSV license, service his motorbike and get new reflectors. He paid off his first loan well and in good time.  

Rueben hopes to buy his own taxi in future.

loans.use: To renew his license and service his motorbike

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is thirty-three years old.  He is married and he lives with his wife and their two children in the small town of Yencala Boggiana near the city of Lambayeque.  It is a rural area which is primarily populated by small farmers of animals.

For three years, Jose has raised animals in the yard behind his home.  He raises ducks, chickens, turkeys and other animals.  He also works as a stevedore for a local private company, where he earns a stable salary.  Jose’s wife is a seamstress.  She sews for local families and also produces clothing for sale in the markets.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional animals and feed in order to expand the family's livestock business.  They hope to be able to increase their income and assets so as to better provide for the education of their children.  Jose is dedicated to the success of his children and works hard every day to ensure that their future is bright.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals and feed

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna resides in Samundri, a small city of Punjab Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. She came here after her marriage, and she lives with her family in a 2 room brick house. 

Amna is 28 years old and has 4 sons, who she is raising with great care and discipline. All of the children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Amna believes in the importance of education so that her children will complete their studies and become successful in their lives.  

While Amna carries out her responsibilities as a housewife, her husband operates a cosmetics shop in the market. He started this business 10 years ago and it has proven to be a very good source of income for him. He sells different cosmetics products such as mascara, eyeliner, lipstick and nail polish.

Amna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his business. With a loan, he will buy cosmetics products in bulk quantity to sell at his shop. This will help him offer a greater range of products to his customers, so that he can make more sales and income. Amna is hopeful that an investment will be more productive for her husband and bring his business to a more profitable position. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attended every meeting. 

In the photo, the woman with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Amna.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Susana Wariara

texts.en:
Susana has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is 43 years old and married to Samuel W.. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She paid her first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

In the future, Susana hopes to grow her business and start selling all types of clothing under one roof.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: José Franklin

texts.en:
Jose is twenty-two years old.  He lives in the town of Morrope in northern Peru.  It is an agricultural region with many small farmers, field laborers and others who work in the agricultural sector.  Jose is married and lives with his wife and their child.  Their home is near the center of Morrope, an area which is more developed and has some significant trade and commerce.

In the yard behind their home Jose and his wife raise animals.  They feed and care for these animals in corrals until they reach the appropriate size for sale.  They sell the animals in the local markets and to neighbors.  In addition, Jose spends most days driving his mototaxi in the streets of the city and surrounding area, providing transportation services to residents.  He assists them in meeting their daily needs, getting to work, buying supplies and visiting friends.  He is proud of his ability to serve his community.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional feed for his animals and make repairs to the corrals.  He hopes to be able to increase the weight of his animals prior to the holiday season in order to take advantage of the increase in prices.  This will be his third loan with Edpyme Alternativa, and the largest loan.  He has used the prior credit responsibly and repaid punctually.  Edpyme Alternativa is glad to provide him with the opportunity to continue to use credit to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for his animals and make repairs to the corrals.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brindan. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 37-year-old mother who lives in Olmos district, an agricultural and rather commercial area that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small grocery store she runs from her home. That´s where she offers for sale a range of different everyday consumer products, including staples and groceries, to neighbours and customers from the area. The business is very well received because of the high quality of the products on offer as well as the good service provided. With the income she obtains from running the business she financialy supports her family. 

The growing demand experienced by her shop has made her want to expand it by acquiring additional products. That´s why she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Buy products to expand her business.

loans.name: Chrisitine Jepkemoi

texts.en:
Chrisitine has operated her pharmacy in Naivasha town for the last six years.  She is 40 years old and married to Joseph Jerop. They have four children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to restock her pharmacy with medicines that are running low.

In the future, Chrisitine hopes to add a clinic behind the chemist and run them concurrently.

loans.use: To restock her phamacy with medicine

loans.name: Noah Milia

texts.en:
Noah Milia, 24 years old, is a single businessman who lives in Nkoile village. He trades livestock at the busy market of Bissil in Kajiado. He sells his livestock to butchers in Kitengela and Kajiado for slaughter and to Kenya meat commission suppliers. He has been running his livestock trading business for two years and he earns a monthly profit of KES 55,000.

Noah was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. He plans to use this KES 80,000 loan, his first from KADET, as follows: KES 40,000 to buy cows, KES 20,000 to buy goats and KES 20,000 to buy sheep, all for trading. If the loan boosts the business, he will buy a pickup for transporting his livestock. Noah’s dream is to specialize in supplying livestock to the Nairobi Burma meat market and to the Kenya meat commission slaughterhouses. He describes himself as ambitious.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats and sheep for trading.

loans.name: Simon Mwangi

texts.en:
Simon, 37 years old, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eight years.  He has specialized in potatoes, which he sells to middlemen who then take them to the capital city, Nairobi.

Simon was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He cleared all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings and to hire casual workers to help him in planting. In the future, Simon hopes to start mixed farming and rear animals, starting with poultry.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings and hire casual workers to help him in planting

loans.name: Paul Kinuthia

texts.en:
Paul has operated a transport business in Naivasha for the last six years.  He is 33 years old, married to Jacinta Wairimu and they have three children.

Paul was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to buy a new reflector jacket and a helmet with the loan amount. Paul also hopes to buy his own lorry in the future which he will use to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: to buy a new reflector jacket and a helmet

loans.name: Tabitha Wairimu

texts.en:
Tabitha has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. She also practices dairy farming. She is 66 years old, married to I. Chege and they have four children.

Tabitha was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She is planning to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow. In the future, Tabitha hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a caring lady, preferring to stay at home and carry out her responsibilities as a housewife. She has 4 sons and 3 daughters. Four of them are studying at a nearby school while the others stay at home. Safia's husband is a private entrepreneur who operates a fruit selling business. He sells fruits from a shop located in the very busy market of Samundri, offering fresh seasonal fruits to his clients. By having a shop in the busiest market, he faces high competition every day with other fruit shops. To compete with them and become more successful than them, he has to keep his shop up-to-date with seasonal fruits to fulfill the timely needs of his customers and to make them his permanent customers.  

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business. He will use the loan money to purchase fresh seasonal fruits in bulk to sell to his customers. Safia is hopeful that an investment will help her husband increase his sales and income. She is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has established a good credit record by paying her installments on time.   

Note: In the photo, Safia is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Alice Kamene

texts.en:
Alice Kamene, 33 years old, operates a vehicle transport business between Nairobi, Mlolongo, Athi River and Machakos town. She is married to Mutua M. who is a driver by profession and together they have two children: a son named Enoch in class six and a daughter named Mutave in class two. Alice was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Alice has been operating this business for a period of two years and her monthly profit is Kshs 37,600. With the loan, she plans to purchase new seats for her Nissan transport vehicle. If this loan boosts the business, she will save until she buys another vehicle for transport.

Alice describes herself as hardworking and ambitious. She dreams of having many vehicles in the future for transporting people in all routes of Nairobi Estates and upcountry.

loans.use: To purchase new seats for her Nissan transport vehicle

loans.name: Joseph Gatoto

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old, married to Eunice Mbaire and has one child. He has been selling milk around Naivasha town for the last three years. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid back his first loan well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to open a permanent milk bar instead of going round selling his milk.
In the future, Joseph hopes to own a large dairy farm in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To open a permanent milk bar

loans.name: Olerai Ole

texts.en:
Olerai has been rearing animals to sell for the last six years in Naivasha town. He is 33 years old, married to Tomoini Olerai and has two children.
He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy five cows and fifteen sheep, which he will rear and sell later at a profit.
In the future, Olerai hopes to buy land from where he will practise zero grazing and also build his family home.

loans.use: To buy five cows and fifteen sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise for the holidays

loans.name: Anna Wanjiru

texts.en:
Anna Wanjiru K. is a 52-year-old widow with three children aged 20, 25 and 32. They live in Lodwar, Kenya. Anna has had a business selling clothes for the past 12 years and now has an income of 26,500 KES per month.
She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend. She is applying for her fourth loan, of 60,000 KES, from KADET, after paying off her previous loans successfully. With this loan she plans to buy five bales of second-hand clothes to sell during the Chrismas season.
In the future, she hopes to operate a bigger boutique and extend her services to the town centre.

loans.use: To buy five bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Jane Wanjiru

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old. She has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town for the last three years. She mainly walks round town supplying her produce to different customers.
She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid back her first loan well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.
In the future, Jane hopes she will be supplying foodstuffs to different institutions in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Roseline Kema

texts.en:
Roseline Kema T. is 43 years old and married to Joseph, a businessman, who brings in an additional source of income for the family. The couple has five school-going children and live in one of the towns within Eldoret, Kenya. Roseline has been dairy farming for 15 years and earns a monthly profit of 7,000 KES.
Roseline learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through marketing awareness carried out in her area. She is applying for her second loan of 30,000 KES from KADET, which she intends to use to buy dairy feed. With her anticipated profits, she plans to extend her poultry farming business.
In the future, Roseline wishes to have more poultry farms since both businesses have proved to be very profitable in her area. Her deeper desire is to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed

loans.name: Irene Wanjiku

texts.en:
Irene Wanjiku K. is 39 years old and single. Her residential place is in Lodwar-Kenya. She sells cereals and has been in this business for the past eight years with a monthly profit of Kshs. 23,000.

Irene learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer. She is applying for her second loan of Ksh. 50,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy two bags of rice, three bags of green grams, and one bag of beans. With the anticipated profits, she plans to purchase her own piece of land.

In the future, Irene wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, green grams, and beans.

loans.name: Betzabeth Julisa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA BETZABETH JULISA J. P. TIENE ACTUALMENTE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, ELLA ES CASADA, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CHOFER DE OMNIBUS INTERPROVINCIALES EN LA CIUDAD DE ICA, AMBOS TIENE 2 HIJOS DE 6 Y 8 AÑOS DE EDAD. LA SEÑORA BETZABETH SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MOLIDOS, ESPECERIAS Y ABARROTES EN EL MERCADO DE SAN ANTONIO, A PESAR QUE ELLA VIVE EN SUBTANJALLA SE DESPIERTA MUY TEMPRANO PARA LLEGAR A SU PUESTO EN EL MERCADO PARA VENDER SU MERCADERIA. REQUIERE EL PRESTAMOS PARA CAPITAL DE TRABAJO EL CUAL INVERTIRA EN SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Mrs Betzabeth Julisa J. Peño is 29 years old and married.  Her husband works as a bus driver on cross-province services.  He is based in the city of Ica.  They have 2 children aged 6 and 8.

Betzabeth sells ground products, spices and groceries in San Antonio market.  In spite of the fact that she lives in Subtanjalla, she gets up very early each morning to arrive at her market stall where she sells her merchandise.  She requires this loan to provide her with working capital which she can invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise for her business

loans.name: Teresiah Nyambura

texts.en: Teresiah has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years.  She is 48 years old, married to Joseph K. and they have one child. She heard about KADET from one of the field officers and this will be her sixth loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings and to pay for labor. In the future, Teresiah hopes to start a side business of livestock farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings and to pay for labor

loans.name: Samson Gathigi

texts.en:
Samson Gathigi, 32 years old, has been farming for the past seven years with an income of KES 9,500 per month. He is married to Gladys Muiruri, who helps with the farm. They have two children aged 5 and 6 years old.

Samson is taking his fourth loan with Kadet to buy an extra dairy cow in order to increase milk production on his farm to meet his clients' needs. He hopes to become the leading entrepreneur in dairy farming and to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy an extra dairy cow

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a resident of Samundri, a small city in the Punjab region of Pakistan, famous for its agriculture industry. She lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in the small housing colony of Ashrafabad. Khalida is a 50-year-old widow who stays at home and takes care of her family. She is a very responsible person and fulfills her household responsibilities very well. Khalida has 4 children: 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son operates a poultry farm business. He sells chickens to different butcher shops on order. Khalida's other children stay at home.

Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to help her son in his business. With the loan, he will buy chicks and chicken feed to expand his business. This will help him fill his customers' larger orders and increase his income. Khalida is hopeful that an investment will expand his business further and will result in better financial conditions for the family. Khalida is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, Khalida is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Kareema's Group

texts.en:
Kareema is a housewife who stays at home and does her household chores. She is a very responsible person who does her work with a good sense of responsibility and effort. Her husband, A. G., is a driver by profession; he drives a rickshaw. Kareema has 2 sons. Her elder son is also a rickshaw driver and her younger son works in a factory for a low wage and sells bangles on a part-time basis to different jewelry shops to supplement his income.

Kareema has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to improve her younger son’s bangles sales business. By investing loan money into his business, he will be able to sell a larger quantity of bangles to his clients and make more money for the family. Kareema is confident that by using his 10 years of experience in this business, he will successfully be able to improve its condition. Kareema is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, Kareema is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy bangles to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is applying for a loan to improve her brother's butchery business.  With the loan, he will buy chickens in larger quantity to sells to his customers.  He started this business four years ago and Rukhsana is hopeful that a loan will help him increase his income.
  
Rukhsana is a stay at home mom who is always ready to help her family overcome difficulties.  Her family lives in Samundri, Pakistan, a city known for its agriculture industry.  They live in a two room brick house. 

Her husband works in a factory. They have a son who is enrolled in a local school. 

Rukhsana is a regular loan user of Asasah.  She has built a good credit rating and never misses any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book is Rukhsana.

loans.use: To buy chickens for chicken meat selling business

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
La banca comunal “Rayito de Sol” es parte del centro focal de Collpani. Cuenta con  once integrantes este es su primer ciclo, diez son mujeres y un varón.  Cuando se conversó con el grupo ellas comentaron que tenían la esperanza de que este dinero, al ser invertido en su negocio les iría muy bien, en particular por que se aproxima la navidad y en estas fechas hay bastante movimiento económico.
Entre los negocios de las señoras, se cuentan con los referentes a la venta de lana de Vicuña, costura y trenzado de mantas,venta de zapatos, taller electrónico, venta de medias, venta de frutas, carpintería, venta de ropa, venta de deportivos.
La presidenta, la señora Janeth Mónica es una mujer joven de 25 años, que ya tiene un hogar conformado con su pareja y dos hijos.  El negocio de la señora Janeth es la venta de ropa en la Ceja de La ciudad de El Alto, realiza este negocio desde hace tres años.  Este ciclo ella ha planificado comprar pantalones para surtir el puesto de venta.
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención del Consultorio de Salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rayito de Sol" meets in the central offices of Pro Mujer in Collpani.  The group has 11 members and this is its first loan cycle; the group contains 10 women and one man.  When we met with this group they commented that they hoped that they would do very well with this money being invested in their businesses, particularly with Christmas approaching, which is a season when there is a lot of economic activity.

The businesses run by the men and women in this group include: the sale of vicuña wool, dressmaking, rug weaving, the sale of shoes, an electronics workshop, the sale of hosiery, the sale of fruit, carpentry, clothing sales and the sales of sporting goods.

The president, Janeth Monica, is a young woman who is 25 years old, who already has a household comprised of her partner and two children.  Janeth sells clothing in the La Ceja neighborhood of the city of El Alto.  She has had this business for 3 years.  This cycle, she is planning on buying pants to stock her sales post.

When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the care provided in the health clinic.

loans.use: to purchase pants

loans.name: Las Nevaditas Group

texts.es:
La banca comunal “Las Nevaditas” es parte del centro focal de Panamericana. Cuenta con  ocho integrantes, este es su primer ciclo.  Entre los negocios de las señoras, se cuentan con los referentes a la atención de una tienda de barrio, venta de papa, venta de lanas, venta de bañadores, venta de chanchos, venta de artesanía, sastrería y tejido de mantas.
La presidenta, la señora Rosmery es una mujer joven de 30 años,  tiene un hogar consolidado con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos.  El negocio de la señora Rosmery es la atención de una tienda de barrio, este negocio fue iniciado en su domicilio hace cuatro años.  Este tipo de trabajo le permite a la señora Rosmery lograr ingresos para su hogar sin descuidar la atención de sus hijos.  Su solicitud de crédito tiene el objetivo de aumentar la variedad de productos a la venta. 

Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención del Consultorio de Salud por que le atendieron bien.
texts.en:
The communal bank "The Nevaditas" is part of the focal center of Pan-American.  It consists of eight members.  This is their first loan cycle.  
Amonthe the business of the ladies are included tending a neighborhood store, selling potatoes, wool, bathing suits and the tailoring and weaving of blankets.  The president, Señora Rosmery is a young woman of 30 years.  She has a home shared with her husband and four children.  The business of the lady Rosmery is the tending of a neighborhood store.  This business was started in her residence four years ago.  This type of work permits Señora Rosmery to achieve incomes for her home without neglecting the tending of her children.  Her loan request has the objective to increase the variety of products for sale.  

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the attention of the Doctor's Health Office because they tended her well.

loans.use: To buy canned foods

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
MARIA MILAGROS M. V.; de 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Ella integra del grupo “TRABAJANDO EN ARMONIA” junto con 10 integrantes mas, quienes son muy entusiastas y emprendedoras.
Desde hace veinte años, la Sra. María se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. Se inicia en este negocio, porque siempre le ha gustado vender, además necesitaba generar un ingreso adicional a su hogar. María quien es madre soltera, con los ingresos que genera su pequeño negocio trata de cubrir todos los gastos de su familia.
La gran meta de María es tener una empresa de productos de limpieza, el reciente préstamo será invertido en los estudios de su hijo y en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, ella esta muy agradecida con los inversionistas y con la institución por todo el apoyo que ha recibido y promete cumplir con la puntualidad en sus pagos. (niños en la foto, hijos de los socios).
texts.en:
Maria Milagros M. V. is 45 years old.  She is single and has 2 dependent children.  She is a member of the “Trabajando en Armonia” (Working in Harmony) group together with 10 others who are very enthusiastic and enterprising.

For the past twenty years, Maria has been selling beauty products through a catalog.  She started out in this business because she has always liked selling and she also needed to make an additional income for her household.  Maria is a single mother.  With the income which she makes from her small business, she tries to cover all her family's expenses.

Maria's goal is to have a business selling cleaning products.  This loan will be invested in her son's studies and in buying merchandise for her business.  She is very grateful to those who will fund her loan and to the institution for the support which she has received.  She pledges to make her payments in a timely manner.  (The kids in the photo are the members' children).

loans.use: To pay for her son's studies and to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: 2 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La banca comunal “2 de Julio” es parte del centro focal de Panamericana. Cuenta con  nueve integrantes (en esta oportunidad estaban almorzando, también estaba la mamá de una socia, la señora de manta beis a rayas café y sombrero mostaza), este es su segundo ciclo y se encontraban muy conformes por que el no tuvieron tropiezos en el ciclo primero.  Entre los negocios de las señoras, se cuenta con: transporte público, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, costura de sacos de dama, venta de detergentes, venta de vajilla, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa y cobradora de minibús.

La presidenta, la señora  Marcela es una mujer que ya tiene un hogar consolidado con su esposo y sus dos hijos.  El negocio de la señora Marcela es la cobranza de los pasajes, en el minibús que conduce su marido.  Ella indica que trabajan en forma conjunta porque han comprobado que cuando ella maneja el dinero de los pasajes, tienen más ganancia.   Su solicitud es por Bs. 2500.- y será invertido en la reparación de la movilidad, compra de llantas y otros. Trabajan de lunes a domingo, de seis y media de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche.

Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el plazo de pago.
texts.en:
The “2 de Julio” (2nd of July) community bank is part of the Panamericana regional office.  It has nine members.  (In the photo the group members are having lunch.  One of the members' moms is also present - the lady in the beige shawl with coffee-colored stripes and a mustard-colored hat).  The group is in its second loan cycle and its members are very happy because they didn't run into any problems during their first loan cycle.  The ladies' businesses include: public transport, neighborhood store, clothing sales, sewing ladies' bags, detergent sales, crockery sales, shoe sales, clothes sales and minibus conductor.

The group's president, Marcela, is a woman who has a strong household together with her husband and two children.  Her business is collecting fares on the minibus which her husband drives.  She says that they work together because they have found that when she handles the fares, they make more profits.  She is requesting 2,500 bolivianos which will be invested in repairing their vehicle and buying tires and other parts.  They work from Monday to Sunday, from 6.30am to 9.00pm.

When we asked Marcela what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the repayment terms.

loans.use: To repair a minibus and buy tires

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak K., 42, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She produces clay pigs and earns about $2 per day.  Her husband is employed and earns about $1 per day. 

K. spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity and water and $65 on other necessities every month.  

She is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the famliy use

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng S., 29, is married and has two children.  They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  Pheng is employed at the factory, earning an income of about $3 per day.  She has to spend $20 on food, $5 on electricity and water and $20 on other necessities every month.  

Pheng is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her family.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La banca comunal “Hormiguitas” es parte del centro focal de Panamericana. Cuenta con  ocho integrantes,  este es su cuarto ciclo.  Las señoras manifestaron su bienestar por que tuvieron un ciclo sin mayores contratiempos.   Esperan que el ciclo que viene sea de igual manera, un ciclo sin problemas.  Entre los negocios de las señoras, se cuenta con: costura, costura de chamarras, venta de pescados, tejido a mano de guantes, venta de miel de abeja, tejido de mantas y venta de fresco y chantilli.

La presidenta, la señora  Wilma es una mujer joven, tiene un hijo.  Ella comenta que desde hace cinco años teje manoplas y las vende a una empresa que las comercializa por mayor.  Un familiar le enseñó a tejer.   Sin embargo, en esta oportunidad está solicitando crédito está destinado para iniciar un  negocio de venta de verduras en un puesto de su Zona, los días viernes y sábado. 
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta participar en su grupo, compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Hormiguitas” (Hard-Working Women - literally 'Little Ants') community bank is part of the Panamericana regional office.  It has eight members who are in their fourth loan cycle.  The ladies have demonstrated the well-being of their group by experiencing a loan cycle with no major setbacks.  They hope that their upcoming loan cycle will similarly present no problems.  The ladies' businesses include: sewing, sewing jackets, selling fish, hand-knitting gloves, selling honey, knitting blankets and selling fruit drinks and whipped cream.

The group's president, Wilma, is a young woman who has one child.  She says that she has been knitting mittens for five years.  She sells them to a company who then sells them wholesale.  A family member taught her how to knit.  However, the loan which she is requesting on this occasion will be used to set up a business selling vegetables from a stall in her district on Fridays and Saturdays.

When we asked Wilma what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes to take part in the group and share with her fellow group members.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Chheoun

texts.en:
Chheoun S., 29, is married and lives with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  S. is employed at the factory, earning an income of about $2.50 per day.  She spends $26 on food, $6 on electricity and water and $85 on other necessities every month.

S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for family use.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L., 57, is married and her family lives in the town of Sta. Josefa.  To make a living, she raises crops, mostly rice.

Lolita joined CEVI to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP  to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N., 49, is married and lives with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  N. weaves Cambodian traditional silk and sells fruit, earning an income of about $2.50 per day.  Her husband raises fish and grows rice, earning an income of $2 per day. 

N. has to spend $20 on food, $5 on electricity and water and $60 on other necessary expenses every month.  

N. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto J. is a farmer from the town of Sta. Josefa.  He owns and tills land where he plants rice crops.  He also hires some of his relatives to help work at the farm.  Loreto has been engaged in farming for more than a few years. He hopes for his harvest to increase so he can earn more money.

Loreto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Loreto is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rhyjil

texts.en:
Rhyjil C., 26, is from the town of Sta. Josefa.  She is married and has two children, ages 8 and 4.  To make a living, she plants and harvests rice.  Rhyjil also grows and fattens pigs and sells them in the market.

Rhyjil joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Rhyjil is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to buy farm supplies and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pig feeds

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Shirley plants and harvests rice. She also grows pigs in her backyard.  Shirley fattens the pigs and sells them in the market. 

Shirley joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Shirley is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs and pig feeds.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pig feeds

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Song N., 28, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province.  N. sells groceries and earns about $3 per day. 

Her husband is employed at the factory, earning about $3 per day.  N. spends $66 on food, $5 on electricity and water and $35 on other necessary expenses every month.  

N. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store.  In the future, she would like to use any profits to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Nourng

texts.en:
Nourn Y., 28, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  He is a construction worker earning about $2 per day.  His wife makes about $1.50 a day by working in a factory.

Y. spends $50 on food, $3 on electricity and water supplies and $40 on other necessary expenses every month.

He is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for family use.  In the future, he would like to use any additional profits to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 42 years old, owns a small shop located along the street where she sells soft drinks and food.  She typically makes around $ 3.20 in profit each day to support her family. 

Her husband is a motor taxi driver.  They have four children, two are single and the others are married.  Three are employed.  

Leng is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers.  She wishes to have more funds to increase her capital to purchase more necessary items to sell.  This is why she decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary items for selling.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat C., 46, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. His wife produces rice wine, earning an income of 3 USD per day. C. has to spend 20 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 25 USD on other necessary expenses every month. C. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s wife appears in the photograph because C. was not available.

loans.use: House repairs

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan L. is a 43-year-old married woman who currently lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang. She is a doctor in her community and treats all villagers who are ill. Chan L. started her job over five years ago. She is blessed with one child who is studying at university. Her husband is a businessman who sells a few products such as fast foods and soft drinks. Chan L. is running her business well because she has good skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. Chan L. wishes to have more funds to purchase some doctor equipment to use to provide her service. With the rest of her fund, she will pay the school fees for her child.

loans.use: To purchase some medical equipment and to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Sroy

texts.en: Sroy S., 31 years old, is a humble villager who lives in Kompong Chhnang province. She is a housewife who has many duties in her house such as cooking meals, cleaning house, caring for her children and managing property in and and around the house. She is married and blessed with two school-aged children, while her husband is a car taxi driver. Her husband picks up his customers from across the province to Phnom Penh city, and makes approximately $15 per day to cover the family’s daily expenses. Unfortunately, his car often breaks down during use. Therefore, Sroy S. has decided to seek a loan of $1000 from Kiva, which she will use to help her husband change the broken car.

loans.use: To change the broken car

loans.name: Ieng

texts.en:
Ieng S. U., 62, is an single father who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. He works as a craftsman and makes pipes to drain water.  His wife died some years ago.

Ieng lives with his two children, who assist him in his business. As a family, they typically earns an average of $6.60 per day to help cover their daily living expenses.  His children are single.

An old bridge in front of his house is broken down.  To fix this problem Ieng requests a loan to purchase material to make a new bridge.

loans.use: To purchase some material for making a new bridge for replacing the old one.

loans.name: Uong

texts.en: Mrs. Uong T. is a 31-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. Uong T. is married to Kat Krouen, aged 33. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has only one child, who lives at home. In the past, Mrs. Uong T. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to make the chore of plowing the farmland easier. Now she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. This will provide her with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: To buy her own cow.

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ramona del Carmen L. H., tiene la edad de 54 años habita en el Barrio Benjamín Zeledón, es casada y su esposo labora como albañil, ellos tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad que sobreviven de manera independiente, pero apoyan económicamente  a sus padres, la señora labora como conserje desde hace mas de 12 años, ellos son una familia muy humilde que habitan en una humilde vivienda que las paredes y techo se encuentran en condiciones precarias, y que amenazan la salud y seguridad de los que ahí moran, es para su préstamo que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan llevar a cabo estas remodelaciones para mejorar las condiciones en las que ella y su esposo habitan.
texts.en:
Ramona del Carmen L. H., age 54, lives in the Benjamín Zeledón neighborhood.  She is married, and her husband works as a bricklayer. They have two grown children who live independently.  However, the children help their parents financially.

She has worked as a janitor for over 12 years.  They are a very humble family, and they live in a humble home.  The walls and the roof are in precarious conditions.  This poses a health and a security threat to the people who live there.  That is why she is requesting a loan to buy building materials.  These materials will allow her to finish remodeling in order to improve the living conditions for herself and for her husband.

loans.use: Remodeling her home

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum C. is 40 years old and is a resident of Kompong Chhnang Province. To earn a daily income, Prum C. works as a police officer in his community, and has a proper salary every month. He has a life partner in his wife, who is a fish seller in the busy market. The couple has three children, all of whom are single. Because fish selling is the main way for his family to earn money, Prum C.’s wife wants to expand her business to a bigger size than it is at present in order to earn more profits. For this reason, Prum C. is applying for a loan for his wife to purchase more fresh fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish for selling.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. S. sells desserts, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed as a local primary school teacher, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. has to spend USD 11 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase pigs and chickens to raise. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy pigs and chickens to raise for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain the health of his plants

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn S., 29, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. S. is employed at the factory, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is an electronics repairman, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. has to spend USD 11 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase electronic spare parts, such as stereos, to expand her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To buy electronic spare parts to expand the business.

loans.name: Lilia Maria Filomena

texts.es:
Maria de 55 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo, tiene un puesto de venta de “bollos” (plato típico de las playas del Ecuador hechas de plátanos, pescado, maní envueltas en hojas de árbol). 

Siempre le gusto hacer bollos porque desde pequeña aprendió a cocinarlos, comenzó hacerlos en su casa y repartirlos a sus conocidos y vecinos para tener buenos ingresos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo su negocio a sido reconocido por personas y ahora reparte a un nivel mayor de producción. Trabaja haciendo los bollos desde las 03:00 de la madrugada hasta las 12h00 de la tarde. Vende cada bollo a $ 1.00 y tiene un nivel de producción de unos 100 bollos al día.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar maní, arroz, y pescado para hacer bollos a un mayor volumen. En el futuro quiere conseguir nuevos contratos en compañías para ofrecer los bollos y otras comidas.
texts.en:
Maria, age 55, lives in an urban zone called Guasmo.  She has a stand where she sells “bollos” (dishes that are typical on the beaches of Ecuador, they are made from bananas, fish, and peanuts wrapped in tree leaves).

She has always liked making bollos because she learned how to cook them when she was little.  She started making them in her house, and she would deliver them to her acquaintances and neighbors in order to get good earnings.  Little by little, and with effort, her business has become known.  She now delivers a greater amount.

She works making the bollos from three in the morning until twelve in the afternoon.  She sells each bollo for $1.00, and she makes 100 bollos a day.

She wants to use the loan to buy peanuts, rice, and fish in order to make a greater volume of bollos.  In the future she wants to get new contracts with companies in order to sell the bollos and other food.

loans.use: Peanuts, rice, and fish

loans.name: Mario José

texts.es: El señor Mario José C. V., es un joven de 29 años habitante del Barrio de la ciudad Rural de Ticuantepe, con su pareja de vida y sus dos hijos menores de edad, su pareja se dedica a realizar las tareas del hogar, el mayor de sus hijos estudia la escuela primaria, ellos son agricultores con una experiencia de más de 15 años, atreves de los años se han enfrentado a diferentes situaciones de infección de plagas que carcomen la producción ocasionándoles problemas económicos a la pequeña y joven familia, fue con el apoyo de su papa que lograron iniciarse en esta actividad, la cual hoy en día es el sustento económicos de los suyos, es para una mejoría en la producción que solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos que brinden un mantenimiento Fito-sanitario adecuado y aumente la producción y mejore día a día las condiciones socio-económicas de sus pequeños hijos. Este no es el primer préstamo de la familia C., ha sido para ellos de gran apoyo los antiguos prestamos y el equipo de Afodenic a notado el cambio positivo que la familia ha tenido a traves de esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario José C. V. is a 29 year old young man living in a neighborhood in the rural city of Ticuantepe with his life partner and two minor children.  His spouse is a housewife.   The oldest child is in elementary school.  

They have been farmers for over 15 years.  Through the years they have faces situations involving pest infestations that consume the crops causing economic problems for the young, small family.  

It was with help from his father that they were able to start out in this line of work which today is the source of support for his loved ones.  He is asking for funds to improve production; he needs to buy products to provide crop maintenance so that production will increase daily thus improving his children’s economic situation too.

This isn’t the C.’s family first loan.  Previous loans have been of great use to them and the Afodenic team has noted the positive change the family has had through this help.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Chhet Phally, 44, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temple. Phally rents a place for tourists at a tourist place in the province, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Phally has to spend USD 11 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  Phally is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase new furniture and office supplies for his education center.

loans.name: Yunieth Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Yunieth del Carmen B. L., es una joven de 27 años, madre soltera, habita en el Barrio de San Caralampio, ella es agricultora desde los 15 años la afectación de las plagas le han ocasionado muchos problemas a sus cosechas, fue gracias al apoyo de su papa que logro adquirir sus terrenos de siembras, a futuro espera sembrar nuevas cosechas que se consuman en masa y ayuden a su economía, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes  e insumos vegetativos  que brinden un optimo Mantenimiento Fito Sanitario y pueda construir su vivienda para el mejor desarrollo de su hijo pequeño, este sería su sexto préstamo y nos indica lo mucho que le ha sido de apoyo los otros préstamos y el cambio positivo que ha habido en las vidas de ella y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yunieth del Carmen B. L. is a young, 27 year old single mother living in the San Caralampio neighborhood.  She has been a farmer since she was 15 years old.  Her crops have been adversely affected by insect infestations.

Her father’s help made it possible for her to acquire the fields and in the future she hopes to plant crops that are consumed in mass and that will help her economy.  

For now she is asking for funds to buy fertilizers and farming supplies that will provide the optimum health and sanitation for the crops so that she will be able to build a house so that her young son can develop better.

This would be her 6th loan and she tells us how very helpful the previous loans have been and how much the lives of herself and her son have improved thanks to them.

loans.use: For crop care.

loans.name: Tol

texts.en: Mrs. Tol L., 50, has been living in the province of Kompong Tom since 2006. She is a married mother, blessed with six children. Four of her children are single and two are married, living in their own homes. She and her husband sell rattan furniture. They buy the handcrafted furniture in bulk on credit from the maker and then use their trailer to sell the furniture door-to-door around the community. Mrs. Tol L. goes with her husband to sell rattan. Mrs. Tol L.'s business is now running her very well because she sells her items at a reasonable price. In order to better satisfy the needs of the customers, Mrs. Tol L. is seeking a loan to stock more rattan cupboards to sell. (Tol L.'s husband is pictured here.)

loans.use: To stock more rattan cupboards to sell.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Vehari, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. It is famous for its agricultural industry. She lives there with her family in a three-room brick house in the area named 39-WB. She came here after her marriage.

Her husband’s name is S. A., and he is rickshaw driver. He owns his rickshaw and provides transport services to the passengers. Khalida lives in a combined family system where her brother-in-law also lives with them in the same house. He is also a rickshaw driver.

She has given birth to two children. Both are below three years of age and have not started going to school yet. Khalida herself is a housewife. She prefers to stay at home; she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and takes care of her children well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to repair his rickshaw, because his rickshaw is having problems and can't run for long enough. With the fully repaired rickshaw, he will continue to give his best transport services to the passengers and increase his monthly income.

Khalida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

Note: In the photo, the woman with a raised hand is Khalida.

loans.use: To repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev R., 31, is a low-income person living in Kompong Tom. To earn a living, Khiev R. built a stall next to her house, in which she raises many pigs to sell. Khiev R. is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband helps deal with the family’s financial situation by working as a salt trader. The family makes an income of approximately $6.20 per day. Unfortunately, their motorbike has often broken down during use. Because of that, Khiev R. has decided to seek a loan of $300 from Kiva, which she will use to replace the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace the broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her husband's shoe shop.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a mother of three daughters and a son. Her daughters are studying, while her son left his education after eighth class and started work to bear the financial burden of the family. He provides movie making services to people. He has a small shop in the market and offers his services to people at parties and marriage ceremonies. Razia lives in Vehari, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She lives there with her family in a three-room brick house in the area named 39-WB. She has been living here for the past 20 years.

She is a very caring and hardworking woman; she carries out her responsibilities of a housewife well and operates an animal sales business at her home. She purchases animals from the animal markets, raises them up, and sells them to customers for a profit. In this way, she generates income for the family that helps her pay the education fees for her daughters.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her animal sales business. With the loan, she will buy animals like goats and buffalos, and sell them at a profit. She is hopeful that this investment will further grow her business and she will be able to manage her household expenses better as a result. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

Note: In the photo, the woman with a raised hand is Razia.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Sahibzadi's Group

texts.en:
Sahibzadi lives in the small city of Vehari, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of 39-WB. She came here 10 years ago. Her husband, G. R., is a daily wage laborer. Shahzadi also supports her husband by working at labor jobs. She also manages her home very well by carrying out her responsibilities. She doesn’t have any children.

Sahibzadi has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her brother who is a rickshaw driver. He provides transportation services to his passengers and drops them off at their designated places. Currently, his rickshaw needs maintenance because its engine is creating problems which don't allow him to run it for long hours. With the fully repaired rickshaw, he can continue his work and provide the best transportation services to his passengers.

Sahibzadi is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, Sahibzadi is raising her hand.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation.

She has operated a business selling fried potatoes for over two years. She sells from her home to schoolchildren and neighbors. Caroline faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a café in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase blocks to construct her house. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan and improve her living standard.

loans.use: To  purchase blocks to construct her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 40 bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase firewood logs and pay for a business permit.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single mother with one son who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

For over 10 years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells at wholesale to her neighbors and food vendors. Christine faces the major challenges of theft and seasonality in her business. She hopes to build her own home and purchase a pick-up van to use to transport her goods. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase 50 sacks of charcoal and pay for a business permit. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business and her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and pay for a business permit.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in Vehari, a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and popular for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family in the area of 63-WB for over 15 years. She is married to M. Y. who has a construction supplies sales business. He sells supplies through his shop which is located in the market. He has been operating this business for many years and has a good reputation among his customers due to the quality items he sells.

Nasreen is a very helpful woman, supporting her family through her bangles business. Wearing bangles is very common among women and young girls. She sells a good quantity of bangles every month in the nearby areas and also to different jewelry shops. The money she makes from her business allows her to pay the utilities expenses.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to improve her bangles sales business. With the loan, she will buy different varieties of bangles such as steel, metal and glass in bulk, which will help her sell more and increase her monthly income. She is hopeful that an investment will take her business to a more profitable position. She is a new loan applicant with Asasah and hopes that it will bring her more profits.

loans.use: to buy bangles to sell

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan P., 42, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. P. raises ducks, earning an income of about USD 8 per day. His wife grows morning glories to sell, earning an income of USD 5 per day. P. has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase duck food. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy animal food to raise ducks

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widow with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a clothes-selling business for over three years, selling at retail and from home to her neighbors. Florence faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina does embroidery works to financially support her family.  She has a good number of clients in her surrounding area who give her regular orders every month which enable her to pay off the utilities expenses of her family and also save some money for a rainy day. 

She is married to M. A. who runs a medicine sales business.  He provides medicines to his customers and earns income for the family.  He also supplies medicines to different medical clinics and stores.

She has given birth to 4 sons. Unfortunately, none of them could attend to school because Sakina and her husband don’t have enough resources available to provide them with an education.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s barber shop.  Her brother also lives with her and runs a barber shop in the market.  From his shop, he provides hair cutting and shaving services to his customers.  With the loan, he will buy scissors, blades and shaving creams to better serve his clients. 
 
He started doing this business two years ago and Sakina is hopeful that an investment will make his business more profitable and he able to attract more customers as he provides them better services.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her brother. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy scissors, blades and shaving creams for her brother's barber shop.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long S., 29, is married and resides with his wife and a child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. S. and his wife grow morning glories, earning an income of about USD 7 each per day. S. has to spend USD 57 on food, USD 15 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use and more morning glory seeds. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and morning glory seeds

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is water. 

She has operated a beauty salon for over two years. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Noor faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season, she is able to get many customers visiting her beauty salon and hence earn more profit. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase hair oil and cosmetics for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair oil and cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives in Vehari, which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area named 63-EB with her family in a 3-room brick house. She moved here after her marriage. 

She is 34 years old, married to A. G., who is 38 years old and runs a grocery store in the market. He sells daily use items like cooking oil, sugar, spices, etc. from his shop. He has a good number of customers due to his good customer dealings and cheap rates on each grocery item. 
Zarina supports her family by selling clothes. She purchases clothes, wholesale, from a city called Multan and sells them to her local area clients for profit. She has 6 children. Three of them are studying, while the others remain illiterate due to limited financial resources.
