Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity, which will help him sell more to his customers and make more money. She is hopeful that by investing loan money in her husband’s business he will be able to provide better financial support to his family by increasing his profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes it will be a good experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Zarina.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um P., 59, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. P. is a housewife and her three children are all employed at the factories, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. P. has to spend USD 47 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Thab

texts.en: Thab C. is a 46-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with four children, all single.  One of them is a hairdresser. Her husband, Doul Sophat, is 55 and works in the farming business. Thab C. inherited the farmland where she and her husband grow different kinds of crops from her grandmother. They grow different kinds of crops on their land, such as watermelon and morning glories, which they will sell to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Currently, Thab C.’s child wants to expand his business by purchasing essential equipment, but he lacks some funds to make it possible. Therefore, Thab C. is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva through HKL to use for helping her child’s business to buy some equipment for cutting chairs. With the remainder of the money, she will buy watermelon seed for ongoing planting.

loans.use: To buy some equipment for cutting chairs and to buy watermelon seeds .

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a food-selling business for over one year, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Rehema hopes to open a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is a resident of 63-WB, which is a small area located in the city of Vehari in Pakistan. She lives in a 2-room brick house with her husband and a son. 

Manzooran supports her family by selling goats. She has been in this business for the past five years and does this to supplement the income of her family. She purchases young goats at cheap rates from the animal markets, raises them, and sells to customers for good profit. While she’s raising them, she gives the goats good food and takes care of them so they become healthy. 

Her husband has a private job, but in his spare time he works in the field and grows seasonal crops.  Her son is illiterate. He couldn’t get an education due to poor financial conditions, so now he is a laborer.

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her goat selling business. With the loan, she will buy some goats to sell for profit. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Manzooran.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng C., 33 years old, owns a small shop in front of her house. She sells soft drinks and fast food, perfume, and plastic products. She typically makes around US$ 5 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. Her husband is a building worker who spends much time in the construction field. Heng C. now has two school-aged kids. Heng C. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations, which she uses with her customers. To earn extra income, she would like a loan from Kiva to purchase additional fast food and plastic products items for selling.

loans.use: To purchase additional fast food and plastic products items for selling.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has a business selling clothes. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Alice faces a major challenge of seasonality. During festive season, there is high demand for clothing, while during the months of January to July, few customers purchase clothes. She hopes to expand and establish a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a wife of N. H.. She lives in Vehari, Pakistan. Vehari is a small city known for its agriculture industry. She lives in a two-room brick house in the area named 63-WB with her family. 

Kalsoom is a caring lady, who prefers to stay at home and carry out her responsibilities of a housewife. Her husband is a mason. He provides his services to building constructors by doing construction work for them. 

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy masonry tools, which will help him to do his work more efficiently. Her husband is the only breadwinner of the family and Kalsoom is hopeful that through this investment he will be able to improve his working conditions and improve his standard of work.

loans.use: To buy masonry tools

loans.name: Somnang

texts.en: Somnang K. is 29 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She and her family live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh.  Somnang and her husband are garment factory workers. They do not have transportation to get work so they pay a lot of money to commute. Somnang is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees for his younger siblings. 

He has operated a charcoal selling business for over six years, selling at wholesale and from door to door to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge in the business is competition from other charcoal business operators. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business. With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Mrs. Pech S. lives in the capital, Phnom Penh.  Pech S. has been working since 2007, and she generates a profit of approximately US$ 3 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses.  Her income also provides stability to the family. Her husband is a construction worker in the community. They have been married for many years, and do not have any children. Pech and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking, because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Pech has requested a loan in the amount of $700 to be used to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mann S. is 41 years old, widowed, and has one child who attends 12th Grade. They live along National Road Number 5, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Mann has been a mason for almost 20 years. He is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, cooking oil and washing soap.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon R. is 39 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than eight years. She sells fish from her husband’s fishing, or she buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Sum Rors, 40, who fishes in the lakes of his community. The couple has two unmarried children, and they are still living under their roof. 

Suon R. faces difficulty with transporting her items because she doesn’t have her own vehicle. Therefore, Suon R. has decided to ask a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in to purchase a used motorbike to pick up the fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike for transporting her fish

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao M. (in the photo), and his wife, Kim Chankresna, live along National Road 5, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1989 and have seven children — three sons and four daughters. 

Mao has been fishing since 1990. His wife sells the fish that he catches in the local market. Mao is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase a horse and cart that he hopes will become another business: for a fee, Mao will use the horse and cart to carry goods for his fellow villagers.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and a cart.

loans.name: Maqbool's Group

texts.en:
M. has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a butcher by profession and runs a butcher shop in the market. From his shop, he sells chicken meat to his clients and earns money. With the loan, he will buy chickens so he can sell more fresh, quality meat. He will also buy a sharp knife for the butchering. M. is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.
 
M.'s husband has worked as a butcher for over 15 years and is the only breadwinner in the family. M. is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her husband and that her family will be better off financially. 

M. has given birth to 2 sons. Her elder son is in the first grade, while the younger is only 4 years old and has not start attending school yet. She is the resident of an area called 34-WB, which is located in a small city called Vehari in Pakistan. She has been living there since her marriage. She prefers to stay at home, manages the household chores  and takes care of her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens for a butcher shop

loans.name: Yut

texts.en:
Yut R. (in the photo) and her husband, Chhoung Vat, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1979 and have seven children. 

Yut was a silk weaver for more than 15 years, but she quit weaving on her loom because the price of silk fabric dropped.

She now wants to start weaving again because weaving is a traditional profession. Yut is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house without electricity or running water, and her greatest monthly expense is clothing.

She operates a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and those who pass by the shop. Purity faces high competition from other retail shop operators, and she hopes to expand her business and become a wholesaler.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice, maize and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, rice, maize and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dasak

texts.en:
Mrs. Dasak S. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Sophak Horng, have been married since 2007. They have two young children: one son and one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

To support the family, Dasak sells rice at home. Recently, she decided to try to supplement her income by selling groceries, too. Her husband is a full-time worker in Phnom Penh. She is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase additional grocery items for resale purposes.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira (pictured with her hand raised) is a 36-year-old, married woman living with her family in a small city called Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari, she explains, is famous for its agriculture industry. She and her husband have four daughters and one son. All of her children, except for her 9-month-old son, are currently attending school. She and her family live in a small home consisting of three rooms in the area named 34-WB. She is married to M. A., who operates a tailoring shop in the market. He is an expert at sewing men's clothes and is very well known in their area for the quality of his work.

To earn a living, Nasira runs a sewing business. More specifically, she receives regular orders from her neighbors due to her ability to finish her work on time and to provide quality work. She generates income each month, which she uses to pay her children's school fees. She also runs another business of selling cosmetics from her home. Ladies from neighboring areas come to her home to purchase cosmetics.

Nasira has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her cosmetics sales business. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy cosmetics such as lipstick, mascara, eye liner, and nail polish in bulk quantity to sell to her customers. She is hopeful that an infusion of capital will enable her to generate an increase in her business's sales and, in turn, her profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah, so this would be her first loan through Asasah.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem K. (pictured) is a 40-year-old, married woman. Her husband, Mr. Dara Roeun, is 45 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, approximately 15 kilometers from the city. They have been married since 1991 and they have three children: two sons and one daughter.

To earn a living, Sem is a tailor, but she also sells sugarcane juice at her home to generate additional income. She is seeking her first loan in the amount of $200 to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem C., 31, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. C. is employed at the garment factory, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband sells salt, earning an income of USD 4 per day. 

C. spends USD 45 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband to transport salt. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and trailer to transport salt

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and running water, and her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a movie shop and her major customers are local residents. She also operates a tailoring shop which contributes as another source of income. Pauline's business is seasonal, which is a major challenge. She hopes to expand in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of movie tapes and DVDs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of movie tapes and DVDs.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Phun P., 50, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. 

P. sells brooms, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. P. spends USD 45 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. 

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase rice stock to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy rice stock to sell

loans.name: Chhorng

texts.en:
Chhorng T., 48, is a young woman and the mother of two children. To earn a living, she owns a small store where she sells food and soft drinks.  The store is in a good location to increase her income.

She has a life partner in her husband who is a building worker in the construction field. The family normally earns an average of $3.5 per day to help cover their daily living expenses. 

Chhorng T.’s house was broken because of the heavy rainy season, and part of the house was destroyed. To solve this problem, Chhorng T. is requesting a loan to repair a part of her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen S., 38, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. 

S. sells used clothes, earning an income of about USD 15 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 0.5 per day. S. spends USD 35 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more used clothes to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to resell

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat S., 47, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. 

S. produces hand made brooms to sell, earning an income of about USD 1 per day. Three of her children are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 each per day. S. spends USD 45 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 35 on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a resident of Nkubu Town in North Rift, Kenya. For 15 years, he has been engaged in the farming business. More specifically, he grows and sells wheat, potatoes, beans, and onions, which are all sold locally. He has four farmhands that assist with his business operations.

He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 55,000 KES ($700) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry and a water tank. Notably, this would be his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo. His first loan, which was in the amount of 45,000 KES, was successfully repaid. He plans to venture into poultry farming and goat breeding to boost his income. He feels that the tank he is seeking will help a great deal to irrigate the farm. He explains that his largest challenge remains diseases, especially anthrax and pneumonia.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing poultry and a water tank

loans.name: Hajiraan's Group

texts.en:
Hajiraan (pictured with her hand raised) is a 53-year-old, married woman. She lives with her family in an area named 34-WB, which is located in a city known as Vehari in Punjab Pakistan. Vehari, she explains, is known for its agriculture industry. Hajiraan is married to F. S.. They have been living in this area for many years in a 2-room brick house. She is a housewife, who prefers to stay at home and to carry out her responsibilities at home.

Hajiraan is a new loan applicant of Asasah. She is applying for a loan for the benefit of her son, who is a butcher by profession and who runs a butcher shop in the local market to earn a living. From his shop, he sells chicken meat to his customers and thereby earns income for the family. He plans on utilizing the loan proceeds to buy chicken in larger quantities so that he can both satisfy customer demand and generate an increase in his income. He only has 2 years of experience in this business, but due to the quality and freshness of his meat, he has been able to attract a loyal client base in a short period of time. Hajiraan is hopeful that, with the loan proceeds, her son will be able to bring about positive changes to his business and to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To expand her son's business by purchasing chicken in bulk

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is a housewife who spends most of her time doing her household responsibilities and taking care of her children. She has given birth to a son and 2 daughters. Her son is studying in class 2nd while her daughters are below 4 years of age and have not started attending school yet. 

She is a resident of 34-WB which is a small area of the city Vehari. Vehari is located in Punjab, Pakistan and is famous for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for over 8 years. 

Her husband ‘s name is A. G. and he runs a grocery store in the market. He sells daily use items to his customers like salt, sugar, milk, etc. By the grace of God he has good loyal customers who always prefer to buy from him due to his good quality products and cheap prices. 

Rubina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity to sell in his store. Rubina is hopeful that this investment will have a positive impact on her husband’s business and increase his monthly income as well. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will bring positive changes to her family’s financial life.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a kiosk (retail shop) for the past three years, selling from home to her local community. Janet faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop and open a beauty shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase paraffin, bundles of maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase paraffin, bundles of maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya. He is married with ten children aged between twenty-four and twelve. He engages in mixed farming producing maize, sugarcane, bananas and milk which are all sold locally.

He has applied for this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his animal trade.He hopes the loan will earn enough income to enable him to sell a variety of animals not just the cattle he has been selling. He really wants to uplift his family's standard of living through the income.

He also lacks enough capital to buy farm inputs like fertilizers.

loans.use: purchasing animals for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. He used to work as a traveling furniture carpenter for almost 10 years.  As of June 2010, he opened his own carpenter shop and he is very thankful for his decision and feels very comfortable owning his personA. business. He is working to modify his business operation; he works closely with locA. furniture galleries and he also gets new catalogs to offer good service to his clients. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase new tools and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and invest in a new wood-sanding machine

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im S., age 42, lives in the province of Kampong Chhnang. She is a sewing worker in the factory industry, and she has been working since 2005. Im S. is a married woman who is devoted to her three children, all of whom are single, studying in school and dependent on her care. Im S.’s husband works as a policeman and has a fixed salary every month. Im S. has been paying money for taxis to get to work because she doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, she is applying for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle, which will allow her to commute to her work location.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle, which will allow her to commute to her work location.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a married man with one child who is too young to go to school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He operates a coconut selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. Antony faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During hot summer season, fewer coconuts are available in the market. He hopes to become a real estate agents in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to start a video library, purchase a video machine and chairs for the viewers in his video library.

loans.use: To start a video library, purchase a video machine and chairs for the viewers in his video library.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of  a dairy cow

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz lives in Arifwala, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area called Muhallah Eid Gah which is a small residential area of the city. She came here after her marriage. 

She supports her family with her profession, working as a midwife. She also sews clothes in her spare time and earns money from her neighboring clients. Her husband’s name is M. K. and he operates a dairy business at his home. For this purpose, he keeps buffalo and gets milk to sell to his nearby customers. Her brother also lives with her. He is a driver by trade and drives a rickshaw. 

Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will help him increase the milk productivity and his sales as well. Mumtaz is hopeful that an investment will be very productive for her husband’s business and her family will be able to have a better standard of living. 

She is the mother of 2 daughters who have not started to attend to school yet. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she built up a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business

loans.name: Preap

texts.en:
Preap S. is a 27-year-old woman, married to Khaim Rithy, age 24, and they currently live in the province of Kompong Chhnang. This couple has one young child and earn a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. 

Preap S. is concerned that she needs to repair her house. Preap S. would like to request a loan which she will use to purchase material for repairing part of her house.

loans.use: To purchase material for mending part of her house.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He operates a cattle and goat meat selling business, and sells to the local residents at wholesale. In addition he sells fish which contributes as another source of income. Mohammed faces a major challenge of drought in his business. He hopes to open a butcher shop in the future.

Antony decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve his business. With the Kshs 80,000 he wants to purchase more cows and goats.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and goats.

loans.name: Hom

texts.en: Hom S., 28 years old, owns a small wooden house and a grocery shop, where she sells many items, including cooking ingredienst, sweets, soft drink, shampoo, and plastic products. Hom S. retails her inventory to people who are passer-bys and are also her neighbors who live near her house in the province of Kompong Chhnang. She has been running a grocery investment for two years ago and earns an average of $3 a day. To assist with the financial stability for the entire family, her husband works as policeman. The couple have no children. Hom S. is taking out her loan to increase her inventory by purchasing some essential items to sell.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by purchasing some essential items to sell.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to passengers and drops them at their designated places. His rickshaw is creating a problem nowadays which is affecting his work and income. He will utilize the loan in repairing it so, he can continue his work and provide his services to the passengers.
 
Naseem is a mid-wife. She adopted this profession a few years ago to financially assist her husband. In Pakistan midwifery is a profitable profession because many poor people can’t afford hospital fees and they prefer to approach midwives.  In her spare time she also does embroidery work for her neighboring clients to earn extra income for her family. 

She has given birth to 5 daughters who are enrolled in school and getting their education. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has  built up a good credit history and never missed any meeting.  

She comes from Arifwala, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in an area called Muhallah Eid Gah which is a small residential area of the city.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Rv - Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 37 years old and is married with three children between the ages 13 and 21 years old.  Currently she is the only member of her family who works.  She works hard to provide for all the needs of her children.  Chantal owns a small business selling decorations.  She has had her business for 1 year and her store is open from 8 am until 8.30pm.

Chantal has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business and to increase the materials she requires for decoration. With the extra profits, Chantal will keep reinvesting in her business for the purpose of being financially stable and she will also start saving for her future.

loans.use: To increase stock for a decoration shop

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still young for school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a retail shop. Her customers are neighbours and passersby. Phoebe faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to become a mobile phone seller in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to start a mobile charging shop, purchase mobile chargers and electrical extensions. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: To  start a mobile charging shop, purchase mobile chargers and electrical extensions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Ourng

texts.en: Ourng R. is an elderly villager who lives with other family members in Kampong Chhnang Province. She cultivates a rice crop to make a living. She is a widow blessed with eight children, four are married, and the remaining four are single. Three of them are working in various occupations, and have a salary. They share their earnings with Ourng R. to support the daily expenses of the whole family. Ourng R. has another farm that she owns, but she has not yet planted crops on it. Ourng R. hopes to use her Kiva loan to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer for growing crops.

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
Zakia is a resident of Arifwala which is a small city in Pakistan, located in Punjab province. It is known for its agriculture industry. Zakia lives there in the area called Mullah Eid Gah which is a small residential area of the city. She came here after her marriage to A. R.. She has 4 children. Three daughters are enrolled in school while her son is below 4 years of age and has not started to attend school yet. 

She supports her family financially by doing embroidery work for her neighboring clients. Her husband is involved in a construction supplies sales business. He provides construction supplies on order to his customers and generates income for the family.
 
Zakia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sand in larger quantity and improves his business. He has been in this business for some time now and Zakia is hopeful that through a loan investment he will successfully be able to improve his business conditions by serving more clients. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zakia.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supplies sales business

loans.name: Alice V.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Ahmadiyya Primary School, in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1947 by the Ahmadiyya Mission. Currently the school is staffed with fourteen teachers and has an enrollment of 400 pupils.    

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 8,750,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone cannot do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials, some a piece of land, pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest the loan in business. 

Alice V. K. (first row right) is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Magburaka town, Alice is married with four children – three in primary school and one in secondary school. Alice V. K. has been in the teaching profession for sixteen years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy market food - rice, palm oil, etc. in large quantity to sell. In this way, Alice will be able to earn more money that will supplement her monthly salary, thereby improving her livelihood.

loans.use: Buy market food - rice, palm oil, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Horticultural farming inputs

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a vegetable stall, selling bananas, tomatoes, maize and green vegetables. In addition she sells paraffin and also buys and sells goats which contribute to her other source of income. Eunice faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of bananas, tomatoes and green vegetables.

loans.use: To  purchase bundles of bananas, tomatoes and green vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow and an oven

loans.name: Shamim Khadim Hussain's Group

texts.en:
Shamim K. H. is married and has four children, a daughter and three sons. Two of them study, while the other two stay at home. Shamim is a resident of Arifwala, a small city of the Punjab, Pakistan area and known for its agriculture industry. She lives in the district named 69-EB. She came here after her marriage.

She supports her family by selling milk. For this purpose, she has a buffalo at her home that gives her good quantity milk every day which helps her to fulfill the needs of her customers. Her husband runs a grocery store in the market where he offers his customers daily use items like milk, salt, sugar, etc. They both work hard to provide their children with the best living conditions.

Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her husband. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family. With the loan, Shamim’s husband will stock up his grocery store and improve his sales. Shamim is hopeful that such an investment will have a positive impact on her husband’s business and increase his income.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy stock for her husband's grocery store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a single woman who lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water bills. 

She operates a retail shop, selling soft drinks, rice and maize flour. She sells to local neighbours and passersby. Esther faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in his business. She hopes to take a bigger Kiva loan to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and soft drinks for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Raheela Muhammad Aslam's Group

texts.en:
Raheela M. A. lives in Arifwala, a small city in the Punjab, Pakistan area known for its agricultural industry. She lives in the district named 69-EB with her family in a two-room brick house. She is a caring lady who prefers to stay at home and carry out her responsibilities as a housewife. She has two sons, four and six years old, who have not started to attend school yet. Her husband works in the field and grows cotton, wheat and other seasonal crops to earn an income for the family.

Raheela has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her husband’s business. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her. With the loan, her husband will buy seeds and fertilizer for his field. He has been a farmer for many years, and Raheela hopes that her husband will be able to increase his field’s output by using this loan for it.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Raheela.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for their farm

loans.name: Fawe Girls Waterloo Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the FAWE Girls School. The school is located in Waterloo, a small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This school was founded five years ago by Dr. Christiana Thorpe to educate girls, especially war-affected children. Currently, the school is staffed with ten teachers and has an enrollment of 400 pupils.

These hardworking and dedicated teachers have come to SMT to seek a loan of 12,700,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone cannot do. Some of them will use the loan to buy furniture, others to buy housing materials, a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest their portion of the loan in a business.

Denka M. is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone, Denka is married to a teacher, and the couple has two children. Denka is seeking a loan portion of 700,000 SLL from SMT and Kiva lenders in order to buy furniture for his newly-built house.

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. is the father of three children from 2 to 16 years old. He does mixed farming in his hometown of Nkubu in North Rift, Kenya. He produces sunflowers, wheat, beans, maize, potatoes and peas, which he sells locally. He also plans to expand both his poultry and dairy farming by constructing a modern grazing unit. Unreliable rainfall and animal diseases are his major challenges.

Peter's first first loan of 45000 KES was paid back. For his second loan, he has requested 55000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank  and fertilizer. He hopes the tank will help him install an irrigation system in his farm to counter unreliable weather conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her courses at the university

loans.name: Kubra's Group

texts.en:
Kubra M. A. lives in Arifwala, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives in the area named 69-EB in a two-room brick house. She supports her family financially through her cosmetics business. She runs a shop near her home where she sells  products such as lipsticks, eye liners, mascara and nail polishes to her clients. 

She is the mother of two daughters. Her elder daughter is studying in eighth class while her younger one is in fifth class.

Kubra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his business of selling construction supplies. This is her first loan. He mainly receives orders from construction companies and gets good profits by completing them on time. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies like sand, bricks and cement in bulk quantity that will help him to fulfill larger orders on time and serve more clients. 

Kubra is hopeful that the investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and he will be able to earn more income for the family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kubra.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her husband's construction supplies business

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 30 years old and in business. She operates "Unique Salon" in a residential estate of Nairobi. She employs three people and serves the estate residents. She is requesting for a loan of 90,000 Kes, to renovate her business premises and purchase more dryers. 

Aileen is single and very hardworking with a five year plan of opening more outlets in Nairobi. She has been in this business for four years.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises and purchase more dryers

loans.name: Ponclat Juvet

texts.fr:
IL fait de l’alimentation en plein étalage au marché, après ses études universitaires, n’ayant pas trouvé un poste de travail, il se lance dans le commerce des produits d'alimentation et des divers . Célibataire sans enfant,il est  en activité depuis 8 ans .
Par jour  en temps normal, il vend 50.000f, le prêt passé a été une école,   les différentes formations reçu lui ont ouvert l’esprit.
Il  veut recevoir  le nouveau  prêt et faire des stocks afin de vendre plus pendant la période des fêtes de fin d’année. IL va acheter : 10carton des biscuits, 10 cartons de bonbons ,biscuits, chocolat,5cartons des jus à pipette pour les petits enfants, 2cartons de lait en poudre, 2 cartons de lait concentrés, 2 cartons de sardines 1carton de pots de mayonnaise, 1cartons de macédoines, 1 carton des petits pois. En vendant  beaucoup pendant cette période des fêtes, il va augmenter ses épargnes.
Très ambitieux, il veut ouvrir  une boutique pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
This man displays his food in the market. After his university studies he was not able to find a job and thus set himself up in the business of selling food products and other items. He is a single man without any children and he has been working for eight years. In a normal day he sells 50,000 francs of goods. The last loan he received was for school and the different training he has had has opened his mind. 

He would like to get a new loan to build up his stock, in order to be able to sell more during the end of year festive season. He is going to buy: ten boxes of biscuits, ten cartons of candy, biscuits and chocolate, five cartons of juice with straws for small children, two cartons of powdered milk, two cartons of concentrated milk, two cartons of sardines, one carton of pots of mayonnaise, one carton of mixed diced vegetables and one carton of peas. By selling a large quantity of products during this festive season he will increase his savings. He is very ambitious and would like to open a shop to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase of cartons of milk, canned foods, spaghetti and bags of sugar

loans.name: N'babah Kalimusu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Peninsula School III, in Waterloo, a small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. 

This school was founded in 1961 by The Seven Day Adventist Mission (SDA) to provide education for the children of the community. Currently the school is staffed with 70 employees and has an enrollment of 2500 pupils.    

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT to seek for a loan of SLL 10300000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful projects that their salaries alone cannot finance. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture; others, to buy house-building materials. Some will buy a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while others will invest the loan in a business. 

N'babah C. is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kambia, northern Sierra Leone, N'babah is married to a businesswoman and the couple has six children, three of whom are attending primary or secondary school. Mr. C., who has been in the teaching profession for 34 years, is requesting this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Femme vendant les fruits de saisons tels que safous,  ananas, oranges, citrons, avocats, bananes, mangoustans, mangues qu’elle achète dans les marchés ou les camions qui viennent de l’intérieur du pays, elle fait la vente en gros et détails et est exerce ce commerce depuis 1978.

Le prêt passé, lui a permis d’acheté au comptant ses fruits et elle peut maintenant connaître son chiffre d’affaire.
Sa vente journalière sont passées de 15000f à 40000f par jour.
Avec le prochain prêt, elle va achetée les caisses et filets de fruits comme : safous, mangues greffées, mangoustans litchis, citrons, papayes et avocats.
Son commerce dépend de la demande et des saisons car pour chaque période de l’année, elle sait quoi vendre.
Elle est dans un coin stratégique  et veut en profiter pour faire plus de bénéfices afin d’atteindre ses objectifs. 

 Pour ses enfants, elle veut contribuer totalement à leurs éducations scolaires.
texts.en:
This lady sells seasonal fruits such as safous, pineapple, oranges, lemons, avocados, bananas, mangosteens and mangoes, which she buys in markets or from lorries that come from inland. She sells on a wholesale and retail basis and has been carrying out this business since 1978.

The previous loan she had allowed her to buy fruit for cash and she can now assess her turnover. Her daily turnover has increased from 15,000 francs to 40,000 francs. With the next loan she is going to buy cases and string bags of fruit such as: safous, mangoes, mangosteens, litchis, lemons, papayas and avocados. Her business is dependent on demand and on the various seasons, since she knows what to buy for each period of the year. She is in a strategic place and wants to take advantage of it to make more money in order to achieve her goal.

She would like to cover the total cost of her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit, such as bananas, mangoes, pineapple, soursops, safous and oranges.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is requesting for 80,000 Kes to buy 10 bags of sugar, 10 bags of rice and other products for resale. He runs a general store in Kiambu where he sells sugar, rice, bread, flour, cereals among other products. He is a member of Thuita Victory SHG and the group has guaranteed this loan. He has been in this business for four years and hopes to grow it into a wholesale. 

Through Faulu Kenya trainings, Paul has learned business focus and he describes himself as God fearing and proactive. He is 37 years old, married and a father of two.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of sugar, 10 bags of rice and other products for resale

loans.name: Khurshida's Group

texts.en:
Khurshida S. M. lives in Arifwala, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives in the area named 69-EB, and owns a two-room house where she has been living for more than 25 years.
 
Khurshida is the mother of five sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is a government employee, while others are studying in different classes.
 
Khurshida is married to S. M., who is a loader by profession and uses a donkey cart for his loading business. He loads different items such as construction supplies and fruits and vegetables and transports the items to the designated places to earn income.
 
Khurshida is also involved in an animal sales business, which she does to financially assist her husband. She purchases goats from the animal markets at cheap rates, raises them, and sells them for a profit.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s loading business. With the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because his old cart has become rough and rotten in some areas, which doesn’t allow him to put a load on it.
  
With the new cart her husband will provide better services to his clients and do his job better. Khurshida is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and it will help her family to live a better life.
 
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes the loan will be a good step towards the growth of her husband’s business.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khurshida.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet K. is a resident of Nkubu Town in South Rift, Kenya. She does mixed farming and produces carrots, cabbages, milk and potatoes. She sells her produce to the local middlemen. She has five children and four of them attend school. She has five farmhands, some temporary and some permanent. She is challenged by unreliable farmhands and both crop and animal diseases.

Janet's first loan of 45000 KES was paid on time. She has requested a second loan of 80000 KES to expand her farming. She believes the loan will help her to get enough income to educate her children and improve their living standard through healthful foods.

In the future, she wants to own three dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase horticultural materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He has been working in butchery since 2007 and in a local restaurant starting in 2010 to earn an income. With his occupational income, he is able to help his father with the heavy life expenses. 

He works hard to earn a good income and to manage his time between his two jobs and his education.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university education fees. He is studying computer programming and accounting and his is preparing his Master's degree.

In the future, he is planning to start his career in a computer company to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income. In the long term, he is planning to open a computer shop in his town.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 43 years old and married with five children. He is the proprietor of "Rafiki Wholesale Shop" where he sells electronic products, cosmetics among other household items. He is requesting  80,000 Kes to buy more electronic goods and household items for resale. He has been in this business for over five years and employs three people. He has a good flow of customers in his business since his business is located in an ideal place. He also practices dairy farming to earn more income. When he is asked about Faulu kenya, this is what he says, "It is Faulu that has brought me this far".

loans.use: To buy more electronic goods and household items for resale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 39 year old man. He is married and a father to three. He sells suitcases and bags in a busy area in Nairobi where the population is very high and he employs one person. He is requesting a loan of 65,000 Kes to add to his stock of suitcases and bags. 

He is a member of "Forty in One" SHG and the group has guaranteed the loan. He hopes to venture in the transport industry in the future with a five year plan of buying a taxi and purchasing a plot of land. He describes himself as stable.

loans.use: To add to his stock of suitcases and bags

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr:
Madame Denise est  vendeuse de poissons salés au marché, elle est maman célibataire et s’occupe de ses enfants avec le peu qu'elle gagne comme bénéfices.
Elle avait bien gérer son prêt passé , car c’est son premier expérience en gestion de crédit, mais elle a remboursé et a épargné, elle a compris et mise en pratique  les différentes formations donné sur la gestion des activités génératrices de revenus. elle avait des recettes de 45.000f a 50.000 fr par jour.
 Elle a maintenu ce cap et veut faire plus avec le prochain prêt qu’elle va gérer avec stratégie et excellence. Pour cela, elle va acheter le poisson sale comme le thon, crovine, capitaine et aussi s'approvisionner en poisson sale fabrique a Pointe Noire,Il s’agit de poisson , requin, morue, thon et crevettes et langoustes séchées, les harengs.

Dans l’espoir de faire des  bénéfices énormes afin de finir sa maison et soutenir ses enfants qui sont en plein dans leurs études, elle veut affronter les cycles avec succès et avoir des épargnes  pour atteindre son but.
texts.en:
Denise sells salted fish in the market. She is a single mother and looks after her children with the little money she earns. She managed her previous loan well, considering it was her first experience of managing a loan, and she repaid it and saved money. She understood and put into practice the different training she had on the management of income generating activities. She had income of 45,000 - 50,000 francs a day. She has maintained this level and wants to do even better with next loan which she will manage strategically and excellently. With the loan she is going to buy salted fish such as tuna, crovine, sea bass, and also stock up on salted fish produced at Point Noire, such as shark, cod, tuna, prawns, dried crayfish and herrings.

She is hoping to make significant profits in order to be able to finish her house and support her children who are in the middle of their studies. She would like to be able to face the various cycles successfully and have savings to achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase of salt water fish such as tuna, crovine, catfish and sea bass

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Maman Jackie pour ses camarade vend le poisson salé depuis plus de 10ans dans le marché plateaux des 15ans.

C’est une femme qui maitrise bien son activité car elle connait le haut et le bas  de celui –ci. Pour la période qui a précédée  le premier prêt, elle  avait les ventes de 25.000f par jour, actuellement ses ventes varient entre 25.000f et 45.000f.

Avec le prochain prêt, elle achètera son poisson salé en gros auprès de ses fournisseurs habituels. Comme elle maîtrise sa gestion de stock, cet achat va lui permettre de vendre pendant une période et de voir comment son activité fonctionnera pendant la dite période  et c’est seulement à la fin qu’elle va renouveler son stock en achetant : 5cartons de poisson sole, 5cartons de poisson capitaine, 3cartons de poisson morue.
Elle veut miser sur le poisson qui coute chers pour vendre pendant les fêtes
Les enseignements reçus, lui ont ajoutés  une connaissance en matière de gestion de stock et aller loin avec le prêt reçu.
Pour sa famille, elle pense les mettre dans les meilleures conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Maman Jackie, as she is known by her friends, has been selling fish for more than ten years (since the age of 15) in the Plateaux market.

She is a woman who masters her business, because she knows its highs and lows. During the period preceding her first loan she had a daily turnover of 25,000fr and now her turnover varies between 25,000 francs and 45,000 francs.

With her next loan she is going to buy her salted fish wholesale from her normal suppliers. Since she manages her stock well, this purchase will allow her to sell for a certain period and see how her business fares during this period. She will not renew her stock until the end of the period and then she will buy: five cartons of sole, five cartons of sea bass and three cartons of cod. She is counting on buying expensive fish in order to sell them during the festive season. In addition to her tuition, she has gained a knowledge of stock management and will be able to go far with the loan she recieves.

She is planning to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of boxes of fish, such as tuna, cod and sea bass

loans.name: Thet

texts.en:
The two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Thet T., 57, and her husband, age 56. They currently live in Kompong Cham Province. Thet T. is a  57 year old married woman and mother. This couple has given birth to seven children, three of whom are married, and the remaining four are single. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. Mrs. Thet T. always grows rice crop on her farmland, and she is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Presently, Mrs. Thet T. wants to start up another rice plantation to earn extra income to support her family’s need. 

Mrs. Thet T. would like to request a loan to invest in her farming business by purchasing cucumber seeds and sugar cane for planting.

loans.use: To purchase cucumber seeds and sugar cane for planting.

loans.name: Russell

texts.en: Russell is 40 years-old and married. He has been in business for three years. His business "Green Rainbow Investments" is a printing business where he prints cards, papers, T-shirts and other items. He also supplies papers. He is requesting 60,000 Kes to buy embroidered patches and T-shirt labels for printing T-shirts. He employs two people in his busy business where he serves small and middle income earners. He describes himself as self-motivated and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy embroidered patches and T-shirt labels.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
Depuis 10ans, elle vend le poisson salé, à 37ans, elle s’occupe de ses 3 enfants qui vont à l’école normalement.

Ayant compris les principes  de fonctionnement des crédits  Hope, elle s’est mise à l’école d’apprentissage car elle peut maintenant organisée son activité en utilisant son journal de caisse et sa gestion de stock.

Avant le premier prêt, elle avait les revenus allant de 10.000f à 35.000f jour et aujourd'hui elle vend 40.000f a 100.000 f lorsque les ventes sont bonnes.
L’actuel prêt sera la bienvenue, elle va faire des provisions  pour cette période des fêtes de fin d’année. Elle va achetée 3cartons du poisson salé soles, 3cartons du poisson salé capitaine, 2cartons de poisson salé morue, 1carton du poisson salé thon, avec ce stock elle compte réaliser plus de ventes afin de rembourser ce nouveau prêt  sans difficultés.
 -  Ses ambitions sont :Construire une boutique pour assurer l'avenir de ses enfants
-   Devenir grossiste
texts.en:
She has been selling salt-cured fish for 10 years, and at 37, she cares for her three children who normally go to school.  Having learned how the Hope loans work, she enrolled in the apprenticeship program because she can now organize her business activities by using her cash book and by managing her inventory. 

Before the first loan, her revenues were between 10,000F and 35,000F per day.  Now she sells between 40,000 F and 100,000 F on good days. 

The current loan will be welcome; she will secure supplies for the period of festivals at the end of the year.  She will buy three cases of salted sole, three cases of salted sea bass, two cases of salted cod, and one case of salted tuna.  With this stock she plans to make more sales and be able to repay this new loan without difficulty. 

Her ambitions are to build a boutique to assure the future of her children, and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cases of salted fish such as tuna, sole, seabass and crovine

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is a father of two adult children and has been working in mixed farming for fourteen years in his hometown of Nkubu, Kenya.  He sells his produce of peas, wheat, tomatoes, maize, beans, and milk at the local market.  He earns additional income from a retail shop he runs locally.

He requested the loan of 55,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank and fertilizer for his horticultural farming.  He says the purchase of a water tank and irrigation pipes will make his production consistent.  His challenges are unreliable weather conditions and an unregulated wheat market.  He praises Juhudi Kilimo for providing grace periods for the loans.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and farming materials

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is 28 years old and married. He sells office stationery and offers secretarial services from his business "Data Back".  He employs three people and he has a good client base.  He is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy a High Density Epson Printer. He also runs a taxi business to earn additional income. He hopes to be one of the most successful entrepreneurs and have outlets in all the major towns of Kenya. He describes himself as hardworking and self-motivated.

loans.use: To buy a High Density Epson Printer.

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en:
Assumpta is 45 years-old and is married with one child who is ten years old. Assumpta's husband is a salesman.  They both work hard in order to obtain all of the basic needs for their family.  Assumpta owns a small business where she sells new clothes.  Her business is known in the area and well-organized. She works from 7.30am until 6.30pm every day and has 12 years experience.

Assumpta will use this loan to purchase additional clothing to sell. Assumpta will be able to attract more customers and earn more profit by expanding her stock. With any profits made from the loan, Assumpta plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia lives in Lahore, a historic city in the Punjab province of Pakistan.  The area is known for its culture and history. She lives with her family in a two-room, brick house in an area named Fareed Town. 

Her husband’s name is K. J. and he is a tailor by profession. He operates his tailoring shop, where he sews men’s clothes, in the market.  Nazia lives in a combined family system. Her brother-in-law lives in the same house and contributes financially to the family by doing labor work. 

Nazia is a seamstress and sews to supplement the family's income. She mainly receives orders from her neighbors.  She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of the children are studying at a local school.  

She is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s tailoring business. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine and hire a worker, which will help him to offer better services to his clients and fulfill larger orders on-time. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, Nazia is the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and hire an employee for a tailoring business

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 27 years-old.  Jean Claude owns a small business where he sells various food and other products. His business is well-known and organized.  Jean Claude works from 5.30am until 11pm.

He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to expand his business through purchasing more products, such as sugar, juice, rice and milk. With this loan, he hopes that he will satisfy all the demands of his customers and hopefully his profits will increase. He will reinvest the profits in the business and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, juice, rice and milk.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 46 years-old and married with two children. She operates a general store where she sells food stuff and cereals. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kes to add stock of rice and maize. She hopes to open a mini-supermarket in the future. She has learnt how to keep her business records and financial management from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya ltd. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock of rice and maize.

loans.name: C7852 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years-old and married with four children between the ages of two and seven years.  Joseph is the leader of a group which is called Abisunganye. This group contains five people: one woman and four men.  Joseph owns a small shop which sells different kinds of products.  Joseph has ten years experience and his shop is open from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Joseph and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their businesses.  Joseph and his group hope to use the loan to increase profits and plan to reinvest this in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Hoe Sellers Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Hoe Sellers” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from the Kiva partner SMT.  With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Massah K. is the leader of the group.  Massah is forty-eight years old and was born in Kambia, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  Currently, he resides in Makeni with his wife and eight children. His wife is a businesswoman and five of his children attend primary and secondary school respectively. For seven years, Massah has been making and selling hoes and buckets.  With his share of the loan, he will buy iron rods to make a large number of hoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy iron rods to make a large number of hoes for sale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Greetings from Emmanuel in Kanazi town in Rwanda!  Emmanuel is a 31-year-old entrepreneur, married with four children between the ages of one and six.  Emmanuel buys goats from rural areas and sells them to different restaurants in Kanazi for meat.  He buys them in the villages and brings them to Kanazi town.  He employs two people to help him look after the goats. 

He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy more animals such as goats, sheep, and chickens to sell in local markets and restaurants in Kanazi town also. With the extra profits, Emmanuel would like to continue investing in his business to be financially stable.  He hopes to build a house and start saving for his future.

loans.use: To buy more animals to sell in local markets.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina supports her family financially with her sewing business. She is very skillful and can sew all kinds of designer clothes. Her talent makes her unique from other seamstresses in the community. She mainly receives orders from her neighbors and makes good earnings by completing the orders on time.  

She lives with her family in a two-room, brick house in Fareed Town, which is located in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore, the capital of the Punjab Province, is a historic city and famous for its history and Punjabi food.  She is a mother of a son who is in the 9th class. Robina wants her son to complete his education and become successful. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a business that sells construction supplies. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies, such as sand, bricks, and cement.  The supplies will help him provide better quality services to his clients and make more income. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supplies selling business

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 32 year-old businessman. He has two main businesses namely dairy farming and transport. He is requesting a 50,000 Kes loan to buy a dairy cow and a chuff cutter for his dairy business. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He plans to acquire taxis and grow his farming business in five years time. He is married with children who are in school and he describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 35 years-old and married with two children. He offers transport services to residents of Kiambu and also practices dairy farming. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow. His business is good since there is availability of customers and the environment is good. He hopes to be financially stable in future. Since joining Kiva partner Faulu, Daniel's financial life has changed. He describes himself as very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim B. A. is a resident of Lahore, Pakistan. It is known for its history and culture. She lives there with her family in a two-room brick house in the area named Fareed town. She moved here 12 years ago. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. All of them attend school and get an education. 
 
Shamim is a hardworking lady who operates a spice-selling business. She sells salts, pepper and red chili powder to grocery stores and earns income for the family. Her husband’s name is B. A. and he is a bus driver. He drives a government local bus and earns income on a monthly basis. 

Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her spice-selling business. With the loan, she will buy spices in larger quantity, which will help her fulfill larger orders on time and increase her income. She has been doing this business for 12 years and hopes that an investment will be a good step towards the growth of her business. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitabler experience for her.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy spices to sell

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
K. Muslima is 35 years-old. She is married with two children. For three years she has been working in a beauty salon. In the salon, she provides various services such as hair styling and cutting, manicures and the services of a cosmetologist. Her business is successful and generates a stable income for her family. Now Muslima is planning to purchase cosmetics and other accessories for her beauty salon.  For this purpose she is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni. Muslima thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina I. lives in Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and is known for its culture and history. She has lived there in the area named Fareed town in a two-room brick house since her marriage. She is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them attend a nearby school and are getting their education. 

Samina has applied for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Asasah. The loan is for her husband, who drives a rickshaw. He provides transport services to his passengers and earns money by dropping them at their designated places. Currently, his rickshaw is not working well. With the loan, he will fully repair his rickshaw so that it is in perfect order to better continue his work.
 
He has been involved in this work for more than five years and Samina is hopeful that this investment will enable him to repair his rickshaw completely.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Samina.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Djavid

texts.ru:
Djavid A. 24 qoda. On  molodoy ne jenatiy qrajdanin kotoriy yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste s semyoy. 
Djavid uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya lubimoy rabotoy skotovodstvom. Djavit ochen xochet uvelichit kolichestvo skota  poetomu on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec. Djaviq s pomoshyu etoy sudu xochet uvelichit yejemeshechniy svoy doxod . Tak je v budushem imeya bolshe zarabotok on xochet jenitsya.
texts.en:
Djavid A. is twenty-four-years-old.  He's a young and single refugee from the city of Fuzili, who currently lives in the Fuzili region with his family.

Djavid has been doing his favorite job, raising cattle, for the past two years.  He really wants to get more cattle so he needs 2000 AZN to buy feed.  With the help he gets from the bank he wants to increase his monthly income because in the future, when he's earning more, he would like to get married.

loans.use: To buy feed.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo es  de la ciudad de Pilar, tiene 23 años y  está cursando el 1° año de la carrera de Ingeneria Comercial en la Universidad de San Lorenzo (UNISAL) de la ciudad de Pilar.
 Sus padres son del interior y se dedican a la agricultura y ganaderia,
Arnaldo se encuentra trabajando como administrador de una Veterinaria de la ciudad de Pilar.
Gracias a este trabajo el mismo se puede mantener y estudiar a la vez, está en los primeros años de la carrera y tiene muchos deseos de concluir. La finalidad de el mismo es el de poder contar el día de mañana de un excelente ingreso como para poder ayudar al progreso de su familia ya que son gentes de una zona muy humilde comento Arnaldo. Actualmente es soltero y vive en una casa que alquila, pero piensa en el día de mañana poder contar con su propia casa tener una familia y poder brindarle todas las comodidades.
El solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
 Arnaldo agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is from the city of Pilar.  He is 23 years old and is in the first year of a Commercial Engineering degree at the University of San Lorenzo (UNISAL) in the city of Pilar.

His parents are from the provinces and they farm and raise livestock.

Arnaldo is working as the manager of a veterinary practice in the city of Pilar.  Thanks to this work, he can support himself and study at the same time.  He is in the first year of his course and he has many wishes to fulfil.  His aim is to be able to have an excellent income in the future so that he can help his family to make progress since he says that they are people from a very humble area.  Arnaldo is currently single and lives in a rental house but he is thinking of being able to have his own house, being able to have a family and being able to provide his family with all the comforts of life.

Arnaldo is requesting this loan so that he can pay his monthly fees to his faculty and also so that he can buy some books that he needs for his studies.

Arnaldo is grateful for this loan since it will help him with his studies and at the same time it will provide him with a credit record which will be very important for him in the future so that he can see his projects realized.

loans.use: To pay his monthly fees and his examination fees

loans.name: Oiminoz

texts.en:
