Oiminoz is a married mother of four adult children. She works at a small market in Dushanbe selling clothing and fabrics for sewing national dresses.  This is a successful business she has operated for three years. Oiminoz enjoys it very much and her kindness, experience and openness attract many clients to her kiosk. She would now like to borrow $1200 USD to increase her assortment of goods.  She hopes to earn additional income and to improve her living condition.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods.

loans.name: Tania Rani's Group

texts.en:
Tania Rani S. A. lives in the second largest city of Pakistan, which is called Lahore and is known for its history and culture. She lives in the area named Fareed town with her family in a two-room brick house. She moved here after her marriage a few years ago.
 
She is 33 years old, married to S. A. and has four sons. All of them are enrolled in local school and are getting their education.
 
Her husband works in a banquet hall and Tania supports her family by selling clothes. She purchases clothes from the wholesale markets of Lahore named “Ichra and Shahalmi” and sells them to her local area clients. She is very supportive in nature and always ready to support her family in every difficult time. Her earning allows her to pay for the school fees of her children and also the utilities expenses of her house.

Tania has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her brother, who operates a welding shop in the market. He repairs various iron items and spare parts there and earns income. With the loan, he will buy another welding machine, which will help him work better and provide his customers better services.
 
Tania is hopeful that this investment will be helpful for her brother and will be able to improve his business. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine for welding business

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en:
Mahfuza is married and has two children. She is a small market entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Mahfuza sells children clothing in one of the local markets. Mahfuza rents a small facility that serves as a vending outlet. She admits that she started this business because it was the only way to survive when her family was going through some challenging financial times. Mahfuza has been in this business for six years. She has a long-term view for her business development and is disciplined with all her business plans. All this promotes successful growth of her business. Moreover, Mahfuza is not afraid of serious amounts of hard work which reveals her great entrepreneurial potential and secures prompt loan repayment. Mahfuza is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni to increase the selection of clothing items that she offers for sale in her store.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase of new goods.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years-old and married with two children aged between three and five years-old.  Rose is a business woman and her husband works in the government.  She owns a interior decor shop at Remera called Smart Decor Shop Ltd.  She has been in the business of selling decorative items for the home for three years and she currently employs two people. She works from 7am to 8pm during the week and her shop is very well organised.

Rose is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more traditional handicrafts to sell which will allow her to improve her profits. She would like to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase traditional handicrafts and other decor items.

loans.name: Israfil

texts.ru:
Israfil A. 44 qoda. On Jenat on imeyet 3 detey, Dochka 5 let ona xodit v detskiy sadik, sin 3 let i doch 2 let. Israfil i yeqo lubimaya semya jivut v Fuzuli regione.

Israfil uje 13 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Israfil Seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa. Israfil kupiv korovi nadeyetsya uvelichit svoy mesechniy doxod i kolichestvo xorosheqo tovara dlya prodaji. Israfil starayetsya sdelat vse chtobi ulidshit svoy doxod radi svoyey lubimoy jeni i detey dlya ix budusheqo. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Israfil  on ochen blaqodaren lenderam za pervuyu ssudun qde on bral 1200$, Israfil s leqkostyu i bez zaderjik zaplatil vsu ssudu.


http://partners.kiva.org/lend/4557
texts.en:
Israfil A. is 44 years old.  He is married and has three children.  His five-year-old daughter goes to kindergarten.  He also has a three-year-old son and a two-year-old daughter.  Israfil and his beloved family live in the Fuzuli region.

Israfil has been a herdsman for thirteen years.  Right now, Israfil needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to expand his business.  Israfil hopes that by buying more cows he can increase his monthly income and the quantity of goods he is able to sell.  Israfil is trying to do everything in his power to increase his income for the sake of his much-loved wife and children and their future.  This is Israfil’s second loan.  He is very thankful to the lenders for the first loan in which he borrowed $1200.  Israfil repaid the entire debt easily and in a timely fashion.

Here is a link to his first loan: http://partners.kiva.org/lend/4557

loans.use: Buying cows

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob M. is a resident of Nkubu Town in Central Kenya. He has been doing mixed farming for 20 years. He has five farmhands and produces wheat, maize, peas, onions and milk. All these products are sold at the local market. Farming is his only source of income.

Jacob's main challenge is unreliable water. He has requested a loan of 55000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank, which he feels will mitigate this problem a great deal. The tank will be helpful in carrying out irrigation and allowing production in and out of season. He says this all-season production will improve his income and raise his family's living standard. He is glad Juhudi is helping farmers do business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Sakiatou

texts.fr: Sakiatou est mariée et a 24 ans. Elle a 3 enfants en charge et exerce comme activité la vente de charbon de bois. En effet elle exerce cette activité il y a 9 ans déjà où elle tire beaucoup de bénéfice. Elle achète à Anié et revend à  domicile  de sa maison à Lomé. Elle est née à Tchamba et réside à Hédzranawoe. L’objet de ce crédit sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de 100 nouveaux sacs de charbons pour répondre à la demande.La dame en question est celle qui est debout et a mis un foulard sur sa tête.
texts.en: Sakiatou is 24 years old and is married. She has three children and is involved in the business of selling charcoal.  In fact, she has been in this business for nine years and makes a good lving.  She buys her supplies in Anié and resells them from her home in Lomé.  She was born in Tchamba and lives in Hédzranawoe.  This credit will essentially be used to buy 100 new sacks of charcoal to respond to demand.   We are speaking about the woman who is standing up and wearing a scarf on her head.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Boturjon

texts.en:
N. Boturjon is 37 years-old. He is the father of four children and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, Boturjon would like to buy a greater number of cattle and to build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of $2400 US Dollars for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, Boturjon will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma D. H. is a resident of the city of Lahore, which is famous for its history and culture, in Pakistan. She lives there with her family in the area named Fareed town in a two-room brick house. She moved there after her marriage.

A very talented lady, Salma operates a clothes-sewing business at her home. She mainly receives orders from her neighboring clients and generates income for the family. Her earning allows her to pay for her family's utilities.
 
Her husband's name is D. H.. He is an embroidery expert who runs an embroidery shop in the market. He crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes and attracts many customers. He has been in this business for over seven years and has obtained a good reputation among his customers. He satisfies them through his quality work.
 
Salma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s embroidery business. With the loan, he will buy embroidery supplies such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity to improve his embroidery business.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Salma.

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies

loans.name: C4368  Jyambere Group

texts.en:
Christoph is 34 years-old and married with four children aged between  three and 12.  Christoph is the leader of the group which is called JYAMBERE in the local language. This group contains five male members.

Christoph, who is the leader, has ten years experience selling various styles of clothing. His shop is open from 7h30 a.m until 8 p.m every day.

Christoph and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their business through purchasing more products for their shops. This loan will allow them to satisfy the demand of their customers. Christoph hopes to earn more profits which will allow his to save money for the future and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.ar:
خديجة في عمر 53 سنة تحب عائلتها فهي متزوجة ولها  3 اولاد تريد تعليمهم وتربيتهم بشكل جيد ينقصها الدعم المادي
لكي تطور نفسها وعملها فهي تعمل في فرن لبيع المناقيش تتلقى الدعم والتشجيع من عائلتها ومحيطها فزبائنها هم من جيرانها ومحيطها تحب العمل كثيرا
وترى نفسها في مكانة عملية متطور فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة للفرن وتحسين الفرن لا تواجه اي صعوبات سوى 
المال لكي تزيد مدخولها عائلتها كل اهتمامها لكي تصل بها الى مستقبل جيد
texts.en: Khadija is 53 years old. She is married with three children. Khadija loves her family, and aspires to educate her children well. She lacks financial support which affects her work and her ability to develop. Khadija works in a bakery making and selling pastries. She receives support from her family and friends. Her clients are her neighbors and acquaintances. Khadija loves her job and has lots of ambition. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, she wants to purchase new equipment for her bakery. Khadija only faces financial obstacles. She would like to increase her income to secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing new equipment and expanding business

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 32-year-old married man who has been working as a house painter since 1995. Khalil has lived in Saida all his life, and he’s well known among his friends and neighbors. He’s famous in the region because of his quality work and commitment. Khalil is requesting a loan for the second time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary products for his work and to make preparations for the expected baby. His previous loan had a positive impact on his work and family. Khalil is happy about the expected baby and can’t wait to see him; he hopes to provide a good and safe home for his new small family. He also hopes to expand his business to cover a wider area and to bring in employees to help open a construction company.

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his work and to make preparations for the expected baby

loans.name: Patronala

texts.en:
Patronala is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a clothing business, selling at the market and to neighbors. Seasonality is a major challenge Patronala faces in her business. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase three bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase three bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik M. is 56 years old. She lives in the city of Sevan with her husband and son. Hasmik worked as a seamstress for several years, but in 1998 she decided to run her own business. She rented a stall at Sevan agricultural market and organized fruit and vegetable trading, which she manages to this day.
 
She says her son and her husband have jobs, but she also wants to have her own occupation and help them to keep their family. She always invests part of her income in her business. 

Hasmik asks for an 800,000-AMD loan to buy fruit, nuts, and candied fruit to resell. This is Hasmik’s ninth loan from Nor Horizon, and she has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: To buy fruit, nuts, and candied fruit to resell

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob S. is 55 years old. He lives in the village of Varser in the Sevan area with his wife and two children. Hakob’s wife is a teacher in a village school; his son and his daughter are students. Hakob is a radio technician, and for about 17 years he worked in this field.
 
Since 2007, Hakob has rented a stall and managed his own food-trading business. With his business’s income, Hakob supports his family and pays for his children's education.

In his stall he sells candy, beverages, food, canned food, tea, coffee, etc. In advance of the New Year holidays, Hakob intends to increase his business. Therefore, he is asking for a 500,000-Armenian-dram loan to begin trading household goods in his stall.

loans.use: To begin trading household goods in his stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of  poultry

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Fausto es de la ciudad es de la ciudad de Encarnación vive en su propia casa del barrio Pacú Cua  de Encarnación desde hace ya varios años.
El solicta el préstamo para gastos de graduación y lo solicita conjuntamente con su madra quien lo apoya en todo sus estudios y se compromente para ayudar para el pago de las cuota del crédito.
Fausto recibirá el título de abogado  y se siente muy orgulloso de la satisfacción que le dará a su madre ya la misma siempre trabajo con mucho sacrificio en un puesto de ventas de frutas, verduras, aceite y harina  para mantener a su familia y dar una buena educación a los suyos.

Los  dos agradece la posibilidad de obtener este crédito ya que mediante el podrá pagar todos los costo de la graduación de su hijo   quien aspira a ser un buen profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
Fausto is from the city of Encarnación.  He lives in his own home in the Pacú Cua neighborhood of Encanación, where he has lived for several years.

He is requesting this loan to pay his graduation expenses and he is requesting it jointly with his mother who supports him in his studies and pledges to help with the payment of his loan installments.

Fausto is graduating as a lawyer and he feels very proud of the satisfaction which it will give his mother since she has always worked with a lot of sacrifice on her stall selling fruit, vegetables, oil and flour in order to support her family and give them a good education.

Both Fausto and his mother are grateful for the possibility of obtaining this loan since with it Fausto's mom will be able to pay all the graduation fees of her son who aspires to be a good professional in the future.

loans.use: To pay graduation fees

loans.name: Paytsar

texts.en:
Paytsar H. is 37 years old. She lives in Sevan with her husband, two school-age children, and parents-in-law. For about 10 years, Paytsar was engaged in clothes trading, but in 2005 she decided to change her business area. She started to run a fruit and vegetable trading business because, in her opinion, it’s more profitable in Sevan. Her husband helps her in this occupation, and, thanks to this fact, they sell fruit and vegetables from a stall and deliver goods to neighboring villages as well.
  
Thanks to the business’s income, Paytsar and her husband have been able to provide for their family and buy a car for their business, and now they are collecting money for their children’s further education.
 
Paytsar asks for a 1,000,000-AMD loan to buy fruit (especially citruses) and vegetables for her business. Paytsar has received loans from Nor Horizon 10 times without delay.

loans.use: To buy fruit (especially citruses) and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina lives in Lahore which is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives in the area named Ismail Nagar with her family in a 2 room brick house. She has been living there for over 10 years. Robina is a caring lady. She  prefers to stays at home and carried out her responsibilities as a housewife. She has given birth to 2 sons and 4 daughters. Her elder son works with his father and helps him in his business. Her remaining children are enrolled in school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s floor tile business. He has a shop from where he sells floor tiles of different colors and designs to his customers and earns income for the family. With the loan, he will put more tiles of different designs in his shop and improve his sales.  Robina is very confident that this investment will put her husband’s business in a more profitable position and it will help her family to enjoy better standard of life
. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To buy floor tiles to sell

loans.name: Mazoea

texts.en: Mazoea is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that doesn't have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mazoea has operated an open air food market for the past three years, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. Mazoea faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to be self reliant in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, sacks of beans, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, cooking oil, sacks of beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Samir

texts.ar:
سمير في عمر 40 سنة يعمل في دهان وتصليح السيارات له في عمله اكثر من 23 سنة يعمل بها بكد ونشاط 
سمير متزوج  وله 5 اولاد يحب عائلته ويعطيها الكثير من اهتمامه فهو يسعى الى تحسين وضع عائلته وتطويرها وتعليم اولاده بشكل جيد
يتلقى الدعم من العائلة بشكل كبير فهو يريد من خلال  طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء مواد جديدة ومواد دهان لتجديد المصلحة
يجد صعوبة في المنافسة من محيطه بسبب نقص المال يجيد عمله كثيرا ويحب تطوير نفسه ومصلحته ثم عائلته
texts.en: Samir is 40 years old. He has been working in the automobile repair business for more than 23 years. He is diligent and active. Samir is married with five children. He loves and cares for his family. Samir hopes to enhance and develop his income, thereby educating his children well. He receives great support from his family. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, Samir would like to purchase new paints and equipment to expand his business. He has lots of competition in the field and struggles to compete for business due to his lack of access to financial help. Samir loves his job and aspires to develop his business and secure a better life for his family.

loans.use: Renovations and purchasing new equipment to expand business

loans.name: Kamal

texts.ar:
كمال عمره 30 سنة يعمل  في تصليح ودهان السيارات متزوج  له تاريخ  جيد مع المجموعة فقد  كان القرض السابق له مع المجموعة الأثر الايجابي في حياته
يحب العمل وتوسيع المصلحة يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجوعة الى شراء مواد جديدة للعمل وتحسين الوضع المادي لعائلته يحب عائلته وهي اولى اهتمامه  يريد التطور 
والتوسع بالعمل يتلقى دائما الدعم من عائلته ومحيطه زبائنه هم من جيرانه واهل قريته
texts.en: Kamal is 30 years old. He works in the auto repair field. Kamal is married, and has a good reputation with Al Majmoua. His first loan from Al Majmoua had a positive impact on his life. Kamal loves his job and aspires to expand his business. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he wants to purchase new material to enhance his operations and improve his income. Kamal loves his family and makes them his first priority. He would like to expand and develop his business. He receives great support from his family. His clients are mainly his neighbors and village residents.

loans.use: Purchase new equipment and expand business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a married woman with five children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Mwanamisi operates an open air food stall, where she cooks chapati(flat bread) and beans which she sells from her home to neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. Mwanamisi hopes to be self reliant in the future. With the Kshs 60,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, cooking oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Nahi

texts.en: Nahi is a 25 year old man from Saida who has been working as a motorcycle repairman for 5 years. Nahi is requesting a loan from A. majmoua for the first time in order to buy necessary spare parts for his business, which will help him to expand it. Nahi’s clients say that his work is unique; his clients include his friends, neighbors, passersby and anyone in need of his services. He hopes to open a motorcycle showroom and maintenance garage in the future. Nahi also hopes to start his own family soon.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Onesme

texts.en: Onesme is 46 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 6 and 21 years old. He runs a store in Rugarama district in Rwanda. Onesme has had his construction business for four years and he currently employs one person. He works from 8am until 4pm every day, except on Saturdays. The main challenges to his business is expansion. This is his first loan requested from Kiva through the Vision Finance Company and it will be used to buy more sheet metal for construction. The extra income from this loan will help his business in the future, as he plans to reinvest it and continue to buy more construction products.

loans.use: To buy more sheet metal.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher has been mixed farming and employing two farmhands in her hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya for over ten years.She is married with  six children aged between twenty four and nine years. Her produce of milk, vegetables and tomatoes are sold locally.

She has requested for this loan of 48,000 KES  from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow .She had once requested a first time loan of 30,000 KES. She says the milk produce will act as food supplement for the family and also pay for the children's school fees. She is optimistic that she will soon have a mini-chilling plant to store the milk and avoid wastage.

She says diseases are a major problem  and eats into her income since the animals must be treated.She recommends Juhudi loans because of their flexibility.

loans.use: Purchase and maintain a dairy cow

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar:
علي عمره 53 سنة يعمل في مطعم خاص به لبيع الفول والمتبلات متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في هذه المصلحة من اكثر من 20 سنة
يحب عائلته وعمله كثيرا يريد تطوير الاثنين معا فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تقوية مصلحته من خلال توسيع المحل وشراء بضاعة جديدة
علي يتلقى دائما الدعم من عائلته يتميز بالنظافة في عمله والدقة له زبائن من السواح والجيران لكن ما يعيق توسيع عمله  هي المادة فقد اصبح محله لا يسع للمزيد
من الزبائن يحب التمييز بعمله والتجديد
texts.en: Ali, 53, is married with two sons. He owns a restaurant where he serves fuul (fava beans) and appetizers. He has been working in this job for more than 20 years. Ali wishes to improve his family and work conditions. Ali wants a loan from Al Majmoua to develop his business by expanding his restaurant and buying new goods. Ali always enjoys his family's support. He shows precision and cleanliness in his work. His clients range from tourists to neighbours. However, he needs capital to expand his business as there is not enough room in his restaurant for more clients. He displays excellence and creativity in his work.

loans.use: To expand his restaurant and buy new goods

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en: Sanita is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She operates a grocery business, selling green vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Sanita faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business and sell as a wholesaler in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Tuinuane Group

texts.fr: Katungu S. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Tuinuane,  âgée de 42 ans, mère de 5 enfants Son mari est infirmier. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente des épices, tomates, arachides, oignons, tangausi.  Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari, il ya 4 ans. Elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ en 2010. Elle installe ses produits  au marché cental de Virunga. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  en huile végétale, tangausi, tomates, etc. En plus, elle ambitionne  augmenter son épargne à 1000$ enfin d’ouvrir d’autres activités génératrices de revenu. La cliente Katungu S. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe Tuinuane est composé de 38 membres.
texts.en: Katungu S. is an entrepreneur and president of the Tuinuane group. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children.  Her husband is a nurse.  She is involved in the business of selling spices, tomatoes, peanuts, onions and ginger.  She started her business with her own money given to her by her husband four years ago.  She received a loan of $50 from the IMF Hekima in 2010.  She displays her products at the main market in Virunga.  This new loan will help her to secure supplies of vegetable oil, ginger, tomatoes, etc.  In addition, she plans to increase her savings to $1,000 in order to start other money-making ventures.  Client Katungu S. thanks Hekima for their work which helps those who are excluded from the traditional banking system.  The Tuinuane group is composed of 38 members.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil, ginger, tomatoes, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Amin

texts.ar:
امين عمره 56 سنة متزوج وله لدان يعمل من اكثر من 10 سنوات في محل لبيع السمانة والسكاكر والمواد الغذائية يحب عائلته
ويسعى الى تحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي تعليم الاولاد يتلقى دائما الدعم من عائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء مواد غذائية وسكاكر 
وحبوب لزيادة البضائع بالمحل له زبائن كثر هم اهل قريته ومحيطه وجيرانه يحبونه لأنه يتميز بالجودة والصدق بالبيع يحب ان يزيد مدخوله المادي لكي يضمن مستقبل
جيد له ولعائلته
texts.en: Amin is 56 years old. He is married with two children. Amin has been working as a grocer for more than 10 years, selling candy and food products. He loves his family, and aspires to enhance his financial and social status. Amin seeks good education for his children. He receives great support from his family. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he wants to purchase food products, candy and grain to expand his business. His clients are the residents of his village, friends and acquaintances. He has earned the respect of his clients because of his diligence and honesty. Amin wants to increase his financial income and ensure a better future for him and his family.

loans.use: Purchase food products, grain and candy

loans.name: San Cayetano/ Belén Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Cayetano se conformó en fecha 24  octubre del 2.010, se encuentran en el 1°ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr. Feliciana  Martínez quien se dedica a la compra y venta, de carne de animales, queso huevo etc.  nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
  Según la Sra. Feliciana    mencionó que la actividad que realiza  la Fundación  es muy importante ya que ella nunca encontró este espacio en otro lado por  ser muy pobre.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano Women's Committee was founded on October 24th 2010.  They are in their first loan cycle and working together in solidarity within the program.

As well as each woman having her own individual work, the group carry out activities together in order to make funds so that they have some capital within the group.  They also help each other to achieve their goals.  Their main goal is to work in order to financially support their families.

The story of Feliciana M. is a very moving one.  Feliciana buys and sells meat, cheese and eggs, etc.  She tells us that with her loan she has been able to improve her business quite a lot, as well as her standard of living and her income.

Feliciana comments that the work which Fundación Paraguaya does is very important because she never found this kind of opportunity elsewhere, since she is very poor.

loans.use: To buy meat, cheese and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes wholesale

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband whose business is selling construction supplies. He offers his services to his customers through his shop which is located in the market. From his shop, he sells different construction supplies such as sand, bricks and cement in bulk quantity to different construction companies and earns income for the family. With the loan, he will buy more construction supplies for his shop and improve his sales.  

Safia is very confident that her husband will utilize the loan in a proper way and further improves his business. Safia is a very supportive lady. In order to financially support her family she sells clothes to her local area clients and generates income for the family. She buys clothes from a wholesale market named “Shahalmi” at cheap rates and resells them for a good profit.  

She is the mother of 4 sons and 3 daughters. Her elder son works with his father in his business while others are studying by attending a local school. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Safia.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a construction supply selling business

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 40-year-old married man and father of three kids, who has been working as a car painter for 20 years. Amer is an expert in his field; he is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary products for his business. 

Amer seeks perfection in his work and perfection in his family members whether in raising his kids or in teaching them. He hopes to provide them with good talent and a secure living. Amer’s clients believe that he’s a man of honor, who respects his word. Amer dreams of opening a big garage in the future

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his business

loans.name: Jalal

texts.ar:
جلال في عمر 38 سنة متزوج وله 2 ولدان يعمل في مجال الاكسبرس القهوة له في عمله 8 سنوات يحب عمله ويجيده 
يحب ان ستطور ويساعد عائلته على التطور يعتمد على نفسه لتحسين وضع عائلته ودعمها لكي تحسن وضعها المادي والاجتماعي يريد من 
خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة مواد اولية لتحسين وضع المحل تاريخه مع المجموعة جيد جدا وقد استفاد كثيرا
من قرضه السابق في تحيسن وضعه وقد تطور في مصلحته سلقى دعم من عائلته بشكل مستمر فهو متميز بعمله وله زبائن اكثرهم من السواح والجيران
texts.en: Jalal is 38 years old. He is married with two children. He has been working in the coffee business for eight years. Jalal loves his job, and aspires to develop and ensure a better living for his family. He is independent and self-reliant as he supports his family in hopes of securing a better financial and social status for them. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he would like to purchase new products and expand his business. Jalal has a good reputation with Al Majmoua and benefited greatly from a previous loan issued from Al Majmoua, which enabled him to enhance his business. He constantly receives support from his family. Jalal works diligently and has several clients, most of which are tourists and neighbors.

loans.use: Purchase new products and an espresso machine

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a widow with eight children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a firewood-selling business for over eight years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she has real estate which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanahamisi faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation incurred while transporting firewood to her place of operation.  She hopes to own a fuel-selling stall in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Amer

texts.ar:
عامر عمره 33 سنة فهو متزوج وله 2 ولدان يحب عائلتها فهي كل اهتماماته بالاضافة الى عمله الذي له فيه اكثر من 10 سنوات 
فهو يعمل في دهان السيارات  يحب مصلحته وقد تتطور بها منذ ان بدء لكنه يحلم بأن يصبح له المكان الخاص به للعمل فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض
له من المجموعة الى شراء كومبراسور هواء +  واجهات للمحل + عدة يدوية لكي يطور مصلحته لقد تلقى عامر دعم كبير من العائلة يتميز بعمله بالجودة والمثابرة
له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واصدقاءه عائلته تحتاج الى تطوره لكي تتطور معه
texts.en: Amer is 33 years old. He is married with two children. Amer loves his family and work. He has been working in the auto repair business for more than 10 years. Amer has been able to develop his work, but aspires to own a private business. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he wants to purchase an air compressor, shop signage and a tool kit, which will help him start his own business. Amer has received great support from his family. He is diligent, active and persistent. His clients are his neighbors and friends. Amer’s family supports his development as it will enhance their income and status.

loans.use: Purchase an air compressor, shop signage, and a tool kit

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is twenty six years old and has been doing mixed farming in his home town of Kitale for two years. He is married with one child. His produce of eggs, maize and beans are sold locally.

He has requested this loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. He believes the income generated will give the family adequate food. He hopes to have expanded his farm and ventured into dairy farming in five years time. He gets additional income from his butchery business.

He says that market price fluctuation makes income quite unpredictable and is the major challenge in project planning.

loans.use: Purchase of poultry

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 48-year-old father of two.  He is able to raise his family with the income from his van ("matatu") transport business.  In his business, he has employed two people.  He was previously running a retail shop.  He has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business record keeping.  This has helped him to run his business well.  He hopes to own buses for transport in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to insure his van and buy tires.

loans.use: To insure his van and buy tires

loans.name: Bano's Group

texts.en:
Bano (pictured holding the Asasah Passbook) is a talented lady who operates an embroidery business at her home in order to financially support her family. She learned this art from her mother and is now earning money from her skill. She is also a caring homemaker who manages the household chores and takes care of the family. She has given birth to four children. Her elder son is involved in manufacturing glass items like tables, mirrors, and windows while her other children are enrolled in school and getting their education. 

Her husband’s name is M. T. and he is a cobbler by profession. He makes shoes on orders received from different shoe factories and shoe shops. He has a shop in the market from which he offers his shoemaking services. 

Bano has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his shoemaking business. With the loan, he will buy leather, nails, and shoe polish in larger quantities in order to make shoes in bulk so that he can fulfill his orders on time and increase his income. He has been engaged in his business for past seven years and Bano is hopeful that her husband’s business will improve further after this loan investment. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a good experience for her.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails, and shoe polish for shoemaking business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar:
حسن متزوج وله ولدان عمره 55 سنة يعمل في نقل الخردة والحطب يعمل في مصلحته من اكثر من 8 سنوات يحب عائلته فهي اولى اهتماماته يحب
ان يطور عمله ويريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بيك اب لنقل الخردة والحطب له زبائن كثر من محيطه العملي وهو مقصود لنقل خردة التجار المحيطين به
لكنه تعب من نقل الخردة والحطب على العربة يتلقى الدعم الكامل من عائلته لكي يحسن وضعه الاجتماعي المادي جدير بالثقة فهو جدي في العمل صادق ودقيق
texts.en: Hassan is a 55-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family very much and wants to put them on firmer financial footing. Hassan in turn receives considerable support from them. Hassan has more than eight years experience collecting scrap metal and wood, with his many customers hailing from business colleagues who retail his materials. Hassan is very earnest and rigorous in his profession. Because he has become worn out from carting all this scrap metal and wood around, he is currently seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to procure a pick-up truck to facilitate his work.

loans.use: To purchase a pick-up truck to collect scrap metal and wood

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills. 

She has operated a fresh water distribution business for over two years; her potential customers are neighbours. Mwanasiti faces a major challenge of competition from other water distributors in the area. She hopes to expand and supply to large groups in the area.

She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase water pumps and also purchase a motorbike to start a motorbike business.

loans.use: To purchase water pumps and also purchase a motorbike to start a motorbike business.

loans.name: Emmanuella

texts.en:
Emmanuella is 21 years old and is married with one child who is one year old. Emmanuella is known in the business of selling new clothing for women. She has been in this business for about three years and the hours of her business are from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day.

Emmanuella has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through adding a variety of styles.  With this loan, she has a vision of wholesaling and retailing at the same time so that her revenue can be greatly increased.  If successful, Emmanuella hopes to continue building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Imad

texts.ar:
عماد عمره 35 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في الادوات الصحية فهو يعمل من اكثر من  18 سنة في هذه المصلحة وهو يحب عمله كثيرا 
يحب ان يتطور ويعمل بجد ونشاط يحب تحسين وضع عائلته كثيرا وتطويرها يحب ان يحافظ على جودة عمله فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة
الى شراء بضاعة اضافية بجودة عالية لكي يطور من عمله وتجديد البضائع الموجودة لديه زبائنه هم اهل قريته واقاربه يريد دعم عائلته وتحسين محيطه الاجتماعي
والعملي
texts.en: Imad is a 35-year-old husband and father of one who wants to help his family and community advance. Imad has been working for the past eighteen years in the field of bathroom supplies, drawing patronage from his relatives and other fellow villagers. He is very enthusiastic about his work which he wants to further develop. Accordingly, Imad is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new high-quality wares to expand his business and to also upgrade the materials he already has in stock.

loans.use: To purchase materials for bathroom supplies business

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 43-year-old married woman, mother of one child, living in Metn and working as a beauty expert and makeup artist for 20 years. Hiyam helps her husband with the family’s income and benefits; their own aim is raising their child in the best possible way.  

 Hiyam is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the second time, in order to buy necessary cosmetics and tattoo materials. Her previous loan improved her work a lot, and she has a good repayment history. Her dream is to open a beauty center in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary cosmetics and tattoo materials

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is 27 years old and married with no children. He runs a boutique in Rugarama district in Rwanda.  He`s been in this business for six years and sells cosmetics and other personal products like soap, Vaseline etc. and he currently employs one person in his store.  He works at the business from 7am until 4pm every day except Saturdays.  

This is his second loan requested through Vision Finance Company and he plans to buy more cosmetics to increase his business inventory.  He would like to use any profits to reinvest in the business and save for the future.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old and married with two children, who are 14 and 17 years old.  He runs a general retail store in Musanze market in Rwanda.  He has been in this business for two years and works from 6am until 6pm every day of the week.  

This is David's first loan request on Kiva and his second loan from Vision Finance Company.  He will use this loan to support his business through the purchasing of more products to sell.  He would like to use any extra income to continue to increase his sales in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his market store

loans.name: Franciscar

texts.en: Franciscar is a 50-year-old lady.  She operates Apostolic Nursery School. Most people in her town of residence take their children in her nursery.  She opened the nursery school ten years ago.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her to upgrade her school.  Her desire is to have a fully pledged primary school in the future.  She has requested 40,000 Kes to buy desks, tables and teaching materials such as chalk.

loans.use: To buy desks, tables and teaching materials such as chalk

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past twelve years, she has operated a tailoring business from home; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. In addition she operates a beauty salon which contributes to her other source of income. Esha cites seasonality as her major challenge. During the holiday season, she makes a lot of sales while during from January to June she gets low sales volume. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures and requirements.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and other materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Renson

texts.en:
Renson is engaged in mixed farming in the town of Kitale in western Kenya and has farming in this way for 30 years. He produces milk, maize, beans, and eggs, which he sells at the local market. He is married with nine children, all of whom are adults save for the youngest who is still in school.

He has requested for this loan of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow as well as to expand his poultry farm. He says his increased milk production will ensure that the family lives more comfortably. He hopes to acquire more dairy cows in order to gain greater income in future.

Renson mentions fluctuating market prices, costly animal feed, and diseases as his major business challenges. He adds that Juhudi Kilimo has empowered people who are now able to save their income.

loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow and the expansion of his poultry farm

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Petrona P., que antes había formado parte de otro grupo pero como era numeroso y tenían diferencias decidieron dividir el grupo y actualmente ella es la presidenta, es una mujer muy trabajadora que pese a sufrir un infarto sigue activando en pos del mejoramiento del grupo.
Ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de hamburguezas desde un puesto que posee en su casa. Todas la noches desde muy temprano comienza a cocinar a todos los clientes que llegan hasta su puesto.
Le gusta este trabajo por que no le quita mucho tiempo para dedicarle a su familia. 
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de panificados, hamburguezas y gaseosas.
Sus compañeras de grupo tienen su microemprendimiento en marcha y aunque tuvieron un pequeño atraso en el primer préstamo, el anterior pagaron en forma excelente y en el presente préstamo se muestran comprometidas a seguir de la misma manera.
Se sienten muy agradecidas con la Fundación por la oportunidad brindada y esperan continuar en buena forma para aumentar su línea de crédito y a su vez aumentar sus ganancias y ahorros.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Señora Petrona P..  They were part of another group that she put together, but the group was very large and they had differences, so they decided to divide the group.  She is currently the president.  

Señora Petrona is a very hard-working woman, who, despite suffering a heart attack, continues to be active in improving the group.  She makes and sells hamburgers for a living from a stand at her house.  Starting early in the evening, she cooks for all her customers that come to her stand.  She likes this work because it doesn't require long hours and she still has time for her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy buns, hamburgers and soft drinks.

Her fellow group members have their own ongoing small businesses and even though they were a bit late with the payments on their first loan, they made the payments for their last loan on time and they are committed to doing the same with the present loan.  They are very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity they are offering them and hope to remain in good standing to increase their line of credit and, in turn, increase their earnings and savings.

loans.use: To purchase hamburgers and buns

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 58-year-old married man with eight children.  He is able to raise his family with the income he gets from farming.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.  He desires to become a well-known farmer in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Pathani's Group

texts.en:
Pathani is the wife of M. and resides in a city named Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari is a small city known for its agriculture industry. She lives there with her family in a two-room brick house.
  
Pathani is a good-natured lady who always keeps a smile on her face and makes her family brave with encouraging words. She prefers to stay at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well.
 
Her husband has an animal sales business. He has been in this business for many years. He has a good knowledge of animals and, due to this and his good experience, he gets orders from butcher shops. He buys animals from the animal markets for cheap rates, raises them up and sells them for a good profit. 

Pathani helps him in his business by taking care of his cattle. She gives them food and water and keeps their places clean to avoid diseases.
 
Pathani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats and buffalo and sell them for a good profit.
 
Pathani is hopeful that through this investment, her husband will be able to expand his business and improve the financial condition of the family.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old and comes from Musanze.  Emmanuel is a photographer and owns a photo studio, which he has been running for two years.  He is a hard worker who works at the business from 6am until 10pm every day except Saturday. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan in order to expand his business and purchase more photography equipment.  The extra income made from this loan will allow him to further expand his business by buying new materials like computers and cameras.  He would also like to have savings in the future.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy new computers and a camera

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Mercedes is one of the members of her group Mujeres en Desarrollo 1, 2 & 3 (Development women). Mercedes makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and one child. She says that her most difficult challenges are to work hard and have a better life. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying upholstering.

Mercedes is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 years, starting by taking a technical class in upholstering. She operates an upholstery  business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying fabrics, wood, and other items. She will use the profits to invest in her business. The Christmas season is better because people like to upholster their furniture and buy new furniture, too.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed capital for her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free traD. zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity which can't be counted on.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, wood and other items

loans.name: Manal

texts.ar:
منال عزباء وتعمل منذ اكثر من 7 سنوات عمرها 34 سنة منال تعمل في مجال الكوافير وهي تحب عملها كثيرا
لكنها تعاني من منافسة شديدة في محيطها وما ينقصها هو المادة لدعم مصلحتها اكثر منال تتلقى دعم كبير من عائلتها وهي طموحة وتحب 
ان تتطور وان ترقى بعملها الى مستوى جيد تعمل بجد ونشاط وتطور عملها فهي جاهزة لتعلم كل ما هو جديد لتحسين مستوى عملها
منال تريد طلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء ادوات جديدة للصالون وشامبوهات وكريمات للوجه لتحسين وضع محلها وتطويره
زبائنها هم من محيطها وجيرانها
texts.en: Manal is a 34-year-old single woman who has been employed as a hair stylist for the past seven years. Her family is very supportive of her goals, but she faces stiff competition and doesn’t have a lot of funds to draw on. Although Manal already enjoys patronage from her neighbors and other community members, she is very driven and is eager to learn about all the latest practices which can help push her work to the next level. Hence, Manal would like to ask Al Majmoua for a loan to buy new equipment, shampoo, and facial creams for her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase wares for beauty salon

loans.name: Hoseah

texts.en: Hoseah is a 33-year-old businessman.  He sells scrap metals to industries for recycling.  He has been in the business for two years.  He was previously selling household items such as utensils and electronics so as to earn a living.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy scrap metals.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Sadame

texts.en: Sadame is a 28-year-old married man, father of one child, living in Tyre and working as a electrician since 1995. This 15 years of experience have given him an acceptable number  of loyal clients. This is the first time that Sadame is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, and it’s for buying  the whole set-up used for electricity maintenance. Sadame hopes to go through construction work in a wider way.

loans.use: For buying  the whole set-up used for electricity maintenance

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a father of four children, aged between eighteen and six years old. He has been doing mixed farming for over ten years in his hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya. His produce of vegetables, onions and tomatoes are sold to the local markets, especially hotels. He has employed two farmhands.

He has requested for this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He aims at taking his children to the best schools within the area with the income generated from his dairy business. He also wants to change dairy cow breeds for better production. 

Patrick says a lot of their milk products go to waste due to a poor road network, which delays delivery, hence spoilage. He is thankful to Juhudi for this asset-financing project.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow and insurance

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is the wife of B. A. and resides in a city named Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari is a small city famous for its agricultural industry. She is an uneducated lady and couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial condition of her family. In her childhood, she had a great desire in her heart to get a good education, but it couldn’t get fulfilled because her father had a big family to serve. She is very thankful to her mother, that she taught her the skill of embroidery, and now she is getting good benefits from this work. She receives orders from her neighboring customers and earns good income by completing them on time. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur in a fruits & vegetables selling business. He has a shop in the market where he serves his customers and earns good profits. He has been in this business for over 7 years.

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy seasonal fruits & vegetables in bulk quantity and improves his sales. Zarina is hopeful that this investment will bring her husband’s business to a more profitable position and increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Shalom 2 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is one of the members of her group Shalom 2 (Shalom). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is improve her house.  In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying taking care of her children and her house.

Dominga is excited to be taking her 9th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 9 years, starting by selling in a table in her home, and then moving her business to a local market. She operates a Fruit and Vegetables stand. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying vegetables, plantains, bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, etc. She will use the profits to invest in her business and buy some materials to improve her business.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to have an improved business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free traD. zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity that can't be counted on.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, plantains, bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, etc.

loans.name: Bihija

texts.en:
Bihija is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.
Bihija has operated a business selling handbags and shoes from home for the past two years. Neighbors and passers-by are her major customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. In the future, she hopes to establish a beauty salon and boutique.
With this 35,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a bale of handbags and shoes for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of handbags and shoes

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 63-year-old dairy farmer. He farms in Kiambu District, which is known for its good climate for farming. He has been farming for 20 years. In the future, John hopes to own several cows on his farm. Since he joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, he has improved his financial status. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo, de 54 años, convive con Antonia, de 42 años. Ambos tuvieron 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Este vital y trabajador hombre, todos los días se dirige a sus más de 7 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra desde hace ya 12 años, “café”. Aquí el esfuerzo, trabajo y constancia, hicieron del grano de café de Pablo, el mejor de la localidad, y muestra de ello, son los acopiadores de café, que constantemente visitan sus plantaciones, para comprar sus cosechas integras. Muchos como él, ya están mejorando sus producciones, pues el mercado actual requiere de producciones de calidad. Ahora está planeando, abrir un negocio de compra y venta de café al por mayor. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y como socio, trabajador y cumplido, de su banco comunal, se siente desarrollado y muy comprometido con el trabajo que realizan. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado invertir en el salario, de los peones que contratará para aplicar abono y limpiar sus cultivos de café, ya que a veces no se abastece solo.
texts.en:
Pablo is 54 years old.  He lives with his partner, 42 year-old Antonia.  They have 6 children together but only live with 5 of them.  They live in their own home which is in Sanchirio community (in the Peruvian central jungle).  Every day this dynamic and hard-working man heads off to his more than 7 hectares of farmland where he has been growing coffee for 12 years.  His effort, hard work and determination have made Pablo's coffee beans the best in the area and this is clear from the fact that coffee traders constantly visit his plantations to buy his entire harvests.

Many others, like Pablo, are improving their coffee production because the current market requires quality crops.  Pablo is planning to open a business buying and selling coffee wholesale.  This is his third loan with MFP and as a hard-working and punctual member of his community bank, he feels fulfilled and committed to their work.  He is planning to invest his loan in paying the salary of the laborers who he will hire to spread fertilizer and clear the weeds from his coffee crops since sometimes he cannot manage this on his own.

loans.use: To hire laborers to help him spread fertilizer and clear the weeds from his plantations

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 35-year-old single man from Nabatieh. Since 2002, he has run a business selling clothes and shoes. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new collection of clothes and shoes for the Holly season. Hussein’s products are of a good quality and his prices are affordable to people in his region. His customers like to buy from his shop because he offers good customer service. Hussein puts his customers first and seeks perfection in his work. He dreams of opening a big shop or new branches in the region.

loans.use: To buy new clothes and shoes collection for the Holly season

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a resident of a city named Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its agricultural industry. She is 37 years old, a talented lady, and she owns & operates her embroidery business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She mainly receives orders from her neighboring areas and earns good income by completing them on time.

Her husband's name is M. R., and he is involved in a poultry business. He supplies chickens to different butcher shops, plus chicken and eggs to different grocery shops, to earn good income. He has been in this business for many years. He has a good name in his region due to his good, quality services.

Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy chicks and chicken feed to further expand his poultry business. Kosar is hopeful that this investment will make a good impact on her husband’s business and help him increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed for her husband's poultry business

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo vive en Anticrético cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la villa exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto. Juan Pablo es Chofer y trabaja en el radio taxi omega y su esposa vende productos de belleza de la línea  de Esika. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene un hijo. 
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la realizar un mantenimiento general a su herramienta de trabajo. Esto le permitirá trabajar mejor.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo lives in 'anticrético' (a special rental system particular to Bolivia).  His home is located in Villa Exaltación, in the city of El Alto.  Juan Pablo is a driver and works for Radio Taxi Omega.  His wife sells Esika beauty products.  This is Juan Pablo's main source of income.  He has one child.

This loan will be used to have his vehicle serviced which will allow him to work better.

This is his first loan from Impro.

loans.use: To pay to have his taxi serviced

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo de 2 años, es soltera; la señora es empleada en la administración publica, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos. El crédito lo destinará a la refacción de una habitación y de la cocina en la casa de sus padres, para vivir más cómodamente.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her parents' home in Pasankeri district, in the city of La Paz, with her two year-old son.  She is single.  Maria works as a civil servant and uses her income to support herself.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan.  She will use her loan to refurbish a bedroom and the kitchen in her parents' house so that they can live more comfortably.

The socio-economic analysis that we have performed qualifies Maria for a loan.

loans.use: To pay to refurbish a bedroom and the kitchen in her parents' house

loans.name: C1186 Ituze Group

texts.en:
Ladislas is 45 years old and married with six children between the ages of 8 and 23. He is the president of a group called “Ituze” and this group have a variety of businesses including boutiques, bars, bean and sorghum sales. Ladislas has a bar and shop selling a variety of general store items. He has been in this business for about one year and is open from 7am until 5pm every day. He employs two people.
Ladislas and his team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more stock for their various businesses. With the use of this loan, Ladislas and his team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will be used to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his bar and general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Y Amor 3 Group

texts.en:
Claudita is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres de Fe y Amor 3 (Women of Faith and Love). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She operates a cafeteria and business selling underwear. Claudita says that her most difficult challenge is to finish her schooling. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to serve the Lord and share with her family.
Claudita is excited to be taking her first loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza. She has had her business for about five years, which she started with her savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying snacks, soda, candies and underwear. She will use the profits to invest in her business and pay for her studies. Her dream is to expand her business and be able to depend on it.
This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to overcome economic crisis. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water, none of which is potable.

loans.use: To buy snacks, soda, candies and underwear

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina, de 24 años, está casada con Iván, de 25 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Jean, de 8, Juan, de 2 y Percy, de 9 meses de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). Está joven mujer y madre; desde niña, se dedicó a sembrar, limpiar y cosechar sus terrenos agrícolas. Ya tiene 12 años dedicándose a ello, pero hace 3 años comenzó a generar sus propios ingresos, pues el motor de su progreso y desarrollo son sus hijos. Su principal producción consta de café y plátanos, los que después de cada cosecha, los comercializa a los intermediarios que constantemente visitan la zona. El deseo de Carolina, es comprar más terrenos agrícolas, donde pueda sembrar en mayores cantidades, pues su aspiración es poder ser una de los mejores agricultores de su localidad. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y está segura que si sigue trabajando con ahínco y empeño podrá salir adelante, junto a su banco comunal. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado compra de 3 sacos de guano de isla (fertilizante natural), con el que esparcirá en sus cultivos de café y, si el dinero le alcanza podrá invertir en la contrata de peones, para que le ayuden en la limpieza de la maleza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Carolina is 24 years old.  She is married to 25 year-old Iván.  The couple have 3 children: Jean aged 8, Juan aged 2 and Percy aged 9 months.  They live together in their own house which is in the community of Sanchirio del Palomar (in the Peruvian central jungle).  This young woman and mother has been sowing, weeding and harvesting her farmland since she was a girl.  She has been doing this work for 12 years but 3 years ago she started making her own income since the driving force behind her progress and development are her children.

Carolina's main crops are coffee and bananas.  After every harvest she sells her crops to the middlemen who constantly visit the area.  Carolina's wish is to buy more land where she can sow more crops since her aspiration is to become one of the best farmers in her area.

This is Carolina's third loan with MFP and she is sure that if she keeps working hard and with determination, she will be able to get ahead in life, together with her community bank.

Carolina plans to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of guano (a natural fertilizer) which she will spread over her coffee crops and, if there is enough money left over, she will also invest in hiring laborers to help her clear the weeds from her crops.

loans.use: To buy 3 sacks of fertilizer and hire laborers to help her weed her land

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald vive en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es comerciante, elabora embutidos (chorizo de carne de res, carne de chancho y carne de pollo).
Es soltero y no tiene hijos.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de carne, tripa, y condimentos) para mejorar la cantidad de producción y sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, requiere el apoyo ya que cuenta con poco capital de trabajo dándole la oportunidad de mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Ronald lives in Obrajes district, in the city of La Paz.  He makes sausages (beef, pork and chicken chorizos).  He is single and doesn't have any children

This loan will be used as working capital (to buy meat, sausage casings and seasonings) to improve the quantity of sausages he makes and his income.

This is the first time that Ronald has requested a loan from Impro.  He needs the support since he doesn't have much working capital and this will give him the opportunity to improve his production.

loans.use: To buy beef, pork and chicken, sausage casings and seasonings for his sausage-making business

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of Forging Goals And Dreams Group

texts.en:
The Women's Bank of Forging Goals and Dreams is comprised of six women members who live and work in Jaris, San Jose, in the central valley of Costa Rica. Historically, the members of this group have demonstrated their ability to fulfill their loan repayment responsibilities while undergoing difficulties within the group. During the lifespan of a prior loan, some group members faced challenges in making repayments. Despite this internal problem, the group as a whole was never late making repayments, i.e. the members banded together in solidarity to ensure the group was on time with their repayments. The loan consultant who has been working with this group over the years has described the members as hardworking entrepreneurs.
Jaris is a rural community with poor access to full-time job opportunities. The main methods of subsistence are through activities in agricultural production such as the rearing of pigs and the production of sugar cane, among others. The women of this group are unanimously involved in the rearing and sale of pork products. This loan will be used by each group member to make investments in livestock, animal feed, nutrients and construction materials (to build pig pens).
Flora V. S. is the elected president of this group. Flora is a 55-year-old mother of eight who lives with her family in Jaris. She dedicates the mornings and afternoons to the care of her livestock. She feeds and cleans her pigs twice a day, when necessary, and her husband helps her. When she isn't taking care of the animals, Flora is carrying out various household responsibilities, including cooking and cleaning. The rearing of pigs is the sole source of family income for Flora and her family.
Flora's goals are to be able to earn enough income from the sale of pork products to enable the provision of a higher standard of living for her family. An obstacle she faces is the fluctuating prices for nutrients, pig food and livestock. An increase in prices for any one of these will eat away at her profits, as will a decrease in the market value of pork products.
The members of this group have been able to access credit, as well as favorable loan conditions, through the group lending model. In traditional financial institutions, a loan guarantor is needed in order to be approved for a loan. With the group lending model, each member acts as a guarantor for another member, which makes it easier for the poor to access loans. The women have grown to know each other on a deep and personal level, as they have lived in the same community for most of their lives. As a group, each woman makes a guarantee to make repayments and support others if they have trouble making repayments. This will be the group's fourth loan with Kiva partner, Fundación Mujer. Over the years, the members have observed loans contributing to an overall improvement in living conditions, enabling mothers to better support their children's studies, good health and livelihoods. The women of this group act as a support network for one another. Monthly meetings and group activities allow the women to take a break from their daily routines, contribute to a positive change in their community, and provide an opportunity to get together with other women.
