Working together on various problems, whether they are rooted in family or business, has allowed the women to develop feelings of solidarity and strength within the group.

loans.use: For the purchase of pigs and animal feed/nutrients

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma es casada y tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus suegros, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente es empleada de una galería vendiendo ropa para mayores y niños, además se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza; el esposo trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de llantas para movilidades.
El crédito lo utilizará para abastecerse de material de belleza. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su segundo crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Irma is married and has one school-age child.  She lives in her in-laws' house which is located in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz.

Irma works in a mall selling adults' and children's clothes.  She also sells beauty products.  Her husband sells all kinds of tires for vehicles.

Irma will use her loan to stock up on beauty products.  That is how she makes income for her household.

This is Irma's second loan and the socio-economic analysis we have carried out shows that she can access another loan.

loans.use: To buy women's beauty products for her sales business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a furniture shop, selling tables and beds. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing timber to use in her furniture shop. She hopes to open a cafe and expand her workshop in the future.

With the loan of 30,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase timber, paint and nails. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase timber, paint and nails.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya. He has been doing dairy farming for three years and has been selling his milk products to the local market. He has one farmhand in the farm.

He has requested for this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He belives this will boost his income and make the family more comfortable financially. He gets additional income from his retail shop business.

The challenge is limited animal feed availability, which makes milk production unstable.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow and insurance for it

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 27-year-old married lady who is blessed with one child.  She has been selling clothes for a living for seven years.  Most of her customers are people in her local area.  In addition, she farms in order to earn extra income.  

Ann is hardworking and hopes to become a successful business-lady in the future.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her to save her money.  

She has requested for 35, 000 Kes to buy shirts and blouses.

loans.use: To buy shirts and blouses

loans.name: Dany

texts.es: Dany, de 18 años, vive con su papá Luis, de 59 años y su mamá Rosa, de 45 años. A los que quiere y cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Esté emprendedor joven, hace 2 años que viene dedicándose a la agricultura. El tiempo que le resta después de estudiar, lo dedica al cuidado de las plantaciones de café de sus padres. Pero ahora, hace tan solo 1 año adquirió 4 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, donde por fin pudo sembrar sus propios cultivos de café y plátano. El plátano según cuenta cada 15 días los comercializa en el mercado de su localidad, pero la cosecha de café, los vende en la cooperativa de la ciudad de Perene, donde acopian el café para procesarlo. Pero el deseo de Dany, es poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía, con el cual piensa apoyar a los agricultores de su localidad. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y agradece por el apoyo de su banco comunal, donde le dieron fuerzas para salir adelante, sobre todo la oportunidad de ser un hombre independiente y trabajador. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 4 mil plantas de café, con los que renovará sus plantaciones de café, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Dany, 18, lives with his father, Luis, 59, and his mother, Rosa, 45.  He loves and cares for them in their own house located in Sanchirio (Peruvian central jungle).

This enterprising young man has been farming for the last two years.  On his free time when he finishes with his studies he takes care of his parents’ coffee plants.

But now, just a year ago he acquired four hectares of farmland where he was finally able to plant his own coffee and banana plants.  According to him, he sells bananas every two weeks at his local market but he sells the coffee crop to a cooperative in the city of Perene where coffee is amassed for processing.  Dany’s wish, however, is to study the professional career of Agronomy that he hopes to use to help local farmers.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is grateful for the support from his communal bank where they gave him the strength to get ahead, above all the opportunity to be an independent, working man.

If he were to get the requested loan, he will use it to buy 4000 coffee plants with which to renew his coffee plantations. If there is money left over, he will use it to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: To buy 4000 coffee plants and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Cristo Redentor 5 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is one of the members of a group called Cristo Redentor 5 (Christ Redeemer). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to offer credits to her customers because she has lost capital. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook and relaxing at her home.

Ramona is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for four years, which started as a stand offering candies and snacks. Now, she operates a 'colmado,' a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally, colmados are in the same neighborhood within a short walk from any home.  

She plans to use this loan to buy rice, flour and other foods. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save.

This Esperanza associate began borrowing because she needed capital for her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry. The main economic activities are a free trading zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour and oil

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a single man. For a living, he operates a driving school. He has engaged in the business for two years.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable. He hopes to expand his driving school in the future.  

He has requested for 30, 000 Kes to buy a computer.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is a wife of M. H. and resides in a city named Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari is a small city and famous for its agricultural industry.  

She is 40 years old and is involved in an embroidery business. She makes embroidered clothes on orders, which she receives from her neighboring customers, and earns income by completing them on time. She is very skillful in her work. Due to her quality work, she gets regular orders every month. She chooses this profession because she likes it. She crafts beautiful designs on clothes, which helps her to attract more people toward her work. Her earning allows her to pay for the utilities expenses of her family. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur in a fertilizer and seeds selling business. Because Vehari city is famous for its agricultural industry, that’s why most people are in the agricultural profession. His work gives him good income because he approaches a good number of farmers and they give him a good number of orders to fulfill. 

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizer and seeds in larger quantity to fulfill larger orders on time and to increase his income. Manzooran is hopeful that through this investment, her husband will be able to grow his business and increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married, with four children aged between sixteen and one. She has been doing mixed farming for eight years and selling her milk, maize and beans products locally.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. It is her second loan, after the first one of 25,000 KES. Her purpose is to expand her poultry farming project. This expansion, she believes, will enable her to pay for her children's educations and improve their economic status in general.

She sees poultry feed scarcity as a threat, since it makes returns quite unpredictable.

loans.use: Expansion of her poultry business

loans.name: Akossiwoa

texts.fr: Akossiwa a 28 ans. Elle est née à Lomé et vit à Hédzranawoe. Elle exerce la vente des assiettes et plastiques où elle tire assez de revenus. A travers son activité, elle a remboursé déjà beaucoup de crédit. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend en suite ses marchandises au marché de Hédzranawoe et compte dans cette activité près de 5 ans. Le crédit sollicité permettra d’accroitre son commerce.
texts.en: Akossiwa is 28 years old. She was born at Lomé and lives in Hédzranawoe.She has a plate and plastics store from which she makes a quite a good income. Through her business, she has already repaid several loans. She buys her stock in Ghana at Accra and at the big market in Lomé.She sells her wares at the Hédzranawoe market and has been working at this activity for about 5 years. The loan requested will permit her to enlarge her business.

loans.use: purchase of plastic goods and plates

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying wire, posts and staples for maintenance

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 49-year-old mother of three.  She sells newspapers and magazines to earn a living.  She has managed to employ one person in her business.  She also relies on her husband for financial support.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to build a house for her family. She hopes to become financially stable in the future.  She has requested for 25,000 Kes to buy magazines, journals and newspapers.

loans.use: To buy newspapers, journals and magazines

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chahuira pampa. El es productor lechero y su esposa le colabora en todas las actividades agrícolas. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Martin tiene tres hijos con su esposa. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Martin lives in his own house; this residence is located in the community of Chahuira Pampa. He is a dairy farmer, and his wife helps him in all of his agricultural work. This is his main source of income and support. Martin and his wife have three children. 

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow. This will permit him to increase his milk production and improve his income. 
 
This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow to increase his milk production volume and improve his income

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 40 años, es una orgullosa madre soltera de 4 hijos, pero solo vive con una de ellos: Marco, de 11 años de edad. A quien educa y cría en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad de Palca. Como madre soltera, ella afirma que tienen más fuerzas y vitalidad para salir adelante. “Tengo que trabajar al doble y ser el ejemplo de mis hijos”, afirma. Con esfuerzo y dedicación logró sacar adelante a la mayoría de sus hijos, ya que la agricultura es su principal sustento. Sus sembríos de papa, arvejas y demás hortalizas, le proporcionan buenos ingresos, en cada campaña de cosecha. Ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a ello, y los compradores mayoristas del mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma, la conocen por ser una mujer luchadora y optimista. Pero, para sustentar la educación universitaria de sus demás hijos, ella hace 2 años, comenzó a vender agua de manzana, y demás bebidas a base de harina de maca y soya, los que acompaña con porciones de pan, este negocio le genera muchas ganancias, y ahora quiere acondicionar su puesto de venta, para que sus clientes se sienten a gusto. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y como integrante de su banco comunal, se siente muy feliz de todo el apoyo que recibe por su banco comunal. Ya tiene pensado destinar el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono, para su cultivo de papa. Como también comprará quintales de harina para su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old.  She is a proud single mother of 4 children but currently only lives with one of them: Marco, aged 11.  She educates and raises her son in her own home which is located in the town of Palca.  As a single mother, she confirms that she has a lot of strength and vitality for getting ahead in life.  “I have to work twice as hard and be an example for my children” she comments.

Through her hard work and determination, she has managed to get most of her children ahead in life, since farming is her main support.  She grows potatoes, peas and other vegetables which make her a good income each harvest season.  Carmen has been in this business for 5 years and the wholesale purchasers in the central market of the city of Tarma know her as a determined and optimistic woman.

However, in order to support the university education of her other children, two years ago Carmen also started selling sweetened apple water and other drinks made from 'maca' flour and soya flour which she sells together with pieces of bread.  This business is very profitable and now she would like to adapt her sales stall so that her customers feel comfortable.

This is Carmen's third loan with MFP and she feels very happy for all the support which her community bank has provided her with.  She is planning to use her loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer for her potato crop.  She will also buy 100kg sacks of flour for her business.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and 100kg sacks of flour

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 30 years old and married with two children aged one and five years old. She runs a mechanic business in Byumba district in Rwanda.  She`s been in this business for two years and sells spare parts at the store.  Her business is open from 7am until 6pm.  She also earns some income from farming.  

This is Marie Claire's second loan requested through Vision Finance Company and she will use it to expand her business through purchasing spare parts to sell.  e extra income from this loan will help her to reinvest in the future.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 23 years old and already in business. He operates a general store where he sells foodstuffs as well as charcoal. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to add stock of unga (maize and wheat flour) and sugar to his general store. Stephen is a member of Springs Youth SHG and the loan is guaranteed by the group. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale business with a five year plan of venturing into the transport industry. Stephen is married and describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock of unga (maize and wheat flour) and sugar

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida lives in Lahore, which is located in Pakistan and is known for its history and culture. Shahida lives there, in the area named Ismail nagar, with her family in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 6 years ago. 

Her husband runs a stationery shop in the market, where he sells books, notebooks, pencils, ballpoint pens, etc. His shop is well-known in the area because he keeps all the necessary items in his shop to fullfil the timely needs of his customers.

Shahida herself is a seamstress, sewing clothes for her neighboring clients on order. She learned this art of sewing from a sewing school at an early age and became an expert by much practice. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month. She is the mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are studying by attending a local school. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his stationery shop business. With the loan, he will buy the stationery items in bulk quantity, which will help him make more sales and income. Shahida is hopeful that by investing a loan in his stationery business, her husband will successfully be able to grow his business, which will help her family to live a better standard of life. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Shahida.

loans.use: To buy stationery, pencils, notebooks, books, etc., for the stationery shop business

loans.name: Cheyech

texts.en:
Cheyech is 33 years old and has been doing mixed farming for eight years, producing milk, eggs and vegetables, and selling to the local market.

She has applied for this loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, her third loan, and plans grow her income from the dairy business and make life better for her family. She gets additional income from her money-transfer business with the leading communication firm in the country. She wishes to have four cows in five years' time.

Her challenge is frequent food shortages and animal diseases.

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa, de 49 años, estuvo casada con Pablo, del que enviudó hace 15 años atrás; con el que tiene 6 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos: Vanesa, de 21 y Hernán de 18 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Palca. La incansable Felipa, trabaja con ahínco en sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembra papa, arveja, hortalizas y una variedad de flores. Desde que tenía 19 años, junto a su esposo Pablo, emprendieron la ardua tarea de surgir en la agricultura, ya que tuvieron que pasar muchas necesidades y esfuerzos para adquirir sus propios terrenos agrícolas, donde ahora sus cosechas son bien pagadas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. En honor a la memoria de su esposo, Felipa trabaja arduamente para poder generar más ingresos, por ello está invirtiendo en la mejora de sus cultivos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta segura de ser responsable en cada uno de los pagos para así seguir progresando en la vida. Ya tiene pensado destinar el crédito que recibirá, en la comprará de 2 bolsas de semillas de arveja, de la misma manera comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, para sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Felipa is 49 years old.  She was married to Pablo who left her a widow 15 years ago.  She has 6 children from her marriage but only lives with 2 of them: 21 year-old Vanesa and 18 year-old Hernán.  They live in a rental house in the town of Palca.  The untiring Felipa works hard on her farmland where she grows potatoes, peas, vegetables and a variety of flowers.

When she was 19 years old, together with her husband Pablo, she undertook the arduous task of becoming a farmer.  They had to work very hard and make a lot of effort to acquire their own land where her harvests now receive a good price in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  In honor of her husband's memory, Felipa works hard to be able to make more income.  For this reason, she is investing in improving her crops.

This is Felipa's third loan from MFP and she is certain that she will be responsible in every one of her repayments so that she can continue making progress in life.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 2 bags of pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer for her potato crops.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 31 years old and married. He owns a printing service located in Kimironko, a suburb of Kigali. His business is open from 7am until 4pm every day and he has one years' experience.
Gilbert has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more paper, ink for printers, files, etc. and more internet broadband access. His dream is to buy more computers for his growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more paper, ink and internet access

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married lady with two children. To earn a living, she operates a medical clinic, which she opened four years ago. Her clinic serves mainly the people in her local area. So far, she has managed to employ one person. She also does poultry farming to supplement her family’s income. She dreams of expanding her clinic in five years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy medicine and an Hb machine.

loans.use: To buy medicine and an Hb machine

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a businesslady in Kiambu. She operates a grocery shop where she sells onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage and other groceries. She has been running this business for a year and her customers are local residents since her business is located in a residential area. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy two bags of potatoes, two bags of onions and four bags of cabbage. Jane is married and a mother of one. She describes herself as very ambitious.

loans.use: To buy two bags of potatoes, two bags of onions and four bags of cabbage

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 39 años, convive con Andrés, de 46 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Marisela, de 13 y Cairo, de 11 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palca, Cuenta alegre, que se siente desarrollada ayudando a su esposo, en los gasto del hogar; pues desde que era niña, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en el campo y como tradición familiar, ella nunca se alejo de ello, Hace 4 años que heredó un terreno agrícola, donde siembra papa, arveja y lechuga, los que después de cada cosecha lo comercializa a los intermediarios que visitan sus terrenos agrícolas constantemente. Pero a Gloria hace 3 años, se le ocurrió una idea. Comprar flores al por mayor y llevarlos a la capital, ya que el mercado ahí es muy bueno y las ganancias son mayores. Ahora ella, viaja una vez por semana, y como le va muy bien está pensando ahorrar para comprarse un camión, con el que pueda trasladarse con mayor facilidad. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y como socia de su banco comunal, está orgullosa de sus integrantes, ya que son mujeres responsables y luchadoras. Ya tiene pensado destinar el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arveja, y el resto del dinero invertirá en la compra de gladíolos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Gloria is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner Andrés who is 46 years old.  The couple have 4 children but only live with 2 of them: 13 year-old Marisela and 11 year-old Cairo.  The family lives in their own home in the town of Palca.  Gloria happily tells us that she feels satisfied helping her husband to cover their household expenses since when she was a little girl her parents taught her how to farm and, as it is a family tradition, she never stopped.

Four years ago Gloria inherited a plot of farmland where she grows potatoes, peas and lettuces which she sells after each harvest to the middlemen who constantly visit her land.  However, 3 years ago Gloria had an idea.  She decided to start buying flowers wholesale and take them to the capital since the market there is a good one and the profits are better.  Now she travels there once a week and as her new business is doing very well she is thinking of buying a truck which would enable her to travel more easily.

This is Gloria's third loan with MFP and, as a member of her community bank, she is proud of the bank's members who are responsible and determined women.  She will use her loan to buy 2 bags of pea seeds and will invest the rest of the money in buying gladioli wholesale.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of pea seeds and to buy gladioli wholesale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 29 years old. She offers computer services such as typesetting, editing, printing and photocopying in Nairobi. She also operates a computer college where she trains people in basic computer skills. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase office stationery such as cartridges. Jane is a member of Tupendane SHG and her loan is guaranteed by the group. She employs two people and hopes to own an IT firm in the future. She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase office stationery, e.g. cartridges

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Elle a 28 ans et est mariée à un gendarme. Elle est coiffeuse de profession mais associe la vente de mèches et produit de beauté. Elle achète au magasin mèche Amina à Lomé et revend dans son atelier à Hédzranawoe à côté de la clinique de l’Aéroport. Elle est aidée par une employée et cumule dans cette activité 7 ans déjà. Le prêt demandé permettra d’acheter de nouveaux lots de mèches et produits de beauté.
texts.en: She is 28 years old and married to a policeman. She is a hairdresser by profession but also sells hair strands and beauty products. She buys her stock at the Amina hair strand shop in Lomé and sells her produce in her salon in Hédzranawoe next to the Airport clinic. She has an employee to help her and has been working in this activity for 7 years already. The loan requested will enable her to purchase a batch of strands and beauty products.

loans.use: purchase of hair strands and beauty products

loans.name: Zeidy

texts.en:
Zeidy is a 37 year old mother of two who lives with her family in San Jose, in the central valley of Costa Rica. In the community where she lives, there is a lack of full time job opportunities. Zeidy has taken it upon herself to create a way to generate income in an effort to improve living conditions for her family. Zeidy is in the business of pig rearing. She hopes to use this loan to invest in the purchase of livestock and animal feed. Zeidy works with her husband to ensure the good health of her animals. Together, they clean and feed the pigs twice a day. 

Zeidy has already spent some time studying business administration. Her goals are: to continue her studies and obtain a university education, achieve financial independence and open her own business one day. The main challenges that Zeidy faces, with respect to her pig rearing activity, is a lack of working capital. This loan will help to address this challenge. Likewise, the fluctuating prices of livestock and the market price for pork products has a great impact on the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: For the purchase of livestock (pigs) and animal feed.

loans.name: Bernilda Rosa

texts.es:
Bernilda J. es una mujer D. 65 años dedicada a la venta D. cosméticos, perfumería y fantasía en general. Ella es casada y tiene un hijo, que en su barrio Educador D. la ciudad D. Cartagena y sus aledaños todo el mundo conoce porque tiene una pequeña miscelanea en su casa y reparte mercancía, ella usualmente se mueve entre cosméticos, perfumes y fantasías, a un muy  buen precio y con mucha alegría y dinamismo. Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará perfumería y cosméticos aprovechando que sus clientes D. estos productos se provisionan con mayor intensidad en la temporada D. Diciembre, porque conoce que la gente recibe primas, bonificaciones, dineros que le ayudan a comprar todo lo que en un año necesitan y no pueden obtener. DesD. hace 15 años es negociante,  inicialmente preparaba  almuerzos  que vendía  a una constructora  desD. su casa, pero gradualmente   fue cambiando  esta actividad por las fluctuaciones del mercado y muy  frecuentes épocas D. bajas  ventas, pero dio un viraje aprovechando que había logrado una importante clientela doméstica y se ha dedicado exclusivamente a vender   fantasías, cosméticos y perfumes en su  zona  D. residencia y en las  aledañas , que es principalmente donD.   distribuye a crédito  sus productos; ella venD. D. contado y tambien planea el financiamiento D. cada clientes, usualmente es con la misma gente que durante su experiencia ha logrado conocer y sabe que son muy buenas pagadoras D. sus cuotas.
Con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo Bernilda no solo ha recibido financiamiento,  sino también el aprendizaje D. cómo administrar su negocio y por eso tiene conciencia muy clara del manejo D. sus ingresos. Su sueño, el D. ampliar su negocio, no lo abandona porque sabe que con esfuerzo constante y disciplina todo se logra, aunque su capital D. trabajo no es D. gran proporción, poco a conseguirá ser exitosa como ella quiere.
texts.en:
Bernilda J. is 65 years old.  She sells cosmetics, perfumes and costume jewelry.  She is married and has one child.  In her neighborhood of Educador, in the city of Cartagena and the surrounding areas, everybody knows her because she has a small general store in her home and she distributes merchandise.  She usually sells cosmetics, perfumes and costume jewelry for a very good price and she does this with a lot of happiness and energy.

This is Bernilda's second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy perfumes and cosmetics, taking advantage of the fact that her customers buy more of these products in the December season because this is when she knows that her customers receive bonuses and money with which they can buy everything that they need in a year but can't obtain.

Bernilda has been a businesswoman for 15 years.  Initially she maD. and sold lunches to a construction company from her home but she gradually started to change her business activity due to the fluctuations in the market and the very frequent periods of low sales.  However, she changed direction, taking advantage of the fact that she had attracted a substantial domestic customer base and started exclusively selling costume jewelry, cosmetics and perfumes in her local district and surrounding areas which is where she distributes her products on credit.  She sells for cash and also plans payment systems for individual customers.  Usually this is with customers who she has got to know and who she knows are very good at paying in installments.

Bernilda hasn't only received loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo but also training in how to run her business.  For this reason, she knows very well how to manage her income.  Her dream is to expand her business.  She does not neglect her business because she knows that with constant hard work and discipline, you can achieve anything.  Although she doesn't have much working capital, she will soon become successful which is what she wishes for.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and cosmetics, taking advantage of the fact that her customers buy more of these products during the December season

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is member of Sunshine Self-Help group. To raise her family, she sells curios. She has been in the business for five years. Jennifer is a hardworking lady who hopes to become financially stable in the future. For this reason, she works hard in her business. Jennifer has requested a 20,000 Kes loan to buy beads, wood carvings and sandals made from beads and leather.

loans.use: To buy beads, wood carvings, and sandals made from beads and leather.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen belongs to Lahore which is the 2nd largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives there in the area named Mughalpura in a 2-room brick house with her family. She came here after her marriage. She is 48 years old, married to A. M., and has a son who is 27 years old and works in a school for a little income. 

Her husband is a waiter in a restaurant, while Nasreen operates her sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She is an expert in her work and can sew every designer's clothes. Due to her quality work, she gets regular orders from her neighboring clients and generates income for the family. Her income allows her to pay off the utilities expenses of her family.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her complete the orders even faster and allow her take more orders in a month. Her old sewing machine is very slow in producing quality work. She started this business 3 years ago and is hopeful that through this investment she will be able to improve her business further.  She has a desire to marry off her son soon, and she is hopeful that she will be able to buy the dowry of his marriage from the loan profit. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady with a hand raised is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Mujeres De La Hondonada Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of the group Mujeres de la Hondonada (Women from Hondonada). Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom have recently immigrated to the Dominican Republic) and Dominican clients. The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and one child.

Santa has come to Esperanza with the goal of growing her business, which supplies salons in her neighborhood with hair products. With this loan she intends to purchase hair products such as shampoo, rinse, and conditioner. She believes that this will allow her to supply more salons and to distinguish herself by always having what is needed in stock, while providing high quality products. She will use the profits to invest in her business, to address some needs in her family and to save. In the long term she would like to continue growing her business with Esperanza to the point where she can sell more products, reach more clients and eventually have enough profits to purchase her own home.

loans.use: To buy hair products such as shampoo, rinse, and conditioner.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
María  Blanquécet  vive en Cartagena y se dedica a la fabricación de chichas y refrescos en general, además de mercancía variada y  de cilindros para los restaurantes y amas decas. Ella inició con la venta de mercancía variadas como ropa y fantasía en general lo que en la actualidad hace directamente y también prepara chichas que vende a través de dos vendedores los cuales reparten su producto en todos los los sectores aledaños al barrio Nelson Mandela en la ciudad de Cartagena, donde ella vive con su cónyuge y tiene cuatro hijos en las edades de 19 a 30 años. María  muy conciente de la oportunidad y observando  que hasta estos sectores no llega el gas natural,  se dedicó a comercializar cilindros de gas, para que las amas de   casa  cuando se les termine este producto de consumo diario, que tiene una duración de un mes, se acerquen a comprarle, ellas llevan tanques vacios y María les entrega el que está lleno; así ellas no detendrán el proceso de preparación de las comidas a sus familias y para los pequeños restaurantes y comidas rápidas que ya conocen su negocio.  
Este es su quinceavo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su credikiva comprará mercancía que tiene sobre pedidos, que vistan a sus clientes en este fin de año y cilindros de gas, porque como todos los años para esta época se escasean, por el alto consumo de alimentos que generan las fiestas navideñas  tiene muchos pedidos que   le han hecho los restaurantes por anticipado. Desde que ingresó a esta organización María ha logrado con los créditos a los cuales les ha agregado  su trabajo y responsabilidad comprar su casa propia porque antes estaba arrendad, y ahora sueña con mejorarla provisionándola de mejores materiales de construcción., así mismo tiene como meta mas adelante tener una refresquería que le genere un mayor ingreso, pero aun no tiene el capital de trabajo que ello requiere y debe trabajar para lograrlo.
texts.en:
María Blanquécet lives in Cartagena.  She makes 'chicha' (a soft drink made from corn) and soft drinks in general.  She also sells various merchandise and cylinders of gas which she provides to restaurants and housewives.  María started out selling various merchandise such as clothes and costume jewelry which she currently sells directly.  She also makes 'chicha' which she distributes through two people who sell her product in all the surrounding districts in Nelson Mandela neighborhood of the city of Cartagena where she lives with her husband and four children aged 19 to 30.

María is very much aware of opportunities and as she saw that natural gas doesn't reach these areas, she started selling cylinders of gas so that when housewives find this product, which they use every day, has run out (a cylinder lasts about a month), they come to her to buy more.  They bring empty cylinders and María gives them full ones.  In this way, the housewives don't have to stop preparing meals for their families.  She also supplies small restaurants and fast food places who already know of her business.

This is María's fifteenth loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use her Kiva loan to buy merchandise for which she has orders from her customers in this end-of-year season and also cylinders of gas because, as is the case every year, during this season they are in short supply since Christmas parties mean that a lot of food is prepared.  She has many orders which restaurants have already made with her in advance.

Since she joined our organization,  María has managed to use her loans to increase her work and responsibility and to buy her own house since the one she lived in before was rented.  She now dreams of improving her home, providing it with better building materials.  She also has a future goal of opening a soft drinks store to make more income although she still doesn't have the working capital that this requires and she will need to work to achieve it.

loans.use: To buy clothes for which she has orders and cylinders of gas to supply restaurants

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 24 años, convive con Antonio, de 27 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Vanesa, de 4 y Dianita de 2 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa arrendada, ubicada en la comunidad de Palca.    Está trabajadora mujer, se dedica a muchas actividades, uno de ellos es la venta de golosinas y mazamorra en puerta del Jardín más reconocido de su localidad, donde todas las mañanas los niños y niñas le compran sus productos. Pero la actividad a la que dedicó, más años de su vida es la agricultura, desde que tenía 21 años, Alicia, se dedicaba al trabajo en el campo, sus cultivos son de arveja, papa y una diversa variedad de flores; los que en cada cosecha comercializa en la capital, donde viaja una vez por semana. Alicia, afirma que en el mes de noviembre tenía que cosechar sus flores, pero por los problemas climáticos se retrazó. Ahora para fiestas navideñas, existe gran demanda de las flores en el país. Por ello está planeando viajar a la capital en estos meses. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y se siente contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal, porqué entre sus integrantes reina la cooperación y el apoyo mutuo. Ya tiene pensado destinar el crédito, en la compra de 5 bolsas de semilla de arveja, como también invertirá en la compra de abono y la contrata de peones para que le ayuden a controlar las plagas que constantemente asota sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Alicia is 24 years old.  She lives with her partner Antonio who is 27 years old.  They have 2 children: 4 year-old Vanesa and 2 year-old Dianita.  They live together in a rental house which is in the community of Palca.

This hard-working woman has a number of business activities.  One of them is selling candies and 'mazamorra' (a sweet pudding) by the entrance to the most well-known park in her town where every morning children buy her products.  However, the business in which she has been engaged for the longest is farming.  She has been farming since she was 21 years old.  Alicia works in the fields.  She grows peas, potatoes and a wide variety of flowers.  She sells each harvest in the capital, where she travels once a week.  Alicia confirms that she should have harvested her flowers in November but due to weather problems the harvest was delayed.  Now, during the Christmas holiday season, there is a high demand for flowers in the country.  For this reason, she is planning to travel to the capital.

This is Alicia's third loan with MFP and she feels happy with the her community bank's work because there is great cooperation and mutual support between its members.  She is planning to use this loan to buy 5 bags of pea seeds and also to invest in buying fertilizer and to pay laborers who she will hire to help her control the insect infestations which constantly attack her crops.

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of pea seeds, sacks of fertilizer and to pay laborers who she will hire to protect her crops from insect infestations

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco, de 20 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palca. Esté joven y trabajador hombre, hace un años que abrió su restaurante en sociedad con su padre. Por las mañanas vende platos a la carta y mariscos, ya por las tardes bebidas calientes, como café y mates. El negocio le genera muy buenas ganancias a Marco, diariamente vende 60 platos de comida, sin contar las bebidas calientes por las noches, que todo poblador de Palca consume, ya que el frío en ese lugar es insoportable. Con el pasar de los meses Marco, compró un televisor y un equipo de sonido, de esta manera hace más acogedor su restaurante. Pero las ambiciones de este joven, son mayores, ahora quiere abrir, un centro de diversiones, donde pueda poner música, pista de baile y bebidas de toda clase.  Este es el primer crédito con MFP y esta segura de ser responsable en cada uno de los pagos para así seguir trabajando con su banco comunal. Ya tiene pensado destinar el crédito solicitado en el alquiler de un local espacioso, donde pueda poner su centro de diversiones.
texts.en:
Marco is 20 years old.  He lives with his parents and siblings in their own home which is in the town of Palca.  This hard-working young man opened his own restaurant with his father a few years ago.  In the mornings he sells à la carte dishes and seafood and in the afternoons he serves hot drinks such as coffee and herbal teas.

Marco's business is very profitable.  He sells 60 dishes a day, without counting the hot drinks that he serves in the evenings and which all residents of Palca drink since the cold in this place is unbearable.  As the months have passed, Marco has bought a television set and sound equipment which has made his restaurant more inviting.  However, this young man's ambitions are even greater.  Now he would like to open a recreation center where he can play music, install a dance floor and serve all kinds of drinks.

This is Marco's first loan from MFP and he is certain that he will be responsible in each of his payments so that he can continue working with his community bank.  He is planning to use his loan to hire spacious premises where he can set up his recreation center.

loans.use: To hire spacious premises where he can install his recreation center

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is a resident of a city named Lahore in Pakistan that is known for its history and culture. She is 37 years old and has been living there in the area named Mughalpura for over 15 years. She is married to Z. I. who is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to his passengers and earns income by dropping them off at their desired destinations.  

Nargis is a caring lady, preferring to stay at home and carry out her responsibilities of a housewife. She has given birth to 2 sons. Both are enrolled in a local school and studying in class grades 9th and 4th. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase his own rickshaw, because currently he drives a rickshaw on rent. After struggling much in a full day, he has to share half his income with the rickshaw owner, and the remaining income becomes insufficient to meet the financial needs of the family. Nargis hopes that a loan investment will enable him to drive the rickshaw as long as he wants and earn good income by providing his transport services to the maximum number of passengers. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady with hand up is Nargis.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German vive en Achacachi. El es constructor albañil y su esposa es productora agrícola, ella siembra particularmente cebollas. Es su principal fuente de manutención para su familia que esta compuesto por sus cuatro hijos.

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera, lo que le  permitirá vender a la fábrica PIL una producción mayor de leche y mejorar sus ingresos. German también tiene el objetivo de afiliarse a Aplepo (Asociación de productores de leche de la Provincia Omasuyos).
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
German lives in Achacachi. He is a mason by trade, and his wife is an agricultural producer, who mostly grows onions. This is his main source of support for his family, which includes his four children. 

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow, which will allow him to sell more milk to the PIL factory and improve his income. German also has the goal of joining Aplepo (the Milk Producers Association of Omasuyos Province).
 
This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow to improve his milk production

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La Sra. I. es una madre de familia muy joven ella tiene un año con su venta de ropa y articulos de segundo uso, a pesar de ser muy joven es una mama muy responsable y con ganas de salir a delante y apoyando a la economía de su hogar y al esfuerzo que tiene su esposo ha decidido invertir mas en su venta, el esposo labora en una maquiladora de la localidad y tiene poco de haber adquirido su casa de interés social el siempre esta al tanto de su familia y apoya a su esposo en todo lo que ella emprende.
texts.en: Mrs. I. is a very young mother, who has operated a business selling clothing and used items for one year. In spite of being very young, she is a very responsible mother with a strong desire to get ahead. To support her household economy and the efforts made by her husband, she has decided to invest more in her business. Her husband works in a nearby factory, and they have just acquired a subsidized house. She is always taking care of her family and supporting her husband with everything she undertakes.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: La Sra. C. es madre soltera solo a estado sacando a su hijo a base de esfuerzo y dedicación ella labora en una maquiladora de la localidad y hace unos años comenzo a vender ropa usada en su domicilio los días de descanso fin de semana, gracias a hace ingreso extra a podido mejor su situación economica, debido a que quiere empezar a vender pequeños artículos nuevos  para mejorar las entradas en sus ventas y establecer mejor su negocio.
texts.en: Ms. C. is a single mother who moves her son ahead through her efforts and dedication.  She works in a local factory that manufactures for export.  A few years ago she began selling used clothing from her home on her days off and on the weekend.  She’s been able to improve her financial situation, thanks to this extra income.  She would like to begin selling other small items so that she can improve her sales and improve her business.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny, de 31 años, convive con Wilder, de 33 años. Ambos tiene 3 hijos: Ronald, de 13, Janeth, de 11, Jaretsy, de 9 meses de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palca. Con la alegría que le caracteriza, Jenny, cuenta que se siente estable economicamente. En estos años su economía subió increíblemente, pues su esposo trabaja en una de las principales minas del país. Pero como mujer trabajadora, ella desea salir adelante en la actividad que más sabe, que es la agricultura. Hace 14 años que se dedica a la siembra de papa, su terreno agrícola produce 80 sacos de papa diario, los que después de cada cosecha vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Pero no solo a eso se dedica, también compra miel de Oxapampa y los vende en la ciudad de Tarma y en la capital. 

Ahora está planeando juntar más capital para poder comercializar en mayores cantidades su producción de papa y miel que compra. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y como presidenta de su banco comunal, es una mujer madura y muy hábil, que constantemente apoya a sus integrantes, ya que son mujeres luchadoras y responsables. Tiene pensado destinar el crédito solicitado, en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, por que la venta de este producto le generaría más rentabilidad, además va a necesitar contratar peones para que le ayuden en la siembra de esté producto.
texts.en:
Jenny, age 31, is living with Wilder, age 33. Together they have 3 children: Ronald, 13; Janeth, 11; and Jaretsy, 9 months old. As a family unit, they live in their own house, located in the town of Palca. With the cheerfulness that characterizes her, Jenny reports that she feels economically secure. In these years, her economic situation has risen incredibly, as her husband works in one of the country's leading mines. But as a working woman, she wants to get ahead in the activity she knows best: agriculture. For the past 14 years, she has worked growing potatoes. Her fields produce 80 sacks of potatoes each day, which she sells at the wholesale market in her city after each harvest. But this is not her only work; she also buys honey from Oxapampa and sells it in the city of Tarma and in the capital. 

She is now planning to put together some more capital so that she can sell her potato production and the honey she buys in greater quantities. This is her third loan with MFP, and as president of her communal bank, she is a highly mature and skilled woman, who is constantly supporting the other members. They are all hard-working and responsible women. She is planning to use the loan she is requesting to buy 2 bags of pea seeds and to hire field workers to help her plant peas.

loans.use: Buying 2 bags of pea seeds and hire field workers

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a resident of Mughalpura, which is a small housing colony in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 15 years ago. 

She is a seamstress, collecting orders from her neighboring clients and providing them finished work in the given time period to earn an income. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. The earned amount helps her pay utility expenses. Her husband is a painter and paints walls, doors and windows on order. He is a daily wage worker and works for house and building owners. He has been involved in this business for the past 15 years. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy different colors of paint and paintbrushes that will help him provide better quality services to his customers. Nasreen is hopeful that the loan investment will help her husband in making more income, and she will be able to return the loan easily in installments. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady with a hand up is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy paint and paintbrushes for her husband's painting business

loans.name: Ma. Asuncion

texts.es: La  Sra. Ma. Asuncion, es una persona, Divorciada, que vive en union Libre con una persona, pero Asuncion se distingue porque es una persona muy luchadora y  eficiente, ya que siempre se ha dedicado al negocio de la compra-venta de ropa, y asi fue como saco a sus hijos adelante y les dio estudio a todos y  ha logrado hacer su propiedad, ahora ella esta sola, ya que sus hijos todos se han casado y sus hijas siguen en el negocio de la ropa,  y ahora se apoyan unos a otros, ella  ahora quiere agrandar el negocio mucho mas porque ahora dedica mas tiempo a la venta de ropa, y le han estado pidiendo mas variedad y ella  quiere tener bien surtido el local, para esta temporada.
texts.en: Maria Asuncion is a divorcee who is now living with someone in a common-law marriage. She it noteworthy for being a very hard-working and efficient person. She is always working at her business of buying and selling clothing, and in this way she has helped her children get ahead, paid for their education, and accumulated her own property. Now her children have all married and left home, and her daughters are continuing in the clothing business. They all help each other. She would now like to expand her business significantly, because she is spending more time selling clothing. Her customers have been asking her for more variety, and she would like to have her shop well stocked for this season.

loans.use: Buying used clothing for her sales business

loans.name: Luis Ange

texts.es: El sr. Luis Angel M. S.  quiere el prestamo para mejorar su casa ya que tiene poquito viviendo ahí y apenas pudo adquirir una casa de interes social,con muchos esfuerzos le ha hecho algunas mejoras y  el desea poner una barda en su casa ya que donde el vive con su esposa Monserrat no tiene ningun tipo de proteccion ya que su esposa esta embarazada y el sr. Luis Angel tiene miedo que le puedan hacer algo a su esposa, el trabaja en una maquiladora y aveces tiene el turno de noche o a veces de dia o de tarde por eso el desea su barda en su casa ya que esta muy poquito ahí con ella y se queda muy preocupado. El señor Luis Angel quiere lo mejor para su esposa y su futuro hijo, y se preocupa por la calidad de vida que les quiere dar.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Angel M. S. wants this loan to make a home improvement. He was barely able to acquire his home through a government subsidy program. With many efforts, Luis has been able to make some improvements. He wants to put up a fence around his house.

Luis lives his wife, Sra. Monserrat, who is pregnant. Since they do not have any type of protection, he is afraid that something might happen to her. Luis works the night shift at a factory and sometimes works in the morning or afternoon. For this reason, he wants a fence around his house. With his wife alone in their small home, he is extremely worried. Luis wants to provide the best for his wife and future child. He is concerned about the quality of life he wishes to give them.

loans.use: Put up a fence around his house

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: Eduarda, de 55 años, es una madre de familia trabajadora y muy jovial,  vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos. El negocio al que Eduarda se dedica, es la venta de recordatorios y rosarios, asimismo  manualidades en telas, como son bolsas, lazos  y todo tipo de decoración con motivos navideños. Ahora  Eduarda, esta evocada más a la venta de rosarios, por las celebridades religiosas (primeras comuniones), que organizan  los diversos colegios, negocio que le esta yendo muy bien. Por ello, siempre esta al pendiente de alguna celebración que se avecinan, y de acuerdo a ello se esmera en abastecerse diversos productos ya que sus clientes, son  quienes les contactan con otros clientes. Es así que ya tiene 9 años, en este negocio que le resulta muy rentable; por tal motivo desea abrir una tienda y un taller de manualidades. Es su 17avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. Es la más preocupada  por el bienestar  y la organización de su  grupo, por ser la líder de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará fuegos artificiales para venderlos en la temporada navideña que se avecina, asimismo adornos navideños.
texts.en:
Eduarda, age 55, is a jovial hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and five children. Her business involves selling mementos, rosaries, and woven crafts such as bags, bows, and all types of decorations with a Christmas theme. Eduarda is now seeking to sell more rosaries for religious celebrations (such as first communions) that are organized by different schools. Her business is doing very well. For this reason, Eduarda is always planning for upcoming celebrations and striving to obtain various different products since her customers contact one another. She has been in this business for nine years and has found it to be very profitable. Eduarda wants to open a store and a craft workshop.

This is her seventeenth loan with MFP. She knows that she must complete her payments on time and is willing to do so. Eduarda is very concerned about the well-being and organization of her group since she is the leader of her Communal Bank. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fireworks and decorations to sell during the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase fireworks & Christmas decorations to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase gas stoves

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilu tiene 45 años, es una madre de familia trabajadora y muy amable, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas. El negocio al que se dedica Marilu, es la venta de productos de belleza  y prendas de vestir, siendo ofrecido estos productos a sus familiares, amigas y demás vecinos de su barrio, a quienes les deja a crédito. Por ello, los fines de semana recorre las calles casi todo el día,  para llegar a casa de todos sus clientes y cobrarles, en la que lleva como  6 años en esta labor. Lo que más le gusta de trabajo es la comunicación de sus clientes, además de las buenas ganancias que le genera este negocio, con ello puede cubrir los gastos del hogar. En adelante, tiene planeado poner un negocio más estable, asimismo construir su casa. Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas. En su grupo comunal, es un socia muy responsable y preocupada por el bienestar de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Marilu, age 45, is a friendly hardworking mother. She lives at her parents’ house with her husband and their two daughters. Marilu has a business selling beauty products and clothing. She offers these products to relatives, friends, and residents of her neighborhood and extends credit to them. On the weekends, she spends almost the entire day traveling through the streets visiting the homes of her customers and collecting payments. Marilu has been in this line of work for six years. What she enjoys most about the job is communicating with her customers. In addition, her business generates a good income that enables her to cover the household expenses. In the future, she has plans to have a more stable business as well as build a house.

This is her fifteenth loan with MFP. She promises to complete her payments on time. In her Communal Bank, Marilu is a very responsible member who is concerned about the well-being of her group. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more beauty products so that she can fulfill her outstanding orders.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Diro Enrique

texts.es:
En el Carmen,  un municipio   ubicado   al pié del valle denominado “Montes de María”, en el centro del  departamento de Bolívar, tierra que con los ojos del  amor inspiró a   lucho Bermúdez para componer el mas bello   Porro que lleva su nombre, es el sitio donde vive y tiene su negocio Diro Enrique, y que desde hace ocho (8) años inició, aprovechando un espacio donde construyó su local hoy un estadero donde vende refrescos bebidas y también tiene un billar que aglomera a gran parte de la población cuando se trata de divertirse sanamente; él es un hombre viudo con tres hijos en las edades de 18, 22 y 26 años que estudian sus carreras técnicas y universitarias a  base de esfuerzo y  dos de ellos trabajan simultáneamente.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el planea comprar unas mesas de billar, bebidas por cajas y realizará reparaciones locativas  en su local comercial. Planea con esta inversión generar mayores ingresos porque con mas mesas sus clientes no necesitan esperar para jugar, teniendo en cuenta que se acercan las vacaciones de final de año, se incrementan clientes oriundos del pueblo y también  turistas  que  se aglomerarán en su negocio y se aumentan las ventas de productos y servicios, en especial en el local de Dirio que está en un corredor comercial concurrido que todo el pueblo conoce, alrededor del cual hay muchos negocios como tiendas panaderías y ferreterías.
Su sueño es ver a sus tres hijos realizados como profesionales exitosos y también lograr que su negocio esté provisto de aire acondicionado para ofrecer confort a sus clientes.

El  mayor desafío que ha enfrentado Diro en su vida,  ha sido la muerte de su esposa, hace apenas seis meses  por eso  aun se encuentra en proceso de duelo, pues fue de una manera intempestiva y ella era su mayor soporte emocional, en el negocio y en el hogar en especial en todo lo relacionado con el apoyo  de sus hijos ; así que toda la familia la extraña .
texts.en:
El Carmen is a municipality located in the valley called “Montes de María,” in the center of the department of Bolívar, a land which inspired Lucho Bermúdez with the eyes of love to compose the beautiful "Porro" which carries his name. This is the place where Diro Enrique lives and operates his business, which he started eight (8) years ago. Taking advantage of the space where he started his business, today he has a game room where he sells drinks and also has a pool room that brings together a large part of the local population for healthy entertainment. He is a widower with three children, aged 18, 22 and 26, who are studying for university and technical degrees thanks to his effort, and two are also working at the same time. 

This is his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he plans to use it to buy several pool tables as well as drinks by the case, and he will also carry out some repairs to his place of business. With this investment, he plans to generate more income, because with more pool tables, his customers will not have to wait to play. Taking into account that the end-of-year vacations are approaching, there will be more local customers from the area and also more tourists who will gather in his shop, increasing his sales of products and services. They will come especially to Diro's business, because it is located in a busy commercial corridor known to everyone, surrounded by many businesses such as bakeries and hardware stores. 

His dream is to see his three children become successful professionals and also to equip his business with air conditioning, to offer more comfort to his customers. 

The greatest challenge Diro has confronted in his life has been the death of his wife, just six months ago. He is still in the grieving process, because it was an untimely loss and she was his greatest emotional support, in the business and especially at home with everything concerning the support of his children; because of this, the whole family misses her.

loans.use: Buying some billiard tables and soft drinks by the case, and carrying out some repairs at his place of business

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. He provides transport services to passengers and earns income by dropping them at their designated places. With the loan, her husband will repair his rickshaw and continue his transport services. Currently, his rickshaw is in trouble and doesn’t work well, which is affecting his earning. Perveen is hopeful that through the investment her husband’s rickshaw will become fully repaired and he can drive it for longer hours to increase his monthly income.

Perveen is 59 years old and lives in Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan and famous for its culture and history. She has been living there with her family for over 20 years. In order to financially support the family, Perveen does a job in a local school. She has only one son, and he operates a mobile repair shop in the market. 

Perveen is a very good and responsible person. Besides her job, she fulfills her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She is willing to marry off her son within a year, and she is hopeful that the improved business condition of her husband will help her save money for his marriage. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has  established a good credit record by paying her installments on time. Note: In the photo, the lady with a hand up is Perveen.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Mabelle

texts.fr: Mabelle a 23 ans et est mariée. Elle a en sa charge un enfant. Pour contribuer au foyer, elle confectionne et  vend  des perles. Elle cumule 2 ans   et a remboursé plusieurs crédits déjà.  Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite à Hédzranawoe. Elle compte augmenter son commerce grâce à ce nouveau crédit.
texts.en:
Mabelle is 23 year old and married. She is responsible for one child. 

To support the family she makes and sells beads. She has two years of experience and has already reimbursed several loans. She gets her supply in Ghana in Accra and at the large Lomé market. She then sells them in Hédzranawoe. 

She hopes to increase her business with this new loan.

loans.use: Purchase of beads achat de perles

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro es una joven de 22 años de edad, reside en Gualococti departamento de Morazán, administra una tienda y vive con sus padres, es madre soltera de un bebe de 1 año y medio, este negocio lo atiende desde hace un año de 6.00am á 7:30pm. Ofreciendo a los clientes lo necesario para el hogar como frijoles, azúcar, jabón, detergentes entre otros productos, inicio este negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a sus padres para los gastos del hogar ya que también tiene a su hijo y sus padres le ayudan mucho.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la tienda, ya que quiere surtir de productos que rápidamente vende con sus clientes, su compra será de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, con esta inversión ella quiere siempre estar preparada para atender la demanda y tener la oportunidad de crecer con el negocio.
La aspiración de ella con respecto al préstamo es cancelarlo bien sin atrasos, con respecto al negocio es aprovechar la inversión para crecer poco a poco para obtener de él los ingresos necesarios para dar a su hijo un buen crecimiento.
texts.en:
Milagro, age 22, is a young woman who resides in Gualococti in the Department of Morazán. She manages a store and lives with her parents. Milagro is a single mother of a 1½ year old baby. Her business has been in operation for a year and is open from 6am to 7:30pm. She offers her customers household necessities such as beans, sugar, soap, detergents, and other products. Milagro started this business so that she could help her parents with the household expenses as well as support her child. Her parents also provide much assistance.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her store. Milagro wants to restock with products that sell quickly among her customers. Her purchase will include beans, rice, and sugar. With this investment, she will always be prepared to meet demand and have the opportunity to grow her business.

Her goal with this loan is to repay it without any delays. With respect to her business, she wants to take advantage of this investment to expand little by little so that she can earn the necessary income to provide her son what he needs to grow.

loans.use: Purchase beans, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Rubia Carolina

texts.es:
Rubia, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, tienen casa propia y residen en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, ella se dedica a la agricultura sembrando maíz y chile, su familia le ayuda con el trabajo ya que es bastante.
Ella en esta oportunidad está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes, este es su segundo préstamo, con el primero realizo una siembra de manzana y media de terreno, con este préstamo quiere sembrar dos manzanas de terreno y además si le alcanza comprar dos terneros para comenzar a criarlos.
Su proyección con la agricultura es fortalecer más su trabajo, ser capaz de ir mejorando las siembras y la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rubia lives with her husband and children. They have their own house and live in El Transito, in the department of San Miguel. She works in agriculture, planting corn and chilies. Her family helps her on the farm because it is a lot of work. 

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as compost and fertilizers. This is her second loan, and with the first she planted a block and a half of land. With this loan, she would like to plant two blocks of land, and in addition, if the funds are sufficient, she would like to buy two calves to begin raising cows.

Her plan for her farm is to strengthen her work even more, so that she will be able to improve her crops and the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Buying compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, de 32 años, convive con Walter, de 30 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Steve, de 8 y Reynaldo, de 2 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Está trabajadora mujer todos los días, desde tempranas horas de la mañana se dedica a la venta de diferentes variedades de frutas; su buen juicio en las ventas le ayudan a obtener mejores ganancias. El secreto de Miriam es vender frutas de temporada, así cada mes tienen nuevas y ricas variedades frutas. Sus 6 años de experiencia le garantiza su éxito; ya que al día obtiene una ganancia de 50 soles y los días jueves y domingo que son días de feria, denominada así, porque existe gran acogida de compradores, ahí obtiene una ganancia de 100 nuevos soles. A ella le agrada mucho salir adelante y poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, por ello más adelante desea abrir una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde pueda vender productos de primera necesidad a los vecinos del barrio donde vive. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y agradece las constantes charlas educativas que le brindan en las reuniones con su banco comunal, donde siente que cada día aprende más. Es por ello que el crédito que recibirá. lo invertirá en la compra de frutas de temporada, que venderá en uno de los mercados más reconocidos de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Miriam is 32 years old.  She lives with her partner Walter who is 30.  They have 2 children: 8 year-old Steve and 2 year-old Reynaldo.  They live in her parents' house which is in the city of Tarma.  This hard-working woman gets up very early every morning to sell a variety of fruit.  Her good sales sense helps her to make good profits.  Miriam's secret is to sell fruit that is in season.  Every month she has new and rich varieties of fruit.  Her 6 years of experience have guaranteed her success since every day she makes a profit of 50 Peruvian soles and on Thursdays and Sundays, which are market days, there are a lot of customers and she makes a profit of 100 soles.

Miriam really likes to get ahead in life and she likes being able to help her husband with the household expenses.  In the future, she would like to open a small grocery store where she can sell convenience store products to the people in her neighborhood.

This is Miriam's sixth loan from MFP and she is grateful for the constant educational talks which are given during the meetings held by her community bank.  She feels that she learns something new every day.  Miriam will invest her loan in buying seasonal fruit which she will sell in one of the best-known markets in her city.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit wholesale

loans.name: Maria Ramosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Ramosa; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de jardín de niños, ella es profesora del nivel inicial que es propietaria de un jardín de niños, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de jardín de niños. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para el jardín.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria Ramosa is a member of the “Maria Elena Moyano” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Maria is 55 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business running a pre-school.  She is a pre-school teacher and owns her own pre-school.  She works from 8.00am to 1.00pm.  She would like to improve her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials for her pre-school.

Maria is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for her pre-school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clay, firewood and nacazcol (a dye)

loans.name: Nancy Patricia

texts.es:
Nancy de 33 años, vende pollos para cocinar por libra desde $ 1.50 y enteros desde $ 6.00 según sea su peso. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  

Tiene 3 años trabajando con las ventas de pollos desde que se separo de su esposo para poder mantener a sus hijos. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en su casa vendiendo los pollos a sus conocidos y afuera de su casa en un puesto los fines de semana. Uno de los inconvenientes para realizar su trabajo es trabajar y atender a sus hijos ya que solo tienen 8 y 3 años de edad.

 Ella quiere darles una mejor vida a sus hijos y que estén cómodos en la casa donde viven por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo material de construcción como cemento, bloques. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old and sells chickens for cooking.  She sells them by the pound from $1.50 and whole from $6.00 according to their weight.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Paraíso de la Flor which is located in an area noted for its dirt roads and mountains.

Nancy has been selling chickens for 3 years, since she separated from her husband.  She works to support her children.  She works from Monday to Friday in her home, selling chickens to her acquaintances.  She also sells outside her home, from a stall, on the weekend.  One of the problems which she has in carrying out her work is that she needs to work and at the same time take care of her children who are only 8 and 3.

Nancy would like to provide her children with a better life and would like for them to be comfortable in their home.  For this reason, she would like to use her loan to buy building materials such as cement and blocks.  In the future, she would like to finish building her home and provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: To buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Nailan

texts.es: Nailan Fernández D. T.  D. 53 años D. edad vive en el barrio la Bajera del municipio D. San Jacinto en Departamento D. Bolívar se dedica elaborar con sus propias manos mochilas y bolsos y también  compra y venD.   cubre lechos, en su condición D. madre   soltera y con 3 hijos en las edades D. 26 a 37 años ha logrado sacarlos adelante mediante su trabajo  en su negocio con el que  sueña cada día hacerlo más prospero   trabajando mucho  para lograr unos buenos ahorros con el fin D.  tener su propia casa.  Aunque su mayor desafío ha sido  la educación D. sus hijos sin la pareja a su lado,  hoy es cosa del pasado porque ya ellos son mayores D. edad y están trabajando entre todos para lograr sacar a su familia adelante. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con este su credikiva comprará materiales como hilos e insumos para la elaboración D. mochilas y bolsos que tiene encargados y comprar mercancía como cubrelechos , vestidos y sandalias artesanales; con esta   inversión   generará una utilidad bruta D. 48% y la solicita en esta temporada teniendo en cuenta que su mayor volumen D. ventas se reflejan  en los meses D. Diciembre a Febrero, por el importante numero D. turistas que llegan a esta población D. vacaciones o pasan por su carretera y se detienen a comprar. Su mayor potencial D. venta lo logra apoyada  por su hija,  que  viaja a las ciudades D. Barranquilla y Cartagena donD. tiene su mayor número D. clientes fijos , a los cuales les lleva mochilas tejidas por las manos D. su madre y otras artesanías que compra en el pueblo y venD. en estas dos ciudades.
texts.en:
Nailan Fernández D. T. is 53 years old and lives in the Bajera neighborhood of San Jacinto, in Bolívar department.  She makes backpacks and bags by hand and she also buys and sells bedspreads.  Nailan is a single mother and has 3 children aged 26 to 37.  She has managed to get her children ahead in life through the work she does in her business.
