She hopes to make her business more prosperous every day, working hard to achieve good savings so that she can buy her own home.  Although her biggest challenge has been to educate her children without her partner by her siD., that is now a problem from the past because her children are all grown up and working themselves to get their own families ahead.

This is Nailan's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use this Kiva loan to buy materials and supplies for making her backpacks and bags which she already has orders for.  She will also buy merchandise such as bedspreads, dresses and hand-crafted sandals.  With this investment, she will make a gross profit of 48%.

Nailan is requesting her loan during this season because she makes her largest number of sales from December to February, owing to the large number of tourists who arrive in her town on vacation or who pass by on the road and stop to buy from her.  She accomplishes her large sales potential with the support of her daughter who travels to the cities of Barranquilla and Cartagena where she has her largest number of regular customers.  She takes them backpacks which her mother has maD. by hand together with other handicrafts which she buys in the town and then sells in these two cities.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for making backpacks and bags which she has orders for.  To buy merchandise such as bedspreads, dresses and hand-crafted sandals

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Juana Maria; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de salón de belleza, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tintes para el cabello, líquidos permanentes y otros materiales para el salón de belleza.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana Maria belongs to the “Maria Elena Moyano” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Juana Maria is 55 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her beauty salon business.  She works from 9.00am to 7.00pm.  Through her business, she has managed to get her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy hair colors, permanent dyes and other materials for her beauty salon.

Juana Maria is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy hair colors, permanent dyes and other materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Maria Sarbelia

texts.es:
Doña Sarbelia, administra un cafetín donD. venD. pupusas y bebidas, tiene 52 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo Aldo D. 21 años D. edad, residen e Yoloaiquin departamento D. Morazán,  el negocio tiene más D. 21 años D. existir y lo atienD. todos los días D. la semana D. 3:00pm hasta 9:00pm, por las mañanas prepara todo lo necesario para la preparación D. las pupusas, el gusto por la cocina lo desarrollo al lado D. su madre.
Ella tiene planes D. inversión en el negocio y solicita un préstamo para poder desarrollarlo, su compra seria D. bebidas como sodas, gatoraD., jugos, y para las pupusas chicharrón, quesillo, pollo, condimentos, este préstamo le ayuda a incrementar el negocio a disponer D. productos y atender a más clientes para garantizar los ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Ella quiere cancelar puntualmente este préstamo, el sueño es crece con el negocio y poder construir un nuevo local granD. donD. pueda atender muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Sarbelia runs a cafe where she sells 'pupusas' (thick corn tortillas with a savory filling) and soft drinks.  She is 52 years old and lives with her husband and her 21 year-old son Aldo.  They live in Yoloaiquin, in Morazán department.  She has had her business for more than 21 years and she serves in it every day of the week from 3.00pm to 9.00pm.  In the mornings she gets ready everything she needs to prepare her 'pupusas'.  She got her love of cooking from her mother.

Sarbelia has plans to invest in her business and she is requesting a loan so that she can do this.  She will buy drinks such as soda, gatoraD. and juices.  For the 'pupusas' she will buy 'chicharrón' (pork crackling), 'quesillo' (cheese), chicken and seasonings.  This loan will help her to increase her business, to have products available and to serve more customers so that she can guarantee her income and support her family.

Sarbelia would like to make her loan repayments punctually.  Her dream is to grow with her business and to be able to build new, bigger premises where she can serve a lot of customers.

loans.use: To buy drinks (soda and juice), pork crackling and cheese

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es:
Marisabel C. de 30 años desde hace cinco años tiene una cafetería en la parada del 7 sur donde comercializa chicle, gaseosa, agua, pan, etc. Este lugar es muy concurrido ya que transitan las personas que van a León, carretera sur, el Crucero, Ciudad Sandino, Chinandega, Nagarote, etc.
Ella trabaja junto con sus hermanas e invertirá el crédito en productos para surtir el negocio y su sueño es construir su casa.
texts.en: Marisabel C. is 30 years old.  She has had a café at the '7 sur' bus stand for five years.  She sells chewing gum, soda, water, bread, etc.  This place is very busy since people who are travelling to León, carretera sur, el Crucero, Ciudad Sandino, Chinandega, Nagarote, etc. pass through there.  Marisabel works together with her sisters and will invest her loan in buying products to stock her business.  Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To buy candies, cigarettes, soda, snacks, water, bread, etc.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dionicia; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller de carpintería, la socia trabaja junto con su esposo, ella hace trabajos como sillas, mesas, sillones y puertas, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de carpintería, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y herramientas para el taller de carpintería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dionicia, 54, is a member of the “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a carpentry shop.  She works alongside her husband making such things as chairs, tables, armchairs and doors. 

She wants to expand and improve the business.  She works from 9am until 5pm and is asking for a loan to buy carpentry tools and supplies.

She thanks all those who share in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy carpentry tools and supplies.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PROSPERIDAD”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felipa; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de leche la socia tiene también su stand de venta de carne ella alterna sus actividades y trata de hacer las dos de este modo puede conseguir más ingreso económico, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la mercadería, ella comprará carne al por mayor de sus proveedores; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Felipa belongs to the "Prosperidad" [Prosperity] Village Bank, located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

She's thirty-eight, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She earns her living buying and selling milk, and she also has a meat stand.  She alternates between the two jobs, trying to earn more income.  She is seeking a loan to invest in merchandise; she'll buy meat wholesale from her suppliers.

Felipa appreciates and values the loan she gets from here and promises accordingly to make her payments in full and on time.

loans.use: Felipa is seeking a loan to invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Blanca Dayssi

texts.es:
Doña Blanca tiene 42 años de edad, es empleada y comerciante de medicina, vive con sus hijas en su propia casa ubicada en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, su empleo lo tiene desde hace 13 años en una empresa llamada Electrocentro y vende medicina desde hace 5 años, actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar medicina, con esta inversión ella pretende crecer, teniendo mucha medicina para distintas enfermedades y que al momento de ofrecer a los clientes pueda vender lo que ellos más necesiten.
Su propósito es crece en este negocio, aumentando sus ingresos para tener una vida más cómoda con sus hijas, al mismo tiempo quiere ir cancelando las cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old.  She is an employee in a company and also works independently selling medicines.  She lives with her daughters in her own home in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  Blanca has had her job for 13 years, working for a company called Electrocentro.  She has been selling medicines for 5 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy medicines.  She would like to use this investment to grow her business, having a lot of medicines which she can offer for different illnesses.  She hopes to be able to offer her customers what they most need.

Blanca's aim is to grow her business, increasing her income so that she can lead a more comfortable life with her daughters.  At the same time, she wants to make her loan repayments punctually.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Fátima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fátima del Socorro F. es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada la cual es propietaria de un taxi quien invertirá el crédito para renovar el permiso, chequeo y repuestos para mejorar la seguridad de sus clientes. Ella desea poder comprar otro taxi para seguir aumentando y acrecentar su negocio. 
Fuente tiene dos hijos los cuales son mayores de edad uno de sus hijo es quien maneja el taxi.
texts.en: Fátima del Socorro F. is a hard-working and determined woman who owns a taxi.  She will invest her loan in renewing her vehicle's license, having it serviced and buying spare parts so that she can improve her customers' safety.  She would like to buy another taxi so that she can continue growing her business.  F. has two grown-up children.  It is one of her sons who drives the taxi.

loans.use: To renew her vehicle's license, have it serviced and pay for maintenance work

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 61 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. compra y venta D. cerveza, ella tiene una tienda donD. venD. cerveza, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. cerveza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cajas D. cerveza.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Josefina, 61, is a member of the “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” communal bank located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has a son.  She alternates her daily chores with being a beer merchant.  She has a store where she sells beer.  She is open from 8am until 10pm and wants to expand the beer sales.  She is asking for a loan to buy more cases of beer.

She thanks all those who share her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy cases of beer.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zonia; ella tiene 47 años D. edad y es divorciado y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. restaurant, la socia hace diferentes platos D. comida, ella trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, ella quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carnes y verduras.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is a part of the communal bank “Maria Elena Moyano.”  The bank is located in the Cusco district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

This member is named Zonia; she is 47-years-old, divorced, and has two children.  She juggles her daily activities with a restaurant business.  She makes different dished of food and works from 8AM to 5PM.  She would like to expand and improve her restaurant business.  She is requesting the loan to buy products to cook like meat and vegetables.

She is thankful to those who are part of making this dream possible through this medium and promises to make her payments in the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan for products to cook like meats and vegetables.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 30 años, convive con Robert, de 34 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Ziomara, de 8 y Sebastian de 8 meses de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. El trabajo al que se dedica Bertha, es la compra y venta de papa en un puesto que alquila en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Donde vende un promedio de 50 nuevos soles diarios, pero cuando vende su propia producción de papa, sus ganancias se incrementan a 200 nuevos soles diarios; ya que según afirma hace 12 años que siembra papa en sus terrenos agrícolas que tienen en el pueblo de Tapo y Huasahuasi, donde genera un promedio de 90 sacos en cada cosecha. Bertha agradece a Dios por toda la bendición que le dio hasta ahora, es por ello que quiere invertir sus ganancias en la compra de su casa propia, así como también en hacer crecer su negocio. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y está orgullosa de los constantes avances que tuvo en estos meses, ya que los consejos que recibe en las reuniones con su banco comunal, la ayudan a tomar buenas decisiones. Por ello con el crédito que solicita, esta pensando comprar varios sacos de papa que venderá en el mercado.
texts.en:
Bertha, 30, cohabits with Robert, 34.  They have two children:  Ziomara, 8, and Sebastián, 8 months.  They live together as a family in a rented house located in the city of Tarma.  

Bertha is a potato merchant in a rented stall in her city’s wholesale market.  Her sales average about 50 new soles daily but when she sells her own potato production her profits increase to 200 new soles daily.  According to what she tells us, she has been growing potatoes for 12 years on fields she has in the town of Tapo and Huasahuasi where she harvests about 90 sacks of potatoes at each harvest.

Bertha thanks God for all the blessings she’s gotten to date.  This is why she wants to invest her profits in the purchase of a house of her own as well as to make her business grow.

This is her 5th loan with MFP and she is proud of the constant advances she’s had over the months because the advice she gets at the communal bank meetings has helped her make good decisions.  She plans to use the requested loan to buy several sacks of potatoes that she will then sell in the market.

loans.use: To stock up on sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Valientes 1, 2 & 3 (Brave Women). She lives in a modest home with her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is not having her own house and she wants to build one. She enjoys doing business and is excited to receive her first loan with Esperanza. She started her business when she realized she needed extra income and save US$90; she has now had her business for a year. Santa plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying chicken, beef and pork for her butcher shop. She will use the profits to buy a washing machine and to save to buy a vehicle.

This Esperanza associate joined us because she wanted to improve her business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy chicken, beef and pork.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Teofilo; el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de enseñanza a niños del nivel inicial, el es propietario de un jardín de niños, el socio quiere mejorara y ampliar el jardín de niños. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales didácticos para el jardín.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Teofilo is a member of the “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” lending cooperative in Cusco.  He is 55, married and has 3 children.  Teofilo dedicates much of his time to teaching very young children and runs a nursery school, which he wants to enlarge to allow for improved conditions.  He is seeking this loan in order to buy teaching materials and educational items for the nursery school.  Teofilo is very grateful for the opportunity to participate in the lending program and is committed to prompt repayment of the funds.

loans.use: El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales didácticos para el jardín.

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Promujer (Prowoman) Group

texts.en:
The Women´s Bank Promujer (Prowoman) consists of 6 members who all live in Villas Darizara, Puntarenas located in the southern region of Costa Rica. The members of this group are involved in commercial activities including catalogue sales, sewing, and food and clothing sales. This loan will be used by each woman in this group to make investments in their productive activity as she sees fit. Examples of two loan uses are to purchase catalogue products, such as cooking items, tools and perfumes, and to purchase items necessary for food preparation, as well as sewing materials (needles and thread). 

Blanca, the elected president of this group, is a 57 year old single mother who lives with her children in Villas Darizara. She has a business selling fast foods, such as hamburgers, sandwiches and casados, which she prepares in her home from door to door in her community. She plans to use this loan to invest in raw materials necessary for food production. Blanca's goal is to one day open a centralized sales post, from which she would be able to sell her fast food products. She says that a main obstacle for her business has been the low prices at which she must sell her food in order to make sales. Blanca says that the main advantage of the group lending moD. is that it is a source of support and friendship.

loans.use: To purchase various commercial items, such as clothing, food and catalogue items.

loans.name: Teresa Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa Jesús; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de manualidades, ella realiza diferentes adornos y pinturas, el esta oportunidad realizara adornos para la época navideña, la socia quiere tener una tienda para poder vender loa adornos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para que realice los adornos para la época navideña.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "MARIA ELENA MOYANO". The bank is located in the Cusco district belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Teresa Jesús, she is 57 years old and married and has 3 children. The member alternates her daily activites with the business of selling handicrafts. She produces different decorations and paintings. At this opportunity she will produce decorations for the Christmas season. The member wants to have a store to be able to sell the decorations. The member is asking for the loan to buy materials in order to produce decorations for the Christmas season.

The member thanks those who are a part of this dream by using this means, and she promises to fulfill her installment payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: This member is asking for the loan to buy materials to produce decorations for the Christmas season

loans.name: Bertha Urbelinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha Urbelinda; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene una tienda de artesanía y vende mantas, chalinas y chompas, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "MARIA ELENA MOYANO". The bank is located in the Cusco district belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Bertha Urbelinda, she is 62 years old and married with 2 children. The member alternates her daily activities with the business of handicraft sales. She has a handicraft store and sells blankets, scarves, and sweaters. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. The member wants to expand her business. The member is asking for this loan to buy wholesale handicrafts.

The member thanks those who are a part of this dream by using this means, and she promises to fulfill her installment payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy wholesale handicrafts.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena, de 23 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos. En su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Está valerosa joven, se dedica a estudiar obstetricia, su sueño es ser una excelente profesional. Todas las mañanas se dedica a la venta de papa al por mayor en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, en un espacio que alquila hace 2 años. Los días de mayor venta, son los miércoles, viernes y domingo, donde la mayoría de los pobladores salen al mercado a hacer las compras de los alimentos para la semana. Ya por las tardes, estudia en un instituto reconocido de su ciudad. El trabajo según menciona la mantiene activa y la ayuda a pagar sus estudios, ahora logró mantener un capital de 3 mil nuevos soles, que invierte semanalmente en la compra de varios sacos de papa. Pero los meses donde gana más cantidad de dinero son las épocas de cosecha, ya que vende su propia producción de papa, que en sociedad con su hermano, siembran en los terrenos que tienen, en el pueblo de Huasahuasi. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, y según menciona está orgullosa de pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues son personas que la encaminan a seguir desarrollándose. Es por ello que el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de papa que venderá los días de feria, y con el resto de dinero comprará 20 sacos de abono para su cultivo de papa que en el mes de Marzo cosechará.
texts.en:
Magdalena, age 23, lives with her parents and siblings, in their own house located in the city of Tarma. She is a brave young woman, dedicated to studying obstetric medicine, and her dream is to become an excellent professional. 

Every morning she sells potatoes, wholesale, in the largest market in Tarma, in a space she has been renting for 2 years. The biggest market days are Wednesday, Friday and Sunday, when most of the local people go to the market to do their weekly food shopping. In the afternoons, she studies at an institute that is well-known in the city. She says that the work keeps her active and helps to pay for her studies, and she has now managed to accrue working capital of 3,000 Soles, which she invests each week in buying sacks of potatoes. But the months when she earns most money are around harvest time, when she can sell her own crop of potatoes that she and her brother cultivate on their land in the village of Huasahuasi. 

This is her 6th loan from [field partner] MFP, and she goes on to say that she is very proud to belong to her communal bank, because they are motivated to continue their own development. For this reason, she will invest the loan she receives in the purchase of several sacks of potatoes that she will selll on market days, and with the rest of the money she will buy 20 sacks of fertilizer for her potato crop that she will harvest in March.

loans.use: To buy bags of potatoes and 20 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Dedicación

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PROSPERIDAD”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dedicación; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, y tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos de autos, la socia vende repuestos de automóviles desde luces, frenos y hasta timones nuevos; la socia trabaja desde hace 10 años ella tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de repuestos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería nueva ella viajará a la ciudad de Lima a traer repuestos de autos para iniciar el año nuevo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank named "Prosperity". The bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and region of Cusco. 

Her name is Dedicacion. She is 36 years old, she lives with her partner and they have 3 children. She buys and sells spare parts, such as headlights, breaks and spark plugs. She has been in the business for 10 years and she has a small store from where she makes her sales. She requests a loan to purchase new merchandise. She will travel to Lima to bring spare parts for the start of the New Year. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise. 

She is very grateful for the loan and she values the opportunity. She is committed to the payment terms established for her loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 38 años, convive con Iván, de 40 años de edad. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que quieren y aman. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. El deseo de Edith, es invertir en el estudio de sus hijos, ya que según afirma, “la mejor herencia es darle la educación para que sean profesionales”. Por ello, hace 12 años que viene dedicándose a la venta de verduras, hortalizas y maíz, en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma; los días de mayor movimiento son los miércoles, jueves y viernes. Donde mueve un capital de 3 mil a 2 mil nuevos soles diarios. Los cuales le generan un promedio de ganancia del 10%. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder vender todo lo invertido, pero como todo negocio, hay altibajos, y teme que puede perder sin recuperar la inversión. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y está contenta con el trabajo que desarrolla en su banco comunal, ya que son personas responsables y muy puntuales en los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de arveja y olluco, para venderlos en los días de feria.
texts.en:
Edith, 38, lives with Ivan, 40. They have 4 children that they love very much. The family owns the house where they live in, located in the town of Tarma. Edith's wish is to invest in her children's education, because as she says "the best inheritance is to provide them with an education so they can become professionals". That's why she has been selling vegetables and corn at the wholesale market in the town of Tarma for the last 12 years. The busiest days are Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays, when the turnover is 2000 to 3000 soles a day and she obtains average profits of 10%. What she likes the most is when she is able to sell everything she's invested in, but as with any business there are ups and downs, and she is afraid to lose out without recovering the investment. 

This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is happy with the work carried out in her loan group, because the members are responsible and very punctual in their payments. She plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of ullucos (root vegetables) and peas to sell on market days.

loans.use: Buy ullucos (root vegetables) and peas.

loans.name: Paso A Paso Group

texts.en:
Fortunata is the treasurer of the group "Paso a Paso" which means "Step by Step."  This group of friends and neighbors chose this name because they are slowly improving their lives a little bit at a time.

Fortunata, pictured in the front row in the black jacket, is a 62-year-old widow.  She has four adult children who have businesses of their own.  Fortunata's business is a taxi service that she runs with her nephew.  With this loan, Fortunata plans to buy new tires for her car she uses as a taxi.

The roads in northern Lima, where she lives, can be very hazardous:  potholes and dirt roads really take a toll on her taxi cab.  With a better maintained taxi, Fortunata hopes to attract more passengers and earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy new tires for her car she uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Yosip

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Yosip; el tiene 31 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agencia de viajes, el está abriendo una agencia de viajes y quiere implementar el negocio, el socio trabajo desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m. El  socio solicita el préstamo para diseñar la página web de la agencia de viajes.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yosip, 31, is a member of the “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” communal bank which is located in Cusco district that is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is single and has a son.  He alternates his daily chores with a travel agency.  He is opening a travel agency and wants to equip the business.  He works from 6am until 6pm and is asking for the loan to design the travel agency’s web page.

He thanks all those who will be part of his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To design the travel agency's web page.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo trabajando en conjunto entre todas las integrante con la responsabilidad solidaria que caracteriza al grupo.
Una de las integrantes y de quien se puede hablar es la Sra. Luz Marina Muños con 45  años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella  va a hacer sus comestibles para la venta por la mañana, luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su quiniela. 
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne, y otros insumos para sus comestibles.
texts.en:
This committee is in its third cycle with all the members working together in the responsible and mutually supportive way that characterizes the group.

One of the members of the group we can talk about is Mrs. Luz Marina Muños, 45.  She has two children that stay at home while she goes to make her meals to sell in the morning.  Then she returns home to prepare lunch and returns during the afternoon to continue selling.

She is a very dedicated woman whose work day is quite laborious because when she gets home from work she still has all the household chores to do.  She does all this in order to get ahead with her children because she’s a single mother and this is how she pays household expenses and expenses of her two children who go to school.

She is asking for the loan to buy meat and other ingredients for her meals.

loans.use: To buy meat and other ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería, ella vende diferentes tipos de panes, la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para construir su casa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nancy, 55, is a member of the “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” communal bank which is located in Cusco district that is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with a bakery.  She sells all kinds of bread from 5am until 7pm.  She wants to expand and improve the business.

She is requesting a loan to buy building materials and supplies to build her house.

She thanks all those who will be part of her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: Enma, de 28 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora, que junto a su mamá Miguelina de 51 años, luchan por salir adelante. Ellas viven en casa de sus padres ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Está hermosa y valiosa mujer, todos los días trabaja en la venta de papa al por mayor y menor, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a ello, pues desde que era joven ayudaba a su mamá en la venta de papa por kilos. Pero con el tiempo su mamá enfermó, y Enma tuvo que dedicarse al negocio familiar, ahora en el mercado mayorista, donde ella vende, todos la admiran y respetan por su buen corazón y su dedicación, ya que al mes genera una ganancia de 2 mil a 3 mil nuevos soles. La otra actividad de Enma es la agricultura, donde siembra papa, zanahoria y hortalizas en los terrenos agrícolas de sus padres, donde todos los fines de semana echa abono, riega y cultiva. Ahora ella está ahorrando para comprar su propia casa. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y como presidenta de su banco comunal, se siente dichosa por dirigir a un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras. De obtener el crédito solicitado, podrá comprar 50 sacos de semilla de papa, Con ello podrá sembrar 2 hectáreas de terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Enma, 28, is a single, hard working woman who together with her mother, Miguelina, 51, struggles to get ahead.  They live in their parents’ house in the city of Tarma.  This beautiful and brave woman works daily selling potatoes at wholesale and at retail.  She has been in this business for 10 years. Her mother became ill and Enma had to take over the family business, now in the wholesale market, where she sells.  Everyone admires and respects her for her kind heart and dedication.  Her monthly profits are around 2000 to 3000 new soles.

Enma is also a farmer.  She grows potatoes, carrots and leaf vegetables on her parents’ farmland.  Every weekend she spreads manure, waters and cultivates.  She is saving up to buy a house of her own.

This is her 6th loan with MFP.  She is President of her communal bank and feels proud to lead a group of enterprising women.

If she were to get the requested loan, she will be able to buy 50 sacks of potato seed that will allow her to plant two hectares of farmland.

loans.use: To buy 50 sacks of potato seed.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Libia; ella tiene 66 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. autopartes para carros, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio D. venta D. autopartes, la socia trabaja desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una máquina para la tienda D. venta D. repuestos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Libia is a membrer of the "Maria Elena Moyano" loan group, located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Libia, 66, is married with 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with a business selling spare car parts. She wants to improve her car part selling business. She works from 9am to 6pm every day. She is requesting a loan to buy a  machine for her spare parts shop. 

She would like to thank those helping her achieve her dream and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed terms.

loans.use: The partner requests the loan to buy a machine for her shop.

loans.name: Sabelier

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PROSPERIDAD”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabelier; La socia tiene 28 años de edad, La socia es soltera; la socia trabaja en un hostal como empleada, ella entra en el horario de las mañanas y la socia pertenece a este banco comunal desde hace 2 años y siempre se reúnen una vez al mes con sus compañeros de banco; la socia desea el crédito para poder hacer algunos presentes para sus padres y también poder comprarse aluno ella misma, la socia manifiesta que cuando le paguen a fines de diciembre ella podrá cubrir sus deudas, pero ahora desea hacerles buenos presentes a sus padres y también ella hacerse uno especial. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Sabelier is a member of the "Prosperity" communal bank, which is located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco.

Señora Sabelier is 28 years old, single, and works in a hostel in the mornings. She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years, and always meets with the other members once a month. She wants the loan to be able to give presents to her parents, and also to buy something for herself. She states that when she gets paid at the end of December she will be able to cover her debts, but she wants to give her parents good presents and get herself something special. She is seeking the loan for personal use.

Señora Sabelier is grateful and values the credit extended to her in this way; she therefore promises to make her repayments on schedule and in the appointed place.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Yawavi Nicole

texts.fr: Nicole a 35 ans et est mariée. Elle a 2 enfants en charge.  Pour participer au foyer, elle fait la vente de produits de beauté. Avec son activité, elle a remboursé plusieurs  prêts déjà. Elle s’approvisionne en Europe et au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite au marché de  Hédzranawoe. Elle compte 3 ans dans cette activité. Elle sollicite au près de WAGES un crédit   pour accroitre son commerce.
texts.en: Nicole is 35 years old and is married. She takes care of two children.  To help meet family expenses, she sells beauty products.  Through her work, she has already repaid several loans.  She gets her supplies in Europe and at the main market in Lomé and then resells them at the market in Hédzranawoe.  She has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting a loan from WAGES to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 33 años, convive con Américo, de 35 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Cristopher de 8 años, y una pequeña mujercita, que muy pronto nacerá, pues Lidia tiene 9 meses de embarazo. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. El Trabajo al que se dedica está hermosa mujer, es la compra y venta de verduras, los que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, los días miércoles, viernes y domingos, en un puesto que arrendó en la sección de verduras. Estos días de feria, donde todos los pobladores compran los alimentos de la semana, Lidia, mueve un capital de 3 mil a 4 mil nuevos soles, generando una ganancia del 10%, en los mejores días. Pero como buena administradora de sus ganancias, ella invirtió en la compra de un camión, con el que traslada la producción de los terrenos agrícola a la ciudad y como buena mujer del campo también siembra papa y arveja, cuyo cultivo cuida los fines de semana. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como miembro activo de su Banco comunal, siente que sus integrantes son personas solidarias y activas. Por ello, con el crédito solicitado, piensa invertir en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arvejas de buena calidad, que sembrará en estos meses.
texts.en: Lidia, age 33, lives with her partner Américo, who is 35. They have 2 children: Cristopher, who is 8 years old, and a new little lady who will very soon be born, as Lidia is 9 months pregnant. They live as a family in a rented house, located in the city of Tarma. This lovely woman dedicates herself to her work of buying and selling vegetables. She rents a stall in the vegetable section of the largest market in the city, on Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays. On these market days, when all the local people buy their food for the week, Lidia turns over 3000-4000 Soles on good days, generating a 10% profit. As a good manager of her funds, she invested in a truck with which she can move the produce from the agricultural lands into the city. As a good country woman, she also sows potatoes and peas, which she cultivates at weekends. This is her second loan with [field partner] MFP, and as an active member of her communal bank, she feels that her fellow members are reliable and active people. Because of this she is planning to invest the loan in the purchase of 2 bags of good-quality pea seeds, which she will plant over the coming months.

loans.use: To buy two bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Jesus De Nazareth Group

texts.es:
sandra Luz C. C., 27 años D. edad, soltera, 1 hijo. Secretaria D. L. Alcancia Comunal: "Jesus D. Nazareth"
Empezò a trabajar hace algunos años vendiendo "anticuchos" y comida casera los fines D. semana y en cuanta feria acontecian en Yauris; pues tenia que costear sus estudios universitarios; ya que el poco apoyo econòmico brindado por su madre y padrastro no le alcanzaba.
Estando por culminar L. Universidad quedo embarazada y cuando el padre D. su hijo se enterò, L. abandonò con 4 meses D. gestaciòn, porque èl tenìa otra familia. 
Con el apoyo D. su madre logrò pagar los gastos del alumbramiento. Hoy por hoy su hija es su motor en todo lo que emprenD. Sandra. 
Despues que naciò su hija pudo terminar su carrera D. Educaciòn y se presentò a una plaza por licencia D. 6 meses; luego D. culminar L. licencia empezò a buscar un puesto D. trabajo acorD. a sus estudios; pero como no tenìa experiencia no encontraba ninguna vacante. Dadas las necesidades D. su hija tuvo que trabajar en varias cosas y en varias jornadas; es asì como viene desempeñandose como vendedor ambulante D. jugos y le ha ido bien. Su deseo es poner una juguerìa.
(En L. foto Sandra esta ubicada en el centro del grupo y viste D. buzo deportivo color negro con franjas blancas)
El prèstamo otorgado serà para alquilar un puesto para L. venta D. jugos D. fruta.
texts.en:
Sandra Luz C. Calderón, 27, is single and has a daughter.  She is the Secretary of the "Jesús D. Nazareth" communal bank.

She started working several years ago selling “anticuchos” (skewered, grilled meat) and home-maD. food on weekends at whatever markets occurred in Yauris because she had to earn money to pay for her university studies because the little economic help she got from her mother and step-father wasn’t enough.

She was about to graduate when she became pregnant and when the father of her child found out he abandoned her in her fourth month of pregnancy because he already had another family.  Her mother helped her pay the costs associated with the delivery.  Today, her daughter is the motivating force behind everything Sandra does.

Once her daughter was born she was able to finish her studies in Education and she took a 6-month position.  When that contract ended she started to look for another position that was commensurate with her studies but, because she lacked experience, found no available vacancies.  Due to her daughter’s needs she had to work at several jobs in a variety of shifts.  She is now working as a street vendor selling juices and has been doing well. Her wish is to set up a juice bar.

(In the photo, Sandra is in the center of the group wearing a black and white sweatshirt).

The loan will be to rent a stand to sell fruit juices.

loans.use: To rent a stand to sell fruit juices.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Susana is one of the members of the Group Dios es mi pastor 1, 2 & 3 (God is My Shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. This city, like many others in the Dominican Republic, has a shortage of drinking water and electricity and is populated by Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. Susana sells miscellaneous products in her business, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, accessories, etc. With this new loan, she is planning to invest in more of these products since there is a lot of demand for her items at this time of the year.

Susana is very excited to receive her sixth loan from Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loans, having thus taken a step towards expanding her business. She tells us that her challenge is to work hard in order to turn her business into a successful store. She enjoys being at home with her long-term partner and 5 children. She is planning to reinvest her profits in the business, since there will be a lot of demand for her products. Her dream is to see all her children become professionals and good people.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, accessories, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Virgen Del Paso Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Elena Benítez quien vive en Itape. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Rurales nombrando al Comité Virgen del Paso.
 
Las integrantes del comité se dedican a la Artesanía, que es un trabajo que heredaron de sus padres y va pasando de generación en generación.

Confeccionando hermosas prendas de vestir como ser: camisas, manteles, en aopoi, también las integrantes se dedican al comercio, compostura de calzados, empleada domestica.

Con la ayuda que le ofreció la Fundación Paraguaya, este comité logro mejorar sus ingresos y  también mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

A la misma actividad que se dedica la señora Elena presidenta del grupo, de esta forma ella trabaja y vende su artesanía, obteniendo así el ingreso que ayuda a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de los accesorios que utiliza en la elaboración de sus artesanías como telas hilos entre otros.
texts.en:
This Committee was formed thanks to Elena Benítez Fernández who lives in the city of Itape.  They were very happy to make up the “Comité de Mujeres Rurales,” or Committee of Rural Women, and named it the “Comite Virgen del Paso,” or the Committee of the Virgen of the Pass.

The members of the committee work as artisans, which is a profession that they inherited from their parents and which is passed down from generation to generation.

They make beautiful items of clothing like shirts and blankets in Ao Po’i (a word in the Guarani language meaning finely woven which refers to embroidery and weaving).  The members also work selling, making shoes, and as domestic workers.

With the help offered by the Fundación Paraguaya, this committee was able to improve its income and also better their quality of life.  

Elena, the president of the group, works in the same activity described above.  She is an artisan and sells her crafts to bring in income that helps her family. She is requesting the loan to buy the materials that she uses to make her artisanal products, like fabrics and threads among other things.

loans.use: Purchase of materials used to make artisanal crafts, for example: threads among other things.

loans.name: Fresas Group

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús, vive en  Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Juvenal Sánchez Sánchez, en donde procreo cuatro hojas y son: Fabiola de Jesús de nueve años, la otra es Fátima Selene, Sandi Gabriela y Sindi Daniela  ambas de cuatro años.
           Ella se dedica a su hogar y a la elaboración de tamales desde hace dos años y comenta que le va bien ya que con eso ha estado obteniendo ingresos en su hogar y familia.
         Se inspiro en esta actividad para sacar adelante a sus familia tenía que tener una actividad  donde le diera resultados, así apoyar a su esposo con los gastos que se dan del diario en el hogar.
       Con las ganancia que va obteniendo compra ingredientes para que, con ello trabaje más días a la semana y con ello  su negocio se baya incrementado día a día.
      Su sueño es que logre obtener ahorros para que apoye a sus hijas en su educación y pueda darle lo mas necesario a cada una de ellas, así sean personas de futuro y logren sostenerse cuando ya tenga una profesión.
      Se integro al grupo ya que la señora Vitalina la invito a ser parte del programa, así con ello apoyarse y comprar ingredientes para su actividad, se animo y solicitaron el  préstamo. El grupo se llama las fresas la razón del nombre es porque en la región se cosechan fresas.
      Las personas que conforman el grupo son tres y son las siguientes:
         Vitalina Pérez P.: ella se dedica a vender productos agrícolas que sedan en la región como son: calabaza, aguacate, frijol, pinol, entre otros.
     Isabel M. García: ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales.
   Teresa de Jesús Pérez Pérez: invierte el  préstamo en la compra de ingredientes como son: carne, chile ancho, tomate, entre otros para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús lives in Coapilla, Chiapas, México.  She is married to Mr. Juvenal Sánchez Sánchez which whom she had four children: Fabiola de Jesús, 9, Fátima Selene, Sandi Gabriela and Sindi Daniela , both four.

She is a housewife and for the last two years has been making tamales.  She comments that she’s done well in that it has produced income for her home and family.

She was inspired to go into this activity to move her family ahead; she needed to have an activity that would produce results in order to help her husband meet daily household expenses.

With profits obtained she buys ingredients so that she can work more days of the week so that her business can grow day by day.

Her dream is to have savings available to pay for her daughters’ education so that she can provide each one of them with everything they need so that they will have a future and be able to support themselves when they have a profession.

She joined the group when Vitalina invited her to be part of the program so that she could help herself and buy ingredients for her activity.  She decided to join and they asked for the loan.  The group is called Strawberries because strawberries are grown in the region.

The three members of the group are:

Vitalina Pérez P.: she sells agricultural products common to the region like squash, avocado, beans, and corn flour, among others.

Isabel M. García: will use the loan to buy ingredients to make tamales.

Teresa de Jesús Pérez Pérez: will use the loan to buy ingredients like meat, chile ancho, tomatoes, among others to make tamales.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Yolene is one of the members of the Group Dios es mi pastor 4 & 5 (God is my shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. This city, like many others in the Dominican Republic, has a shortage of drinking water and electricity and is populated by Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. Yolene sells clothes, such as blue jean, skirts, shirts, shoes, and t-shirts. With this new loan, she is planning to invest in clothing.

Yolene is very excited to receive her fifth loan from Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and thus having taken a step towards expanding her business. Her challenges are raising and educating her four children. She lives with them and her long-term partner. She is planning to reinvest her profits in her business, since there will be a lot of demand for her products. Yolene's dream is to improve business.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es:
Martha, tiene una carnicería en donde vende embutidos, carne de vaga, pollos etc. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  

Con su ex esposo ella comenzó a trabajar desde joven pero desde que se separaron ella se quedo con el negocio y lo comenzó administrar. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 14h00pm y después de atender a sus hijos y comer desde las 15h00pm hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. Vende carnes, embutidos, pollos listos para cocinar.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, embutidos para tener más variedad en sus ventas. En el futuro quiere comprar maquinas para hacer más rápido las ventas.
texts.en:
Martha has a butcher's shop, where she sells sausages, beef, chickens, etc. She lives in a zone called Paraíso de la Flor, on the outskirts of the city, in an area characterized by its mountains and dirt roads.

With her ex-husband, she started work when she was young, but since they separated she has kept the business on and taken over running it. Now she works from 8am till 2pm, and then, after seeing her children and having something to eat, from 3pm till 6pm. She sells meat, sausages and ready-to-cook chickens.

With the loan she wants to buy meat and sausages so she has more variety in what she sells. In the future she wants to buy cash registers to process sales faster.

loans.use: Meat and sausages

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of Dorcas Group

texts.en:
The Women’s Bank of Dorcas is a group comprised of 7 women members who live in Paso Canoas, Puntarenas. Each individual member is involved in a commercial activity such as sewing or various types of sales (shoes, clothing, jewelry, livestock and catalogue items). Each woman will use this loan to make general investments in their productive activity. For example, to purchase chickens, animal feed, or various merchandise for sale. As the Christmas season is upon us, many Costa Ricans will be making gift purchases this month. This represents an opportunity for these women to increase their revenues.  

Maria Ofelia, the elected president of this group, is a 63-year-old mother of 8 who lives by herself in Paso Canoas. Maria has a sewing business. She produces bedding such as sheets, blankets and pillow covers. She sews during the daytime and at night she prepares the projects she plans to work on for the next day. 

The community of Paso Canoas is plagued by poverty, partially due to a serious lack of job opportunities. Maria’s goal is to create a better living situation for herself, her fellow group members, as well as strive to provide employment opportunities in the community at large. Her main obstacle has been a lack of access to working capital. This loan will help to address this issue. 

The members of The Women’s Bank of Dorcas know each other from living in the same community and from meetings at the local church. Maria says the main benefit of receiving a loan from Fundacion Mujer is the low interest rate that will be charged, as compared to other financial institutions. The name of this group is symbolic of a hardworking woman that the members learned of in the bible.

loans.use: For the purchase of various merchandise for sale such as shoes, clothing, livestock and jewelry

loans.name: Marifer Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama MARIFER, lo tomaron porque les gusta ese nombre. Está ubicado en la comunidad de San Cristobal Huichochitlan, en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. Felicitas M. es una integrantes del grupo. Tiene 33 años, estudió unicamente la  primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos; 1 mujer  y 2 varones.  Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para surtirse de fruta y verduras para poder poner un puesto en el tianguis. Sus clientes se expresan bien de la señora ya que les muy amable y tiene lo que sus clientas le solicitan.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta e ilusionada ya que podrá crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.   Quiere este crédito para poder darse a conocer en otras comunidades pero necesita tener gran cantidad de surtido para poder realizar las ventas fuera de su comunidad, en el tianguis.   También espera poder seguirle dando estudio a sus hijos ya que son los que la motivan a seguir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called MARIFER.  They chose the name because it is one they like.  The group is located in San Cristobal Huichochitlan community in the State of Mexico and has 9 members.  One of these members is Felicitas M..  She is 33 years old and has only an elementary-level education.  She is a saleswoman and has 3 children: 1 girl and 2 boys.

Felicitas sells fruit and vegetables, a business which she started 5 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to stock her business with fruit and vegetables so that she can set up a stall in the open-air market.  Her customers speak well of her because she is very kind and has everything that her they ask for.

As she requests this loan, Felicitas feels very happy and enthusiastic as she will be able to grow her business and increase her sales.  She would like this loan so that she can become known in other communities but she needs to have a large quantity of goods in stock if she wants to sell outside her own community in the open-air market.  She would also like to continue providing her children with an education as they are her motivation to continue working.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and set up a stall in the open-air market

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es:
Thelma Leonor Aguilera es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora desde hace cinco años inicio vendiendo cosméticos Avon, marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catalogo actualmente comercializa ropa usada en la que invertirá su crédito.  Ella tiene seis hijos de 24, 22, 21, 18, 15 y 14 años la menor.
Ella ha trabajado arduamente para que sus hijos tenga una mejor calidad de vida, estudien y se preparen.
texts.en:
Thelma Leonor Aguilera is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who has sold Avon cosmetics, a brand known for catalogue sales, for the last five years.  

She is currently selling used clothes that she will use the loan for.  She has six children who are 24, 22, 21, 18, 15 and 14 years of ages.

She has worked hard so that her children can have a better quality of life, go to school and prepare themselves.

loans.use: For cosmetics.

loans.name: Gladys Maribel

texts.es:
Gladys de 31 años, confecciona y cose ropa por pedido. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.

Hace 4 años atrás trabajaba en un taller de costura pero como se quería independizar porque le pagaban muy poco, comenzó a reunir dinero para comprar sus propias maquinas de costura. Ahora trabaja con su hermana desde las 09h00 hasta las 18h00pm. Ella trabaja con sus clientes por pedidos si son confecciones o enmendaduras. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hilos y telas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una lista de clientes fijo y hacer más grande su taller.
texts.en:
Gladys, age 31, makes clothes to order.  She lives in an urban area called Guasmo.  Most of its inhabitants are merchants.

Four years ago she worked in a seamstress shop.  However, she wanted to become independent because they paid her very little.  She started to get money together to buy her own sewing machines.  She now works with her sister from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She works with her customers on orders making clothes or mending clothes.

She wants to use this loan to buy thread and fabric for her business.  In the future she wants to have a list of fixed customers and to make her shop bigger.

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johana del Carmen Pavón de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien vende calzado hace siete años la cual inicio con unos ahorros y ha continuado por medio de los préstamos. Ella con el crédito comprará calzado ya que en esta época por las fiestas navideña, los quince años, bodas, bautizos, promociones la población compra más. 
Pavón junto con su compañero de vida cría a sus cuatro hijos de 13, 12. 6 y 3 años por los cuales trabajan arduamente.
texts.en:
Johana del Carmen Pavón, 31, is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who has sold footwear for the last 7 years.  She started the business with some savings and has continued it using loans.

She will use the loan to buy footwear because during this Christmas, fifteen-year birthday parties, weddings, baptisms and school graduations season people buy more.

Pavón and her spouse are raising four children who are 13, 12, 6 and 3 years of age and for whom they work arduously.

loans.use: For footwear.

loans.name: Daniela Lucia

texts.es:
Daniela Lucia V. Rodríguez de 18 años tiene un café  en la entrada los Vanegas km 12 ½ carretera Masaya donde vende comida, refrescos, gaseosa, chiverías etc. desde hace un año. Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería para su negocio y surtirlo. 
El sueño de esta joven es hacer más grande su negocio es por ello que está iniciando a prestar.
texts.en:
Daniela Lucia V. Rodríguez, 18, has a café at the entrance to Los Vanegas at the 12-1/2 kilometer marker along the Masaya highway where she has been selling  food, beverages, soft drinks, snacks, etc. for the last year.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.

Her dream is to enlarge her business and this is why she's starting to borrow.

loans.use: For basic grains, fruit, soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria Esperanza se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que ha sido de mucha ayuda. Su negocio inicio aproximadamente hace unos 7 años con el apoyo de una tía e inicio con la venta de ropa interior y de niño. Pues siempre ha demostrado ser una madre muy abnegada y que se preocupa por su familia. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de materia prima necesaria como   ropa, calzado y cosméticos, ya que es una mujer muy responsable.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza sells general merchandise.  This is not the first time that she has requested loans; they have been a big help.

She started her business approximately seven years ago with help from an aunt.  She started selling underwear and children’s clothes.  She has always demonstrated herself to be a very self-sacrificing mother who looks after her family.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy the items that she needs like clothes, footwear, and cosmetics.  She is a very responsible woman.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marino

texts.en:
Marino is married and has two children.  They make their home in Hato Mayor in a simple structure. He says that his most difficult challenges are to buy his house and provide for his family's household needs.  Marino enjoys preaching.

Marino is excited to be receiving his eighth loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and expanded his business of iron and metal recycling. He has had his business for five years, starting it with some savings he had. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying iron and metal pieces to resell to industries. He will use the profits to reinvest in his business and increase his capital. 

Marino began with Esperanza because he needed capital for his business. His story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). His group is located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity .

loans.use: To buy Iron and metal pieces

loans.name: Jimi Emmanuel

texts.es: Jimi Emmanuel V. es un señor trabajador, esforzado y emprendedor de 24 años quien vende repuestos de moto desde hace un año con el fin de sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles todo lo posible a sus dos hijos de 2 años y 11 meses. El invertirá el crédito en el negocio con la compra de materia prima como cascos, aceites, etc.
texts.en:
Jimi Emmanuel V. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising, 24 year old man who has sold motorcycle spare parts for the last year in order to support his family and provide his two children, who are 2 years and 11 months old respectively, with everything possible.

He will use the loan to invest in the business buying raw materials like helmets, lubricants, etc.

loans.use: For spare parts.

loans.name: Leonardo José

texts.es:
Leonardo José M. U. es un señor trabajador, esforzado y emprendedor de 49 años quien tiene el servicio de transporte para materiales de construcción desde hace 10 años. El con el crédito compra llantas para su camión. 
M. tiene la meta de adquirir otro camión para aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonardo José M. U. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising, 49 year old man who has had a construction materials and supplies hauling service for 10 years.  He will use the loan to buy tires for his truck.

His goal is to buy another truck to increase his business.

loans.use: For truck tires.

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es: Diana Luz tiene 58 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte colectivo. Hace más de 36 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio con su esposo que anteriormente el brindaba el servicio como transportista y con el esfuerzo de ella fue que compro el vehículo ya que con ciertos ahorros que tenia logro comprarlo para empezar este medio de vida. Tiene 3 hijos pero todos trabajan de manera independiente. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de  llantas y ciertas reparaciones para su vehículo.
texts.en:
Diana Luz is 58 years old, and she provides public transportation service.  She has had this business for over 36 years.  She started with her husband.  He previously provided transportation service.  Through her effort she bought the vehicle.  With some savings that she had, she managed to buy it in order to start this way of life.

She has three children, but they all work in an independent manner.  The reason for the loan is to buy tires and for some repairs on her vehicle.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the compressor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials like: broom sticks, bristles, wool, wire and plastic screw-on caps.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es: Aida Luz tiene 34 años, su actividad es una abarrotería desde hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. Es una mujer muy responsable ya que es siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Sus inicios empiezan por su familia pues fueron ellos quienes empezaron este medio de vida a pesar de las dificultades que enfrento como son problemas de salud, ya que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para atender a sus diferentes clientes que siempre asisten a su negocio. El motivo de financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Aida Luz, 34, has been a grocer for over 10 years.  She is a very responsible woman who has always enjoyed working.

She started out thanks to her family because it was they who began the business despite difficulties faced like her health problems.  She has to get up very early to start attending to her customers who visit the store.

The reason for the loan request is to buy basic grains and detergents among others.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao tiene 42 años de edad, reside en Yoloaiquin departamento de Morazán, vende productos lácteos, él vive con su familia su esposa María Andrea y una nieta de 9 años de edad.
Este negocio consiste en la venta de productos lácteos como cuajada, crema, leche, para la preparación de estos productos el compra la leche por mayor a los ganaderos de la zona y realiza el proceso para la obtención de los productos finales, tiene ya tres años de dedicarse al negocio.
Actualmente enfrenta un  problema de liquidez por lo que ha visto difícil la compra de leche por los que solicita un préstamo para poder solventar esta situación y volver nuevamente a procesar sus productos e incrementar su cantidad.
Él sueña con algún día tener los suficientes ahorros para construir su propia casa y llevar a su familia para tener una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
42-year old Estanislao lives in Yoloaiquin in Morazán Department. He sells milk products. He lives with his wife María Andrea and a 9-year old granddaughter.

He sells milk products such as cuajada (cheese curd), cream, and milk.  To make these products he buys milk wholesale from local dairy farmers. He’s been running this business for the past three years.

At the moment his biggest problem is lack of liquidity to buy milk. For this reason he is seeking a loan to address the situation, return once again to making the products, and increase the amount he produces.

Estanislao’s dream is to have enough money to build a house of his own and provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Elizabeth Ene Kipa

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been rearing animals for resale in Naivasha town for the last five years. She is 37 years old, married to Topoika S., and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy 10 sheep, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Elizabeth hopes to grow her business so that she may comfortably take all her children to school.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Soleado Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama NUEVO AMANECER SOLEADO. Porque se imaginan amanecer siempre con dinero y visualizan un día excelente. Está ubicado en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes. La Sra. Roció Salas Solís, es una integrante  del grupo  quien tiene 29 años. Tiene una hija de  7 años. Se dedica a vender productos de madera, ropa y artículos de papel. Solicita su préstamo para invertir en su negocio y poder adquirir materias primas, ya que se acerca la época navideña. Ella trabaja en su casa. Siempre se le ha conocido como una persona muy trabajadora a su corta edad.
texts.en:
The name of the group is “Nuevo Amanecer Soleado” (Sunny New Dawn).  It got its name because they always imagine waking up with money, and they visualize an excellent day.  The group is located in the state of México, and it is comprised of 11 members.

Roció Salas Solís, age 29, is a member of the group.  She has a seven year old daughter.  She sells wood products, clothes, and paper items.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her business to be able to get basic materials for the coming Christmas season.  She works in her house.  She has always been known to be a very hard-working young person.

loans.use: To buy basic materials

loans.name: Alfarero Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfarero lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Irene T. de 39 Años quien se dedica a la venta de prendas, perfumes y cosméticos Avon además de realizar bisutería desde hace cinco años.  Ella con el crédito compra los encargos que tiene para diciembre los cuales son muchos.
Las otras integrantes son Fabiola B. quien vende esquimo y cerveza desde hace 5 años y Heydi R. comercializa ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The Alfarero group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is 39-year old Irene T. who sells underwear, perfume, and Avon cosmetics. For the past five years she has also made costume jewelry. Irene plans to use the loan to buy the items she needs to fill her December orders, of which there are many.

The other members of the group are Fabiola B. who has been selling Eskimo milk products and beer for five years, and Heydi R. who sells clothing and footwear.

loans.use: to buy underwear, perfume, cosmetics

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.es:
Doña Perfecta, es una señora D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la venta D. antojitos como tamales, plátano frito, café, leche; es madre soltera vive con sus cuatro hijos y un nieto, tiene casa propia y algunos D. sus hijos ya son independientes.
Doña Perfecta se dedica a la venta desD. hace más D. 10 años, tiene un local frente a la terminal D. buses y su horario D. atención es D. 5:00am a 3:00pm, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia y actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en leña, maíz y demás insumos para su negocio, con esta compra ayudara a realizar una buena inversión y crecimiento al negocio, también tendrá la oportunidad D. recibir ganancias.
Seguir trabajando es su principal sueño, ser buen cliente para tener acceso a préstamos que le ayuden a crecer y a mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Perfecta, 57, is a woman living in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.  She sells fast food like tamales, fried plantain, coffee and milk.  She’s a single mother and lives with her four children and one grandchild.  He owns her house and some of her children are already independent.

She has been in sales for over 10 years.  She has a locale in front of the bus terminal and her hours of operation are from 5am until 3pm.  The business started on her own initiative and she is currently requesting funds to buy firewood, maize and other ingredients for her business.  This purchase will help her make a good investment and expand her business; she will also have the opportunity for higher profits.

Her main dream is to stay in business and to be a good client so that she can have access to subsequent loans that will help her grow and improve her economic situation.

loans.use: To buy maize and firewood.

loans.name: Janet Ndinda

texts.en:
Janet Ndinda, aged 36 years, is a single mother of two children, Banice, aged 15 years in grade 4, and Njeri, aged 8 months. She has a boutique at Mlolongo market, which is a very busy market. She sells clothes to Mlolongo residents. She was introduced to KADET by her friends.

Janet has been running her boutique for a period of three years, and her monthly profit is Kshs 4,000. This loan of Kshs 40,000 is Janet's second loan with KADET. The first loan was paid well and in time. She plans to use Kshs 20,000 to increase her stocks of clothes for resale and Kshs 20,000 to open another boutique. If the loan boosts the business, Janet will buy food and clothing for her children, which has been a challenge in her life. She will also pay school fees for her daughter.

Janet describes herself as bright and enterprising. She dreams of building her own business premises and her own home.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothes and open another boutique.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 43 años, tiene un ciber en donde la hora de internet la da a $ 0.60. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.

Inicio su negocio hace años para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares a su esposo ya que él es guardia de seguridad. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am dando el servicio de internet y vendiendo snack. La hora de internet la cobra a $ 0.60 y las impresiones a color y blanco y negro según sea la tinta. Con el préstamo quiere comprar computadoras para hacer más grande el negocio. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
