Ana, 43, has a cyber café where she charges $0.60 an hour for Internet access.  She lives in an urban area called Guasmo that is notable because most of its residents are merchants.

She started the business a few years ago in order to help her husband meet household expenses since he’s a security guard.  She starts work at 8am providing Internet access and selling snacks.  An hour of Internet access costs $0.60 and black and white and color copies are charged according to the type of ink used.  She wants to use the loan to buy computers to enlarge the business.  In the future she wants to build her house better.

loans.use: For computers.

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es:
Gilberto, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán., tiene 32 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposa, y sus dos hijos Melvin de 11 años, y Daniela de 7 años de edad, su negocio ofrece a los clientes azúcar, arroz, frijoles, lo tiene en su propia casa donde los vecinos y personas que viven cercanos a la zona son sus cliente.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta básica que son jabón, aceite, detergentes, granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar. Con esta ayuda el inventario de su negocio estará fortalecido para atender a la demanda por parte de los clientes.
Gilberto sueña con tener los ingresos suficientes para atender las necesidades del hogar y ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Gilberto lives in San Carlos, in Morazán department.  He is 32 years old and sells convenience store items.  He lives with his wife and two children: 11 year-old Melvin and 7 year-old Daniela.  Through his business he offers his customers sugar, rice and beans.  His business is located in his own home and his customers are his neighbors and people who live nearby.

Gilberto is requesting a loan to buy basic products such as soap, oil, detergents, basic grains such as rice, beans and sugar.  With this help, he will strengthen his business inventory so that he can meet his customers' demands.

Gilberto dreams of having enough income to cover his household needs and help his children with their education.

loans.use: To buy soap, oil, detergents, rice, beans and sugar

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra anteriormente ya trabajo con la institución en otra agencia, la actividad a la que se dedica es la de dictar cursos de manualidades a personas mayores y a niños, ella les imparte diferente técnicas de pintura, muñecos en goma Eva, tarjetería y tiene muchos alumnos.  Las clases las dicta en su domicilio.  La señora vive en Bajo Llojeta,  ella vive en la casa de su mama con sus dos hijos pequeños.  La cliente invertirá en la compra de material para impartir sus clases,  comprara por cantidad goma Eva, plasto formó, cartulinas, pinturas y pinceles lo cual le servirá para que sus alumnas aprendan y practiquen con ella, ella es muy conocida por su habilidad en la elaboración de trabajos manuales, esta agradecida con la institución  por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sandra used to work with another branch of our institution.  Her business activity is providing craft courses for elderly people and children.  She teaches different painting techniques, how to make dolls from foam rubber and card making.  She has a lot of students and gives the classes in her home.  She lives in Bajo Llojeta, in her mom's house, with her two small children.

Sandra will invest this loan in buying the material she needs to give her classes.  She will buy foam rubber, polystyrene, card, paints and paintbrushes in bulk.  She will use these supplies so that her pupils can learn and practice with her.  She is very well known for her skill in making crafts.  She is grateful to our institution for the support we have provided.

loans.use: To buy material wholesale

loans.name: Buena Fe 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yusleny is the coordinator of her group Buena Fe 1 & 2 (good Faith). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenges are selling her products on credit and collecting.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying doing business.

Yusleny is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 4 years, beginning with a small sum her husband gave her to start up the business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to purchase household and cosmetic products. She will use the profits to invest in the her business and some for her family expenses.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because "I feel great being part of this program and with the unit in my neighborhood," she said. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding L. Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity that can't be counted on.

loans.use: to buy household and cosmetic products

loans.name: Gerardo Jose

texts.es: Gerardo José tiene 30 años, vive en casa propia, está casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Gerardo  emprendió su actividad como es ofrecer el servicio de gimnasio hace más de 2 años cuando pudo adquirir ciertas maquinas que le es de mucha utilidad, además que él es el propietario la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes, adultos y ciertas personas vecinas publico en general, cuentan con clientela formada. Gerardo es un señor muy sacrificado quien se esfuerza diariamente para brindarle lo mejor a su familia y buena educación a sus hijos para adquirir una profesión universitaria. Necesita el crédito para la compra de pesas, maquinas, entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Gerardo José is a 30-year-old man who lives in his own house with his wife and 2 under age children. Gerardo owns a gym, and he has been in business for over 2 years. He has been able to obtain workout equipment that has been very useful for him. The majority of his customers are young people, adults, and some neighbors. He has a solid clientele. Gerardo is a very hard-working person who strives to give his family the best and provide his children with a good education so that they can one day obtain a college degree. He needs this loan in order to purchase weights, fitness machines, and other things for his gym.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es: Liliana Díaz V.  de 44 años es una mujer emprendedora que inició su experiencia de negocio desde el año 2005, cuando compraba colonias, talcos, cremas y champoo mediante guías especializadas de productos, posteriormente con sus utilidades logró comprar un enfriador e inició la venta de bebidas   los fines de semanas en la puerta de su casa y ese es ahora su principal negocio. Las cajas de cervezas le salen a $33.600 COP y obtiene una utilidad de $11.800 COP por cajas, vende 20 cajas semanales,   como también vende   mercancía a crédito tiene unas cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 19 días, mientras sus mercancías lo hacen  cada 30, obteniendo una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 25% y una liquidez de 2.8% y una capacidad de pago de un 35 % incluyendo el crédito.  Desde que inició su vinculación a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo su negocio ha mejorado porque tiene efectivo disponible para comprar de contado y con descuentos, igualmente ha podio agregar productos a su canasta de ofertas por lo cual sus clientes la prefieren.  Liliana es casada y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 14 a 22 años y con su cónyuge han logrado sacarlos adelante, así como  su negocio ha sido un gran respaldo para este fin.  Su sueño ahora se encamina a comprar una casa y ampliar su patrimonio, porque espera tener un techo propio que ofrecerle a su familia. Con su credikiva comprará bebidas por cajas y refrescos pues se acerca la temporada de  fiestas como grados, cierres de año, navidad que hacen que sus ventas se incrementen especialmente en lo relacionado con estos productos.
texts.en:
Liliana Díaz V. is 44 years old.  She is an enterprising woman who started her business experience in 2005 when she bought aftershaves, talcum powder, creams and shampoo through specialist product guides.  With her profits she managed to buy a refrigerator and started selling drinks on weekends from the doorway of her home.  This is now her main business.

Boxes of beer cost 33,600 Colombian pesos and she makes 11,800 pesos profit per box.  She sells 20 boxes a week.  She also sells merchandise on credit.  Her accounts receivable turnover is 19 days whilst her merchandise turnover is 30 days.  Her profitability on sales is 25%, her liquidity is 2.8% and her payment capacity is 35%, including the loan.

Since she joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Liliana's business has improved because she has had cash available so that she can make her purchases in cash and thereby obtain a discount.  She has also been able to add products to her basket of offers which has made her loyal customers.  Liliana is married and has 3 children aged 14 to 22 and, together with her husband, she has managed to get them ahead in life.  Her business has been a great support in achieving this goal.  Her dream now is to buy a house and expand her estate because she hopes to have her own home to offer to her family.

Liliana will use her Kiva loan to buy boxes of drink and soft drinks since the party season is approaching with graduations, end-of-year parties and Christmas.  This season sees her sales increase, especially as far as these products are concerned.

loans.use: To buy boxes of drink and soft drinks as party season is approaching with graduations, end-of-year celebrations and Christmas.  This is a season which sees her sales increase

loans.name: Maudo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Maudo tiene 53 años de edad, trabaja en un taller de tráiler él es soldador y mecánico particular, vive en El Divisadero departamento de Morazán con su familia, su esposa Cecibel, su hijo Juan Antonio de 17 años de edad, don Maudo trabaja de lunes a sábado como mecánico soldador en el taller donde él es empleado, los fines de semana realiza trabajos particulares.
Actualmente tiene la necesidad de comprar herramientas de trabajo, soldadores y taladros. Por lo que solicita un préstamo para disponer de fondos y realizar la compra, con esta inversión su trabajo particular se verá beneficiado ya que tendrá a su alcance lo necesario para brindar un buen servicio.
La visión de don Maudo es que a través del taller pueda mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y apoyar a su hijo en los estudios.
texts.en:
Maudo is 53 years old.  He works in a trailer workshop as a private welder and mechanic and lives in El Divisadero, in Morazán department with his family; his wife Cecibel and his son, 17 year-old Juan Antonio.

Maudo works from Monday to Saturday as a mechanic and welder in the workshop where he is an employee.  On weekends, he does private work.  He currently needs to buy tools for his work (soldering irons and drills).  He is requesting a loan so that he has the necessary funds to make his purchases.  This investment will benefit his private work since he will have to hand everything he needs to provide a good service. Maudo's dream is to be able to improve the financial situation of his family and support his son in his studies through his work in the workshop.

loans.use: To buy soldering irons and drills

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos José tiene 26 años, su actividad es la venta de tortillas, pinol, carnes entre otros. Cuando inicio fue por la falta de empleo ya que no tenía un trabajo estable que le proporcionara ingresos necesarios para su esposa y su hijo que están a su cargo. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable y trabajador. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de tortillas, tamales y pinolillo. Su negocio le exige salir todos los días para ofrecer los diferentes productos.
texts.en: Carlos José is a 26-year-old who sells tortillas, pinol (flour made from toasted maiz), meats, and other goods. He started his business because he did not have a stable job that would provide him with the income necessary to support his wife and son. He has always been known for being a very responsible and hard-working person. This loan will be used to purchase tortillas, tamales, and pinolillo (cornstarch). His business requires him to go out and sell his different products every day.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luz Del Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz del Sol está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras quienes son Heylen E., Meyling Solís, Brenda T. y Melania O.. La coordinadora del grupo es la joven E. de 22 años quien se dedica al comercio de prenda de plata y ropa desde hace dos años con el firme propósito de salir adelante.
Las otras integrantes son S. de 30 años comerciante de ropa usada y nueva, T. vende ropa y calzado y O. tiene una carnicería además vende ropa por encargo.
texts.en:
The Luz del Sol (Light of the Sun) group is composed of four hard working women:  Heylen E., Meyling Solís, Brenda T. & Melania O..

The group Coordinator is Miss E., 22, who has been selling silver jewelry items and clothing for two years with the firm goal to get ahead.

The other members of the group are Miss Solís, 30 who is a new and used clothing merchant and Miss T. who has a butcher shop but also sells clothes on order.

loans.use: For silver jewelry articles and clothing.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Juana de 54 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, es comerciante de mercería y cosméticos, ella vive sola ya que sus hijos ya formaron sus respectivas familias, desde hace 20 años se dedica al comercio de adornos, cosméticos y ropa, ella proviene de una familia laboriosa ya que tanto sus padres como sus hermanos son comerciantes, trabaja todo el día toda la semana.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio específicamente en mercería, con el apoyo de este préstamo diversificara su mercadería y así ofrecer mejores productos a los clientes. Su principal propósito es seguir trabajando en el comercio, poder ofrecer mejores productos de calidad para los clientes y así tener mejore sus utilidades para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana, 54, lives in Corinto, Morazán department.  She is a general merchandise and cosmetics merchant.  She lives alone because her children have formed their own families.  For 20 years she has sold decorations, cosmetics and clothes.  She comes from a very hard working family because both her parents and siblings are merchants.  She works all day every day of the week.

She is asking for funds to invest in the business, specifically in merchandise.  Support from the loan will allow her to diversify her merchandise thus offering better products to her customers.  Her main goal is to stay in business and to be able to offer better quality products to her customers so that profits will be better thus improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es: Manuela Del Socorro, es casada con 2 hijos mayores de edad que viven de manera independiente. Ella tiene su negocio que es una pulpería en su casa de habitación, no es la primera vez que solicita créditos, por lo que ha sido muy reconfortante. Inicio con este negocio desde hace 32 años, ya que en ese tiempo ella laboraba en Plastinic una empresa de fabricación de plástico con el tiempo fue decide realizar su propio negocio. Siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una manera muy humilde.  El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en: Manuela Del Socorro is a married woman with 2 grown children. She runs a general store from home. This is not the first time that she requests a loan, which is comforting. She started this business 32 years ago when she used to work at Plastinic, a plastic factory. As time progressed, she decided to start her own business. She has always liked to work and earn a living in a humble manner. This loan will be used to purchase candy, soft drinks, bread, detergent, and staple grains.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gissela

texts.es: Gissela, de 33 años, comparte su vida con Edu, de 35 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que crían y educan en unión familiar en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Hace 11 años que se dedica a la compra y venta de papa, en un puesto que alquiló en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Todos los días desde las primeras horas comercializa un promedio de 40 sacos diarios como mínimo, los cuales vende a 45 nuevos soles cada uno. El trabajo que realiza es muy sacrificado y a la vez gratificante, pues lo que más le gusta a Gissela es negociar la venta de las diferentes variedades y clases de papa, y al terminar el día se siente agotada por el trajín diario. Ahora ella quiere ampliar su negocio con la compra de un camión para poder trasladar los sacos de papa; de los terrenos agrícolas a la ciudad con mayor rapidez. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y se siente dichosa de pertenecer a un banco comunal, donde le enseñan a ahorrar y pensar en el futuro. Es por ello que el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de 300 sacos de papa, que comercializará.
texts.en: Gissela is a 33-year-old woman whose life partner is 35-year-old Edu. They have 4 children together, and they raise and educate them in a rented house located in the city of Tarma. She has been buying and selling potatoes for the last 11 years in a stand that she rents at the wholesale market in her city. Every day from the early morning, she sells an average of 40 sacks of potatoes at 45 PEN each. Her job is both arduous and gratifying. What Gissela likes most is negotiating deals on the different varieties of potatoes that she sells. At the end of the day, she feels exhausted from her hectic day. She now wishes to expand her business by purchasing a truck to be able to transport her sacks of potatoes from the crop fields to the city even faster. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she feels proud of being a part of a communal bank in which she learns how to save money and plan for the future. For this reason, she will invest this loan in purchasing 300 sacks of potatoes, which she will sell.

loans.use: Purchase 300 sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Justino

texts.es: El señor Justino tiene un taller de costura, desde hace seis años y medio realiza todo tipo de prendas de vestir, trabaja junto con su esposa tienen casa propia, tienen tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando, este crédito es para la compra de tela, tiene un pedido para hacer poleras para una institución.  Esta en su segundo ciclo en la institución, ha demostrado ser responsable con su crédito anterior, pagando puntualmente sus cuotas,con el dinero del credito comprara tela para realizar poleras es una persona muy amable y muy trabajador, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Justino has a sewing shop where for the last six and a half years he has been making all kinds of clothing. He works with his wife, and they own their own home and have three children in school. 

This loan is for the purchase of fabric. Justino has an order to make shirts for an institution. With the money from this loan he will buy the fabric that he needs to make them. Justino is in his second loan cycle with Emprender [the Kiva field partner] and he has shown himself to be a responsible borrower, making all his payments as indicated. He is very friendly and hard-working, and is thankful for the support that Kiva and Emprender have given him.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Resolucion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Resolución está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Jesenia Raquel R. de 31 años quien vende ropa desde hace cuatro años el cual por su ardua labor, los prestamos e iniciativa ha ido creciendo. Ella con el crédito comprara mercadería como camisas, pantalones, vestidos, trajes, jeans, faldas…etc. 
R. tiene dos hijos de 14 y 12 años quienes en su tiempo libre le ayudan en el negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Marlene S. Granada quien vende ropa y sandalias desde hace 5 años y Jasmina del Socorro C. comerciante de ropa.
texts.en:
The Resolución [Resolution] loan group is made up of three hard-working, dedicated and enterprising women. One of them is Yesenia Raquel R., who is 31 years old. She has worked selling clothes for the last four years, and because of her hard work and initiative, as well as the loans she's taken out, her business has grown. With this loan she will buy more merchandise, such as shirts, pants, dresses, suits, jeans, skirts, etc. Yesenia has two children who are 12 and 14 years old. They help her out in their spare time. 

The other members of the group are Marlene S. Granada, who has been selling clothing and sandals for five years, and Jazmina del Socorro, who also sells clothing.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs to sell

loans.name: William De Los Reyes

texts.es: El señor William tiene 38 años. El se dedica a la venta de medicamentos. Cabe señalarse, sus productos los compra en Managua al por mayor para obtener mejores precios y obtener mayores ganancias. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, pues ha sido de gran ayuda, inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, buscando una fuente alternativa de ingresos para brindarle manutención a su familia. Pues con muy poco capital de trabajo ha salido adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de medicamentos.
texts.en: Mr. William is a 38-year-old man who sells medicine for a living. It should be pointed out that he purchases his products wholesale in Managua so that he can obtain the best prices and bigger profits. This is not the first time that he requests a loan, as they have been a big help. He started his own business 6 years ago in an attempt to find an alternative source of income to support his family. He has managed to get ahead with just a little capital. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase medicine.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Roca Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Roca está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas Elba Tamara S. Ortiz de 23 años se dedica al comercio de ropa y perfumes la cual inicio con 1,000 córdobas  hace tres años y poco a poco y gracias a los préstamos y su ardua labor ha ido mejorando su negocio. Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería en ropa, zapatos y perfumes para mejorar su negocio.
S. tiene un pequeño de 10 años y su sueño es tener su casa propia.
Las otras integrantes son Gloria Elena Calero quien realiza tortillas desde hace tres años y Velma B. quien tiene una pequeña venta y ropa desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The La Roca (The Rock) group is composed of three hard working women.  One of them is Elba Tamara S. Ortiz, 23.  She sells clothes and perfumes.  She started out with 1,000 córdobas three years ago and gradually, thanks to loans and her hard work, has been improving the business.

She will use the loan to buy clothes, shoes and perfumes to improve the business.

Silvia has a 10 year old son and her dream is to have her own house.

The other group members are: Gloria Elena Calero who has made tortillas for the last three years and Velma B. who has had a small sales business and clothes for the last five years.

loans.use: For clothes, shoes and perfumes.
